name: Quick Fish Release
summary: Your inventory won't close anymore after releasing a fish, allowing you to release multiple fishes faster.
author: Syzzle
description:
After playing around with fishing in the expedition I realized how painful it was to release multiple fishes with the inventory closing everytime you released one, so I made this mod for myself to use and uploading it for anyone else that also is annoyed by it, the mod basically makes it not close the inventory when you release a fish.

Before uploading I looked around and found that someone had already done this mod before, it was [url=https://next.nexusmods.com/profile/brehny/mods]brehny[/url]﻿, but their mod was outdated and still using the old method with PAKs that the game doesn't use anymore, after contacting them, they said they were out of the NMS loop and that I was allowed to upload my mod.
[size=2]They also made their own mod hidden hence why I can't link it here as credit for making it first.[/size][size=1]
[/size]

[quote][size=5][b]Installing Mods[/b][/size]
Follow these steps to install mods.

[list=1]
[*]Browse to [b]No Man's Sky\GAMEDATA[/b].
[*]Create a folder named [b]MODS[/b].
[*]Place the [b]mod folder containing the loose files into the MODS folder[/b] (they have to be in the MODS folder itself and not in any subfolder, and no loose files should be inside the MODS folder).
[*]Start the game and wait for the splash screen to disappear.
[*]If done correctly [b]the[/b] [b]game will display a[/b] [b]warning[/b] just before displaying the selection of saved games.
[/list][/quote]The warning will look like [url=https://i.imgur.com/zTEEFwI.jpeg]this[/url].

files.changelog_html: Initial Release

name: Better Base Sites
summary: Causes better base sites to be discoverable via the Secure Site planetary charts.  These will be large flat areas with a base computer in the center.
author: Bladehawke
description:
There once was a mod called Easy Base Building.  The author made it for 2.12, updated it for 2.13 and then disappeared.  He does not respond to PM's and you can't even post on his mod.  His mod has been broken since 2.14.  I made a new version of the mod using [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/mods/957]AMUMSS[/url]﻿ and Lua. If XenonSurf ever resurfaces and objects to this mod, I'll remove it. I'll eventually post a Lua again, but at present, I'm hand editing the EXML from diffs I make from my NMSMB builds.

Now that that's out of the way, this is Better Base Sites.  If you buy/trade for a Planetary Chart for a Secure Site of Interest (the top option in trading with the Cartographer), it now has a chance of locating a Habitable (or Planetary) Base.  This base site is a large flat area with a base computer installed in the center.  Just walk up to it and claim the site.  The mod also adds a waypoint to the site.

✅ Updated for Worlds Part II
✅ Patch mod - likely to work well with other Patch and Overwrite mods

Contains the following files: 
[code]\METADATA\REALITY\TABLES\REWARDTABLE.EXML
\METADATA\SIMULATION\ENVIRONMENT\PLANETBUILDINGTABLE.EXML
\METADATA\SIMULATION\SCANNING\SCANEVENTTABLEPLANET.EXML
[/code]

name: sProtect - No Tech Damage with Shield Up
summary: Disables Tech Damage while your Shield still up, your Techs will only be damaged if your shield goes down.
author: Syzzle
description:
If you like the idea of your Techs being damage in Combat, but dislike the idea that for some reason they still get Damaged even though your Shield is there and your Ship didn't take any damage at all, this mod is for you. Your Techs will only be breaking when your Shield goes down, so until that happen your Techs will be completely protected.


[quote][size=5][b]Installing Mods[/b][/size]
Follow these steps to install mods.

[list=1]
[*]Browse to [b]No Man's Sky\GAMEDATA[/b].
[*]Create a folder named [b]MODS[/b].
[*]Place the [b]mod folder containing the loose files into the MODS folder[/b] (they have to be in the MODS folder itself and not in any subfolder, and no loose files should be inside the MODS folder).
[*]Start the game and wait for the splash screen to disappear.
[*]If done correctly [b]the[/b] [b]game will display a[/b] [b]warning[/b] just before displaying the selection of saved games.
[/list][/quote]The warning will look like [url=https://i.imgur.com/zTEEFwI.jpeg]this[/url].

files.name: sProtect
files.changelog_html: Updated to 6.02

name: Buildable Corvette Workshop Cache
summary: Allows you to build the Corvette Workshop Cache in your base or in your Corvette.
author: Syzzle
description:
This mod adds the Corvette Workshop Cache to be unlocked at the Anomaly (the same place you unlock the other base storages) so you can build them in your bases or inside your Corvette to get access to all your Corvette parts.

PS: There may or may not be a bug with the game when you build (and/or dismantle) it inside the Corvette where the camera breaks and farther away from the ship, going back to the main menu and loading back in fixes the bug, so far the bug apparently only happens when building and/or dismantling it inside the Corvette, normal use doesn't break so far.

name: Better Pulse Scan
summary: Rare resources will now appear when you use Pulse Scan with Multitool or Exocraft.
author: Syzzle07
description:
[center][/center]Have you ever thought:
[i]"Goddamn, this Pulse Scan tech is worthless, I don't need Oxygen, Sodium or Di-Hydrogen anymore, why do Module Upgrades for it even exist?!"[/i]
Say no more, fam.
With this mod you can make everytime you press C on your Keyboard not be a mistake, every (or at least I think it is) Rare resource will now show up when you use Pulse Scan. Yes, those Resources that appear as Stars when you use the Visor Scan, and some other things too, like Knowledge Stone, Whispering Eggs and more.

And if you don't care about any of those and only want to find Curious Deposits so you can build your Nanite farm, there is an optional download that is only for that.

[color=#ff0000][size=4][quote]The way the game works is that you have two (there are tecnically more, but that's beside the point) types of "Scan", one is the Visor and the other is the Pulse Scan, you can only see things through one of them, not both, this mod changes so all of those are shown through the Pulse Scan, which means that you won't be seeing them anymore through the Visor.

Can't make Ship Pulse Scan work since in order to see the Icons after scanning you would need to be really slow and really lower almost kissing the ground, at that point it's better to just be on foot or using exocraft.[/quote][/size][/color]
These are the EXML files affected and what they actually are in the game, so if you want any of them to stop showing up in the Pulse Scan and go back to only show up in the Visor, just delete the file.

[code]LAVAGEMS.ENTITY.EXML ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿-- 'Organic' Rock - MORDITE (RARE 2)
WORDSTONE.ENTITY.EXML ﻿ ﻿ ﻿  ﻿ ﻿  -- Wordstones
CORRUPTDRONECOLLECT.ENTITY.EXML ﻿     ﻿-- Alluring Specimen (RARE 3)
_FLOAT_1.ENTITY.EXML            -- Mutant Plant - SULPHURINE (RARE 1)
LIGHTUP.ENTITY.EXML"  ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿     -- Gravitino Ball (RARE 2)
ROLLINGPROP.ENTITY.EXML         -- Curious Deposits (Runaway Mould) (RARE 3)
_EGG_1.ENTITY.EXML ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿     -- Albumen Pearl
GEMCRYSTAL.ENTITY.EXML ﻿  ﻿ ﻿ ﻿   -- 'Organic' Rock - MORDITE (RARE 2)
METEORROCK.ENTITY.EXML ﻿     -- 'Organic' Rock - GLOWING MINERAL (RARE 2)
CRYSTALALTAR.ENTITY.EXML ﻿ ﻿   -- Ancient Data Structure (RARE 1)
FIENDEGG.ENTITY.EXML ﻿   -- Biological Horror Egg
_GEMSTONE_1.ENTITY.EXML ﻿    -- 'Organic' Rock - CHLORINE (RARE 22)
METALFORMATION.ENTITY.EXML ﻿     -- Metal 'Fingers' - GOLD AND URANIUM (RARE 3)
SPOREBAG.ENTITY.EXML ﻿   -- Mutant Plant - RADON (RARE 1)
FLOATINGGASBAG.ENTITY.EXML ﻿     -- Floating Crystal - GLOWING MINERAL (RARE 2)
FLOATINGRESOURCE.ENTITY.EXML ﻿   -- Floating Crystal - DI-HYDROGEN (RARE 1)
METALSPHERE.ENTITY.EXML ﻿    -- Submerged Relic - HADAL CORE (RARE 2)
_URCHIN_1.ENTITY.EXML ﻿      -- Sac Venom -  SAC VENOM (RARE 3)
SCRAPCORE.ENTITY.EXML ﻿  -- Salvageable Scrap 
BONEPILE.ENTITY.EXML ﻿   -- Natural Burial Sites - ANCIENT BONES
UNDERGROUNDPROP.ENTITY.EXML ﻿    -- Buried Technology Module - SALVAGED DATA
GRAVEINCAVE.ENTITY.EXML ﻿    -- Unknown Grave
STORMCRYSTALS.ENTITY.EXML ﻿      -- Storm Crystals - STORM CRYSTAL
[/code]

name: Overclocked Industry
summary:
Power up Autonomous Mining, Atmosphere Harvester and Oxygen Harvester to harvest a full stack of 9999 in 15 seconds.
Amount and Time fully configurable through the LUA script.
author: Syzzle07
description:
[left]This mod changes Autonomous Mining Unit (AMU), Atmosphere Harvester and Oxygen Harvester to produce a full stack of 9999 in 15 seconds, you can also change the amount or time through the LUA file provided with the mod.
If you don't like to use Extractors or prefer to use AMU for aesthetic reasons (since they actually need to be on top of a Deposit in order to mine), but always felt bad for it being too slow and too little resources for the amount of work, you might wanna give this mod a shot.

[b][size=5][url=https://antifandom.com/nomanssky/wiki/Mods#Installing_Mods][color=#ffff00]Click Here for Instructions of how to Install Mods[/color][/url][/size][/b]

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b][size=4][color=#ffff00]DISCLAIMER[/color][/size][/b][b]

[/b]Like the Refiner, AMU (and probably the other two as well) has a bug where while it's working if you teleport away, to a different place or system, when you come back to it, it will be empty, both the resources it was mining and the fuel will be gone. That's a old bug that to this day isn't fixed, it's not guaranteed to happen, but it happens from time to time, so in case it happens with you, it's not the mod's fault.
And that's not the only bug it has either, if you have AMUs on top of different deposits on the same planet (eg. one on Gold and one on Copper), sometimes it can bug and start gathering mineral from a different resource than the one you're on top of (AMU on top of Gold getting Copper instead). Maybe one day Hello Games will fix it.[/left]

name: Unlockable Expedition Exclusive Techs
summary: Adds the Expedition and Pre-Order exclusive Techs for Ship, Multi-Tool, Exosuit and Base Building to the Anomaly.
author: Syzzle07
description:
This mod does a couple of things, it changes Pulse Drive, Launch Thruster and Hyperdrive to be able to be dismantled so you can install the replacement ones, and add the Techs you're not able to get normally anymore, such as Expedition exclusive techs, pre-order techs or techs that were removed from the game.

[b]Ships:[/b]
Add Waveform Engine which is a better Pulse Drive. (Expedition Tech)
Add Frameshift Catapult which is a better Hyperdrive. (Expedition Tech)
Add Advanced Launch System which is a better Launch Thruster. (Expedition Tech)
Add Photonix Core which is a Pulse Drive Upgrade. (PS4 Pre-Order Tech)

[color=#ffff00][size=4][b]WARNING:[/b][/size][/color][color=#ff0000][size=4][b] [/b][/size][/color]
[quote]Since Waveform Engine, Frameshift Catapult and Advanced Launch System are better versions of the mentioned 3 core ship techs, when installing them you SHOULD REMOVE THE OTHER EQUIVALENT ONE FROM THE SHIP otherwise your ship might break and not fly, if you install Waveform Engine, remove Pulse Drive, if you install Frameshift, remove Hyperdrive, if you install Advanced Launch System, remove Launch Thruster or your ship won't fly anymore.[/quote]
[b]
Multitools:[/b]
Add Boltcaster SM which is a Boltcaster Upgrade. (PS4 Pre-Order Tech)
Add Plasma Resonator which is a Mining Laser Upgrade. (Previously removed from the game)

[b]Exosuit:[/b]
Add Visceral Synthesiser which I have no idea what it does, but it's an exclusive expedition tech so here we are. (Expedition Tech)
Add Archive Override Implant which I have no idea what it does either, but again it's an exclusive expedition tech. (Expedition Tech)

[b]Base Buildings:
[/b]Add Utopia Build Station, Portable Exocraft Research Station, Utopia Ship Station, Utopia Exosuit Statio and Utopia Multi-Tool Station, they are portable stations from Utopia Expedition so you can learn new Blueprints without having to do to the Anomaly.

[quote][size=5][b]Installing Mods[/b][/size]
Follow these steps to install mods.

[list=1]
[*]Browse to [b]No Man's Sky\GAMEDATA[/b].
[*]Create a folder named [b]MODS[/b].
[*]Place the [b]mod folder containing the loose files into the MODS folder[/b] (they have to be in the MODS folder itself and not in any subfolder, and no loose files should be inside the MODS folder).
[*]Start the game and wait for the splash screen to disappear.
[*]If done correctly [b]the[/b] [b]game will display a[/b] [b]warning[/b] just before displaying the selection of saved games.
[/list][/quote]The warning will look like [url=https://i.imgur.com/zTEEFwI.jpeg]this[/url].

Even if you remove the Mod after installing the Techs on your ship, they will still be there, but you will lose the ability of installing it on other ships of course.

name: Faster Resource Mining
summary: Modifies the Optical Drill and Advanced Mining Laser Tech to mine faster and get more resources.
author: ripshawe
description:
Updated for Holiday Expeditions 6.17.2

Modifies the Optical Drill and Advanced Mining Laser Tech to mine faster and get more resources. Includes LUA script for AMUMSS, in case you want to merge this mod or tweak it.

Modifies GCTECHNOLOGYTABLES

Optical Mining Drill (_id="UT_MINER")
Changes Mining Bonus from 1.5 to 10 (GcStatsBonus index 0)
Modifier also affects how many plants you harvest while the optical drill is installed on your active multi-tool.

Advanced Mining Laser (Found under _id="STRONGLASER")
Changes Mining Time from 0.85 to 0.25 (GcStatsBonus index 1)
Most mining takes about a second or less.

The mod is now published in EXML format so you can edit the EXML file in Notepad++ to tweak any of these numbers if you like. :)

name: Less Storms - Longer Days
summary: After two other mods that claimed to do this stopped working and weren't updated, I recreated the effects. Working with 6.17 (Voyagers), this mod is for all those who dislike the fact that storms happen so frequently.
author: Dr Kaii
description:
[b]Fixed to work with Origins. Includes two versions, both with storms 45 mins - 1 hour apart, with one version also slowing time so day is 1 hour and night is 1 hour each.[/b]

Extract to your GAMEDATA\MODS folder - that's it!

Storms are much less frequent, no less than an hour apart, up to 2 and a half hours. They last half as long. 
Also, day/night cycle is 4 times slower, 1 hour day, 1 hour night.



[b]NOTES:[/b]
[list]
[*]This mod affects ONLY storms (not rain). They begin with "Warning, storm approaching", and say "STORM" in your hazard protection bar.
[*]This may not work if conflicting with other mods that affect the GCSKYGLOBALS.GLOBALS day length and storm properties
[*]I am not 100% sure what the details are on the differences between Low High and Extreme storms, but from what I can tell, it seems that a planet with storms can only have one type. Some planets will have "Low" storms, some will have "High" and extreme planets can have "Extreme" storms. This isn't 100% confirmed but the game does divide the times between them in vanilla in descending gaps, so I thought some might want this to still happen even when delaying them across the board.
[*]Working for NMS Voyagers
[/list]May update and add variants in future, especially if requested.

name: Floating Teleporter Collision
summary: Fix the corvette floating teleporter collision so you can stand on it. Adds a base under the land teleporter.
author: lMonk
description:
[color=#bf9000][size=5][b]Floating Teleporter Collision 1.1[/b][/size][/color][size=3]

[/size][color=#bf9000][size=4][b]Description[/b][/size][/color][size=3]
Fix floating teleporter collision so you can actually stand on it.
Adds a bottom beneath the floating teleporter to block the missing texture.
Adds a base under the land teleporter to fill the missing base when placed on a slope.
[size=3]
⚠️ Overwrite mod - unlikely to work well with other Overwrite mods[/size]

[/size][color=#bf9000][size=4][b]Install[/b][/size][/color][size=3]
Unzip the mod and place the full folder into [color=#fff2cc]{NMS Install Folder}\GAMEDATA\MODS[/color] (not PCBANKS). Create MODS folder if necessary.
If the mod(s) still doesn't work, make sure the settings file [color=#fff2cc]{NMS Install Folder}\Binaries\SETTINGS\GCMODSETTINGS.MXML[/color] is not set to [color=#fff2cc]DisableAllMods=true[/color].
◈ The LUA isn't used by the game directly. It's an aid for merging with other mods, using AMUMSS, or modding yourself. If you don't do either, you can safely ignore it.

[/size][color=#bf9000][size=4][b]Change-log[/b][/size][/color][size=3]
1.1: [size=3]Adds a base under the land teleporter[/size]; Synced to game version [b]6.17[/b]

[/size][color=#bf9000][size=4][b]Compatibility[/b][/size][/color][size=3]
changes made in the following files:
- MODELS/COMMON/SPACECRAFT/BIGGS/TELEWATER.SCENE.MBIN
- MODELS/COMMON/SPACECRAFT/BIGGS/TELEPORTER.SCENE.MBIN[/size]

name: Nanite Multiplier (Beacon)
summary:
Mod inspired in the Nanite Reward Multiplier (Leviathan-Outlaws), Created by "Reece5268", updated to new version of No Man's Sky.
NOTE: previous versions used .MBIN extention, but new versions uses .EXML.
So, delete previous folder to install the new version.
author: Reece5268
description:
Mod inspired in the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/mods/2309]Nanite Reward Multiplier (Leviathan-Outlaws)[/url], created by "[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/users/52990756]Reece5268[/url]".
Updated to new version of No Man's Sky.

This mod multiplies the amount of Nanites you get from rewards, such as "Damaged Machinery" and Missions.

Came in versions of:
[list]
[*][b]2x[/b]
[*][b]5x[/b]
[*][b]10x[/b]
[*][b]20x[/b]
[*][b]50x[/b]
[*][b]100x[/b]
[/list]
[code]Modifies [i]METADATA/REALITY/TABLES/REWARDTABLE[/i][/code][i]

[/i]Must be set to high priorit in GCMODSETTINGS.MXML file. ([quote]<Property name="ModPriority" value="0" />[/quote])

This is the only way it worked for me.
(you can merge it with other mods that use same REWARDTABLE file)

[b]Updated to the lastest version of the game.[/b]

name: zBest Freighter v6.17
summary: zBest Freighter is a redesign of the Bridge and expands the Freighter Hangar to 12 Pads. New to v6: Moved Corvette teleporters and added a Starship Outfitter.
author: JMZ
description:
[b][u][color=#00ff00][size=5]zBest Freighter v6.17[/size][/color][/u][/b]

[size=4][color=#00ffff]zBest Freighter is a redesign of the Bridge, expands the Freighter Hangar to 12 Pads and moved Corvette teleporters.[/color]

[/size][color=#ffff00][size=3]My Thanks to those of you who voted this Mod of the Month for July 2025.[/size]
[/color]
[size=3][u]zBest Freighter[/u] replaces the freighter bridge with an open-plan design and improved ergonomics. It expands the freighter hangar from 9 to 12 fully functional landing pads. The number of your starships that can be in the hangar is increased from 6 to 9. NPC ships and your friends (also using this mod) can use any/all of the unoccupied landing pads. The Corvette teleporters have been moved to a much more convenient location. There is also a Starship Outfitting terminal in the hanger.

A key aspect of this mod is the ability for you to build any object that can be built in your freighter base on your new bridge! You can now take full control of what YOUR fighter bridge looks like. Need more light? Add one. Want a conference table with chairs? Add them. You are limited only by your available blueprints and imagination. Since you can't remove things added by this mod, only a minimal set of items come pre-installed and they retain the flavor of the original bridge design elements.[/size]

[size=3][u][b][color=#00ff00]Details:[/color][/b][/u]
zBest Freighter combines and extends my 3 Freighter mods (zBridge, zBridge Terminal, and zHangar) This combination was required to enable increasing the landing pads in the hangar from 9 to 12. If you want to efficiently add lights to your new bridge add my zLights mod and use the completely new Lab Light. All of my mods now work on all freighters: capital, system, and pirate! You may wish to read the documentation for these individual mods as each goes into more detail.

[u][color=#ff7700][b]Special Note to Pirate Dreadnought Captains:[/b][/color][/u]
There are a few cosmetic issues with the Hangar interior on dreadnoughts. To save 50-100 hours of additional work, I decided to reuse the regular hanger interior on dreadnoughts.  And while it is fully functional, there are some issues in 3 of the 4 corners (fit and intrusions) that do not meet my standards. If there is enough interest in this mod, I do intend to completely redo the pirate hangar interior using the original pirate hangar 3D model parts. Frankly I'm a bit burned out with working on this right now and it may very well be August before I release a new version with that fix. Between now and then, I am open to suggestions on what items to add or remove on Dreadnoughts. Just leave a post.

This mod also patches 2 globals files. GcFleetGlobals is changed to increase the number of your starships that can be in the hangar from 6 to 9, increasing it to 10 may cause a crash on reload, increasing to to 11 or 12 will cause the game to fail to load. Changes to GcAiSpaceshipGlobals allows NPC ships to use ALL landing pads. When you visit the space station or a trading post, you will see more NPC ships landing than the usual 4 or 5. Both of these simple text files are in the mod's Globals folder and can be edited.

Anything you build and place on your bridge is part of your freighter base and counts against its 3000 part limit. These additions will remain if you should uninstall this mod. So you may need to manage those additions carefully. As with any of the bridge mods out there, you probably don't want to be standing on your bridge when you exit the game and uninstall any bridge replacement mod. You can end up trapped inside the old bridge structure. The game provides an emergency relocation option if you find yourself caught on your freighter.

Unlike almost all mods, the items zBest Freighter allows you place on your bridge can be seen by any other players who visit your bridge. The base parts you added will be seen by visitors just like any other part of your base. The placement may not make sense to the visitor unless they are also using zBest Freighter (as that piece is strictly local to the individual player). Said differently, if you and your friends all use zBest Freighter, each can customize their bridge and that custom bridge will be seen when you/they visit. With other bridge mods, every bridge you visit looks exactly like your own - because the effects of the mod are completely local to your computer.[/size]

[size=3][u]Before you report a bug:
[/u]NMS v6 is still very buggy. Freighter doors don't always open and One NPC ship may "land" above the hangar landing pad 2A. I have run into both of these "features" without the mod. NMS also has a VRAM memory leak that may cause low frame rates and or game crashes. All of this will likely be fixed in future NMS updates.
[/size]
[size=3][u][color=#ff0000][b]Known Issues:[/b][/color][/u]
The original 3D model parts that the bridge and hangar are constructed from have numerous errors. I have fixed some of them, but many remain. You may never notice them all, but there are a couple that are more obvious. The elbows in each corridor from the hangar to the bridge have light leaks. You may also encounter a brief hang when entering those corners. I have not been able to track down the cause - yet. If you find your self walking around on the outside of your freighter, there are a couple of places where you may find yourself falling through the structure. Again, I have not fully tracked down the cause. This is not the mod's fault, it is a model deficiency. There are some limitations to modifying the 3D models and you may bump into some things that are not visible (all in places you are unlikely to frequent). I take full responsibility for degrading the fit and finish of the exterior of the bridge. I had to refit the pieces HG provided to improve the interior appearance at the expense of exterior.

This mod is of limited scope, replacing/enhancing the freighter Bridge and Hangar, including the Bridge Terminal. This mod is not compatible with any other mods that replace or edit these files. The mod that loads last is the one you will see in effect. The [color=#00ffff]!zBest Freighter[/color] folder should be placed in your No Man’s Sky\GAMEDATA\MODS folder along with all of your other mods.

[u][b][color=#00ff00]Important Note:[/color][/b][/u]
If you are currently using zBridge, zBridge Terminal, and/or zHangar, (Thank you! and) you will need to uninstall these mods since zBest Freighter replaces all three.

[u][b][color=#00ff00]Highly recommended mods for use with zBest Freighter (You really want to add these to your mods):[/color][/b][/u]
zLights: Superior lights for use in your base - one light may be all you need.
Exosolar's Beyond Base Building: Allows you to build almost anything anywhere.

[color=#ffff00]This mod would not be possible without the use of the fabulous MBINcompiler and NMSDK plug-in for Blender.
A special thank you to the senior modders on the No Man's Sky Modding Discord for their patience and guidance.[/color]

[color=#00ff00]I hope you find this mod useful and enjoy it.  If you do like this mod and were waiting for this update, I ask that you consider taking a moment to endorse it. Endorsements are the only real feedback that is reliable.

Cheers, JMZ[/color][/size]

name: Faster Scanning v6.17
summary: Scan anything faster!
author: Flugelwulff
description:
Lets you scan things faster with the analyzer. 1 second and instant options available as well as the option to disable the delay between scans.


[b][u]HOW TO INSTALL:
[/u][/b]1. Install with Vortex (strongly recommended - just do it)
2. Choose scan speed
3. Profit

LUA file is available for those who wish to change the multiplier themselves or merge it with other mods.

name: More Materials v6.17
summary: Options for increasing the amount of substances and/or products available from traders.
author: Flugelwulff
description:
This mod increases the amount of substances (e.g. Oxygen), products (e.g. Microprocessor) or both, to 10 times the amount normally available to buy.

[color=#ff0000][size=2][b]This mod [/b]DOES NOT[/size][/color][b][color=#ff0000][size=2] modify the available items, just the quantity. Items available permanently are still there and random ones are still random.[/size]
[/color]
[/b][b]HOW TO INSTALL:
[/b]1. Install with Vortex (strongly recommended - just do it)
2. Choose whether you want more substances, more products or both
3. Profit

[b]**NOTICE**
[/b]LUA files for AMUMSS have been uploaded! Many thanks to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/users/62067056]Babscoole[/url] for his work in preparing these and his permission to upload them for all of you!

name: Mining Multiplier v6.17
summary: Options for increasing multi-tool mining & terrain manipulator yield.
author: Flugelwulff
description:
Changes the total resource multiplier applied when the [b]Optical Drill [/b]upgrade is installed. Choose from x2, x5, x10 or x100 in Vortex.
[b]**NEW** [/b]Added options for the Terrain Manipulator as well! No special upgrade install required for this part of the mod.
[b]**NEW** [/b]Added option to remove mining particle effects. Working to add one for less instead of only none!


[b][u]HOW TO INSTALL:
[/u][/b]1. Install with Vortex (strongly recommended - just do it)
2. Choose multiplier value
3. Profit

[color=#ff0000][b]The [url=https://nomanssky.fandom.com/wiki/Optical_Drill]Optical Drill [/url]upgrade is REQUIRED, or the regular resource gathering part of this mod will do nothing. Only works for hand mining; ships unaffected.[/b][/color]

LUA file is available for those who wish to change the multiplier themselves or merge it with other mods.

name: Keep Gifting
summary: Keep Gifting makes the npcs gifting dialogue stay open when gifting items to increase faction rep and also replaces gifting option for 1x with 5x.
author: Reikokuu and Babscoole
description:
If you have more than one item to gift to npcs this will make the process less tedious.

All settings are completely customizable in the lua script.
For a full list of customizable settings check the doc tab.

[b][b]Manual Installation :[/b][/b]
Extract to GAMEDATA\MODS

[b]Mod Edits :[/b]
﻿METADATA/REALITY/TABLES/COSTTABLE.MBIN
﻿METADATA/REALITY/TABLES/REWARDTABLE.MBIN
﻿METADATA/REALITY/TABLES/NMS_DIALOG_GCALIENPUZZLETABLE.MBIN

For install and usage of AMUMSS to self update the mod or combine with other mods using the included Lua script please see [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/mods/2626]AMUMSS How To[/url]

[b]Other Mods :[/b]
﻿[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/21587394?tab=user+files&BH=0]Reikokuu Mods[/url]

name: Firmware Update for the Signal Booster
summary: Signal booster upgrade to find Portals, Crashed Ships, Multi Tools, Factories, Drop Pods, Planetary Archives, Crashed Freighters, and Observatory with no inputs.
author: Lowkie and Babscoole
description:
Feel free to include any or all of the LUA in any mod or usage you may want.

[size=4][b]The following are all the exciting things the scanner can now find[/b][/size]
[size=3]Dialog 1
[list]
[*]Vanilla random structure scan for milestones 
[*]Portals  
[*]Crashed Starships
[/list][/size]
[size=3]Dialog 2
[list]
[*]Multi-Tool location
[*]Manufacturing Facility
[*]Exosuit DropPod
[/list][/size]
[size=3]Dialog 3
[list]
[*]Planetary Archives
[*]Crashed Freighters 
[*]Observatory 
[/list][/size][size=2]
[size=3]Dialog 4
[list]
[*]Scan Habitable Outposts (A random habitable location)
[*]Sentinel Pillar
[*]Traveler Graves
[/list][/size][/size][size=2]
[size=3]Dialog 5
[list]
[*]"Wild" Base Computer 
[*]Boundry Failures
[*]Abandoned Building
[/list][/size][/size][size=2]
[/size][size=3]Dialog 6
[list]
[*]Sentinel Camp
[*]Crashed Sentinel Ship
[*]Settlement
[/list]
Dialog 7[list]
[*]Autophage Settlement
[/list]
[/size]

[size=3]Files changed by this mod:
METADATA\SIMULATION\SCANNING\SCANEVENTTABLEPLANET.MBIN
METADATA\REALITY\TABLES\COSTTABLE.MBIN
[/size][size=3]METADATA\REALITY\TABLES\NMS_DIALOG_GCALIENPUZZLETABLE.MBIN[/size]
[size=3]METADATA\REALITY\TABLES\REWARDTABLE.MBIN  --Caution this table is changed by many different mods.
METADATA\GAMESTATE\STATS\STATDEFINITIONSTABLE.MBIN
METADATA\GAMESTATE\STATS\STATGROUPSTABLE.MBIN
METADATA\SIMULATION\MISSIONS\ENABLINGCONDITIONSTABLE.MBIN

If one or more others mods you have installed are using any of these files, there would be a conflict and only one of the mods would work.
[size=2]
[/size][b][size=5]LUA Notes\Other Modders:
[/size][/b][size=3]The LUA structure makes adding additional options super easy, even re-arranging the options is a simple task.[/size]
[size=3]So if you use [/size][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/mods/957][size=3]AMUMSS[/size][/url][size=3] which you should if you are modding NMS, you can customize this mod to suit your taste.﻿[/size][list]
[*][size=3]You can put the options in whichever arrangement you want[/size]
[*][size=3]Adding a new option is just two pieces of information[/size]
[*][size=3]Rewards can also be added, again with just two parameters[/size]
[*][size=3]Removing any option(s) is even easier[/size]
[*][size=3]See the notes in the LUA[/size]
[/list][/size]

3.38.01: Rebuild with more LUA still lots of replacements,
3.42-2.0: Better formatting and cleaner replacement of values.
3.51-2.1: First release for Prisms. No updates or changes from the 3.42 (Expeditions) version
3.89: Update for 3.89.  Added "Wild" Base Computer scan
3.90: Adding ModBuilder cs script.  Thanks aFaern/Bladehawke
3.97a: Added Boundry Failures.  Updated cs script
3.97b: The scanner will now replace the factory location with a new one if you scan while still having a factory already as a waypoint.
Major re-write of the CS script, same functionality.
3.99: Update to 3.99.  Added Abandoned building scan.  cs script will be updated soon
Add version with NAV DATA cost
Add .cs script for NiF version and cs scripts bug fixes, thanks to Bladehawke
4.02: Traveler grave will now remain marked, no other changes
4.05: Update for Waypoint 4.05.  Added back in vanilla scan for compatibility with milestones that require signal scanner usage.  Be aware that disappearing icons are a vanilla bug that HG has to fix, it's affecting all mods that use ScanEvents.
Updated cs scripts will follow soon
4.22: Update for 4.22.  Added sentinel camp and crashed sentinel ship
4.22a: Only updated .cs scripts for NMSMB, thanks to Bladehawke.  No mod or Lua script changes
4.48: Changed the Lua script for NiF version.  Script will ask if you want the NAVDATA cost to be 1, 5, or 10.  1 is default.  Thanks to jironimo for the idea.  No other changes to the "main" script or either .pak.
4.50: Complete revamp of the mod and Lua, even though will look the same in-game.  Small bug, where currently you won't see a message if a scan fails (usually because there's none of that thing in the system you're in).  Being worked on.
4.50a: Fix missing fail message.  Huge thanks to Alchemist for all the assistance in switching the mod over to mission based and Bladehawk for updating his .cs script to match the changes in the mod.
4.71: Update for NMS 4.71.  Hopefully Expedition booster override fixed.
5.0.3: Update for NMS 5.0.3, Worlds.  Added option for 3 NAV DATA cost to NiF version
5.11a: By request, made a change to the Lua to account for an issue when combining with Cooking With Cronus
5.70: Update for NMS 5.70, Beacon.  Added Autophage Settlement search
5.75: Fixed for use in abandoned mode.  Thanks to Jay33721 for reporting
