[/list][list]
[*][b]﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿[/b] ﻿[b]Scatter Blaster ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Damaged [/b]increased[b] 2x ﻿Range [/b]reduced to[b] 0.4x[/b] [b]﻿Recoil [/b]reduced to [b]0.75x[/b][b] ﻿Dispersion [/b]increased by[b] 2x ﻿Reload time[/b][b] [/b]increased by [b]1.2x. ﻿﻿Critical [/b]multiplier is now[b] 1.3x [/b]instead of 1.5x[b].[/b] ﻿[b]Upgrade Module [/b]bonus [b]Damage [/b]increased to[b] 2.4x ﻿[/b]The Scatter Blaster has a very short effective range, poor accuracy, a low Critical multiplier and difficulty hitting weak points, and a lengthy reload but makes up for it in raw burst damage. (With the highest Recoil for Multi-Tool weapons, as in vanilla it actually greatly benefits from using the Combat Scope, which reduces recoil.)

[*]﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ [b]﻿Neutron Cannon ﻿ ﻿     Damage [/b]increased by ~[b]1.05x[/b] ﻿ ﻿Uncharged (Rapid-fire) shot [b]Damage [/b]increased an additional [b]~4x[/b]. ﻿ ﻿[b]Charge Time[/b] is "fixed" to now be [b]improved [/b]by [b]supercharging the core tech[/b] instead of made worse (like the Blaze javelin is). I.E. It is now [b]always [/b]beneficial to [b]supercharge [/b]the Neutron Cannon [b]core tech[/b]. ﻿Upgrade modules have their bonus [b]Damage reduced to 0.21x[/b][b].[/b] ﻿ ﻿(Class X Upgrade Modules fixed to be possibly stronger than Class S modules like other weapons) ﻿[b]Base dispersion (inaccuracy)[/b] increased [b]1.4x[/b] (should make it slightly easier to hit multiple enemies at once)   ﻿[b]Fuel Usage[/b] rate increased [b]2x[/b] ﻿The Neutron Cannon isn't obviously strong, but the generous AOE effect is quite powerful vs grouped enemies such as newly spawned Drones, Repair/Corrupted Drones & their healing patient, clusters of enemies on Derelict Freighters, etc. The AOE also appears to be able to trigger critical weakpoints, so it does well vs. things like Sentinel Quads.
[/list][list]
[*][b] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Blaze Javelin ﻿ ﻿   ﻿Damage [/b]increased by ~[b]2x ﻿ [/b]﻿﻿Stun effect [b]reduced from 5 to 1 second[/b]. ﻿Upgrade modules have their bonus [b]Damage [/b]increased to [b]2.5x[/b]. ﻿The Blaze Javelin as a weapon was never particularly strong, and even with these buffs it still has a slightly lower DPS than most other weapons. However with the increased health of sentinels in PTSd, now it should be able to one-shot regular drones, and on a good enough Multi-Tool with enough upgrades, even repair/summoner drones as well. The stun effect however was much too strong and easy to stunlock enemies, so now it function more as an "interrupt," useful for stopping summoners mid-summon.
[/list][list]
[*][b] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Plasma Launcher[/b] [b]﻿ ﻿ ﻿ Damage [/b]increased to [b]1.45x[/b] [b]﻿Upgrade Module [/b]bonus [b]Damage [/b]reduced to [b]0.7x[/b] ﻿[b]Charge [/b]bar reduced from 20 to [b]16 shots per refill[/b].
[/list][list]
[*][b] ﻿﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Geology Cannon ﻿ ﻿    [/b][b]Damage [/b]increased to[b] 1.21x[/b] ﻿[b]Charge [/b]bar reduced from 20 to[b] 10 shots per refill[/b].
[/list][list]
[*] ﻿ ﻿[b]Paralysis Mortar ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Charge [/b]bar reduced from 20 to [b]8 shots per refill[/b], stun radius [b]reduced from 4u to 3u[/b], stun duration [b]reduced from 3.5 to ~2 seconds[/b]. Again, stunning is extremely useful, so this is an attempt to balance it somewhat.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ [b]﻿Mining Laser ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ Critical Damage Multiplier [/b]reduced from 4x damage to [b]2x damage.[/b][b] [/b]Makes switching to a "proper" weapon more important. Bonuses to Multi-Tool Mining Laser heat time, fuel efficiency, and overheat cooldown from procedural Mining Laser upgrades reduced ~[b]-20%. [/b]The "[b]overheat[/b]" animation for the mining laser now disables it about [b]~7x longer[/b] than vanilla (The UI overheat display may sometimes fade before it has fully cooled down). This is to incentivize paying attention to the heat bar / investing in mining upgrades, since now you need to wait about 4 times longer if it overheats vs. stopping at the last second to let it cool down naturally (In vanilla it can actually be faster to do the overheat animation than to let it cool naturally). The Mining Laser has been fixed so that supercharging it increases mining speed instead of decreasing it.
[*]﻿ [b]﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Hijacked Laser ﻿ ﻿    ﻿[/b](Using [b]instead of[/b] the Mining Laser, not stacked with it) No longer[b] identical [/b]to Mining Laser[b]. [/b]Now deals[b] 9.33[/b][b]x damage[/b] (which mines objects 6x faster), and a [b]further 1.33x damage[/b] vs [b]Sentinels[/b] & [b]Creatures.[/b] However, it only yields [b]0.3x the resources[/b] from objects it destroys (before applying Class level, Optical Drill, or supercharging bonuses). It [b]heats up twice as fast[/b] (but "[b]reloads[/b]" after an overheat [b]twice as fast[/b]), uses [b]fuel 3x[/b] as quickly, and [b]costs 2x [/b]as much to recharge  (description now notes all of this). The high damage but low resource yield means when mining multiple objects in succession, you are still getting more resources per second than any other Multi-Tool, so this could still be worthwhile when mining objects that are abundant & in large groups such as rocks on airless planets (Also, when mining minerals & di-hydrogen the yield from opening [b]Geodes [/b]or [b]Crystal Fragments[/b] is unchanged, so the Hijacked Laser is [b]especially effective[/b] when mining objects with a chance to drop [b]set items[/b] like those. Objects which [b]always drop a set amount[/b] of items, such as Floating Crystals, Radiant Shards, Subterranean Organic Structures, Salvageable Scrap, etc. are even better, essentially having no downside to using Sentinel multi-tool on them, which destroys such objects more than [b]~7x faster[/b] than a Royal multi-tool of the same Class.). However, maintaining that high resource per second rate will be difficult since compared to other Multi-Tools you will be spending more time aiming at new objects or looking for them as they get destroyed so quickly, and have to take more frequent breaks to cool down due to the quick heating. Notably, [b]supercharging [/b]it makes the fuel usage & resource yield get [b]worse [/b]instead of better, unlike the normal Mining Laser, although the damage, heat time, etc. are still improved (the resource yield has been increased in advance to account for how supercharging will reduce it). Overall this lends it to more of a "[b]weapon[/b]" role, since it has a DPS in the same range as most other Multi-Tool weapons with the high range & accuracy of a laser. However it still has niche use as a mining laser for bulk mining, though costing much more fuel in the process, and still a bit behind Pistols in resources per second.
[*][b]﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ Runic Lens ﻿ ﻿    ﻿[/b](Using [b]instead of[/b] the Mining Laser, not stacked with it) While it still has a 1.5x slower heatup time as the Mining Laser, it's other stats are changed even more. It has been changed to now give [b]1.55x as much resources[/b] and deal [b]0.73x as much damage[/b] as a normal Mining Laser  (description now notes this). This means that it will yield more resources per object than most other multi-tools, but slightly fewer resources per second than Sentinel Multi-Tools. It is not as well suited for objects [b]dropping a set amount[/b] of items, as those don't benefit from the increased resource yield and it destroys them [b]~0.72x as fast[/b] as a Royal multi-tool of the same Class (Sort of the inverse of the Hijacked Laser, and without the increased fuel usage either). However the lower mining damage and laser heatup mean that for most objects you waste less time aiming at or looking for new objects to mine, and less time cooling the laser down, so the resource per second rate will often be a little higher.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿[b]Exocraft/Minotaur Mining Laser[/b] [b]﻿[/b] [b]﻿Damage [/b]to Creatures reduced to[b] 0.2x[/b], base damage increased ~[b]1.17x[/b], Minotaur Laser and related techs adjusted to it always remains ~1.15x stronger than the Exocraft Mining Laser with matching upgrades. All upgrade modules had their Mining Power bonus increased a further [b]3x[/b] to allow them to remain competitive with Multi-Tool mining rates for longer. While the best, maxed out Multi-Tool can still obtain substances faster, the new Nutrient Ingestor bonuses to Exocraft Laser Power are enough to temporarily bring Exocraft mining rates much closer.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿[b]Exocraft/Minotaur Cannon[/b] [b]﻿[/b][b]Damage [/b]increased to[b] ~1.2x.[/b] ﻿[b]﻿Critical [/b]multiplier is now [b]1.8x[/b] instead of 1.5x (since the AOE effect makes critical hits so easy). (Exocraft & Nautilon Cannons consume 0.5x as much fuel to fire). [b]Minotaur Cannon[/b] additionally given 1.25x slower firerate but 1.25x higher damage (results in the same DPS) in order to increase the DPS of the [b]AI-Piloted Minotaur Cannon[/b], which fires at a set slow rate.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿[b]Sentinel Hardframe Right Arm[/b] (Stun Cannon for Minotaur) has had it's charge bar reduced to ~1/10 vanilla size (you can only get about 30 shots per refill), and it costs ~10x more substances to recharge it. Stunning is an incredibly powerful effect to apply to enemies, so I try to restrict its usage.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ [b]﻿[/b][b]﻿Sentinel Hardframe Left Arm[/b] now provides only a [b]2.5x[/b] bonus to Minotaur Laser damage vs. stunned targets, as with the buffed Minotaur Laser upgrade modules and Nutrient Ingestor bonuses to Exocraft Laser Power it is more powerful by default.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿[b]Liquidator Right Arm[/b] (Mech Flamethrower) has it's [b]damage [/b]increased by [b]~2x[/b], and damage from upgrades and Fire DOT DPS increased by [b]~10x[/b], allowing it to be a formidable weapon at close range. (As in vanilla, the listed + damage % bonus on Flamethrower upgrades is incorrectly displayed extremely high for some reason)
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿[b]Mounted Flamethrower[/b] (Flamethrower for non-Minotaur Exocraft) had the same adjustments as the Minotaur Flamethrower above, but its fire rate is only 75% as fast. However, it can [b]now use the same Flamethrower upgrade modules[/b] that the Minotaur version can (tech & upgrade descriptions now reflect this)
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿[b]Nautilon Cannon ﻿[/b] [b]﻿ ﻿[/b][b]Damage [/b]increased to [b]~1.4[/b]x.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿[b]Tethys Beam[/b][b]﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Damage[/b] reduced to ~[b]0.93x[/b] and no longer can mine "difficult" minerals by default, but now has an unlockable [b]Advanced Tethys Beam[/b] tech like the Exocraft/Minotaur Mining Lasers which enables this and further improves mining power even more.

[b][size=3]Starship Balance Changes[/size][/b]
[spoiler]
[list]
[*][b]Starship attribute rebalance[/b]: Thanks to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/mods/1932]jackty89 and their Unique Space Ships﻿[/url]﻿ for help and framework for many of the following changes. The full change details can be seen in the .lua﻿, but the main points are:
[*] ﻿ ﻿﻿﻿Starship [b]maximum upgradeable inventories have been reduced;[/b] instead of the typical vanilla max of 110/60 for Cargo/Tech, the new baseline is [b]30/40[/b], although most specific ship types are adjusted as listed below. The lower maximum inventory size also means that it should cost much less to fully upgrade a starship to max slots.
[/list][list]
[*] ﻿ ﻿Starship [b]Initial inventory slots [/b](for spawned purchasable/crashed starships) have been adjusted to generally follow the same trend as the maximum inventory size for that starship type.
[*] ﻿ ﻿All starship initial [b]Boost Speed [/b]has been reduced to [b]0.6x[/b] vanilla, however with enough upgrades they can reach top Boost Speeds that are roughly [b]~1.5x[/b] those in vanilla. In vanilla, maxing out upgrades for starship speed could only increase your speed less than ~20% due to harsh diminishing returns, now upgrade modules will have a significant effect on your starship Boost Speed. This also means you can install far more speed-boosting upgrade modules before diminishing returns kick in. A side effect is that the UI will display erroneously low % values for starship boost values on upgrade modules, despite the upgrades actually increasing speed more than in vanilla. 
[*]Enemy starship maximum combat speeds have been adjusted to roughly ~800u/s or 1,200u/s for slow/fast enemy starships. This means that a fresh ship won't be able to outrun them, but with enough upgrades even a Hauler should eventually outrun any enemy starship.
[*] ﻿ ﻿The difference in [b]speed [/b]between [b]Light, Normal, [/b]and [b]Heavy[/b]-weight starships has been re-tooled. In vanilla the fastest ships were only 15% faster than the slowest type ship with equal upgrades, but now the Space Boost Speed of the Light ships (Explorers, Fighters, Exotics, Solars) are ~50% faster than the Heavy ones (Haulers, Living Ships). Additionally, other speeds such as non-boosting, combat, atmospheric, etc. have been adjusted along similar lines, most notably being Haulers & Living Ships are no longer the fastest in atmosphere.
[*] ﻿ ﻿While in vanilla [b]Sentinel Interceptors[/b] are a [b]Heavy [/b]weight ships with an added ability to hover in atmosphere, in PTSd they have been given their own new weight class of "[b]Abnormal[/b]," which is between "Normal" and "Light", while still keeping the hover ability.
[*] ﻿ ﻿﻿Similarly, [b]Corvettes [/b]in vanilla have the same speed & handling as the Iron Vulture (a Hauler with added hover), but in PTSd they have their [b]own custom "Corvette" weight class[/b]. In space they have the speed of an Interceptor with the handling of a Hauler, and in atmosphere they have the speed of a Hauler and handling slightly worse than a Hauler (with hover). While their top speed will stay in the ballpark of Interceptors / Haulers in space/atmosphere due to diminishing returns, their maneuverability can eventually be increased even well past Interceptors due to the bonuses from Corvette modules.
[*] ﻿ ﻿﻿The new starship [b]"Agility"/"Maneuverability"[/b] base stat has been fixed to affect [b]maneuverability at all times[/b] (in Vanilla due to a typo it only affect ship maneuverability when boosting)
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿However, because in Vanilla the new "Agility" stat only increases the ship's Boosting Speed without affecting the "soft cap" of 2.5x base speed where huge diminishing returns come in, it doesn't really affect the ship's final boost speed when fully maxed out. Thus, in PTSd the [b]"Agility" stat no longer affects Boosting Speed[/b], only Maneuverability (Again, the final maxed-out Boosting Speed of ships would be essentially the same either way).
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿The new Ship Agility / Maneuverability bonus is tied more closely to ship type in PTSd than to class or random chance, so at C class each ship has half the eventual S class bonus, and the bonus varies by +/- 0.05x at each class. This is since the game already has a mechanic to give random variation to the base speed & maneuverability of any starship, and already gives bonuses to those stats for each Class level. Note that these bonuses are applied to the base maneuverability for the particular "weight class" of ship, IE "Light" ships naturally have higher maneuverability (& speed) than "Heavy" ships. (In PTSd Sentinel Interceptors are given their own weight class in between Normal & Light instead of using Heavy as in vanilla)
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Supercharging the appropriate tech/upgrades increases Maneuverability by [b]~1.2x[/b], compounding each time (or a larger ~1.3x-1.5x for Haulers)
[*] ﻿ ﻿Most Starships/Freighters have had [b]substantial increases[/b] to their [b]Hyperdrive Range bonuses[/b] (Especially Explorers & Living Ships). Alongside the increased travel distance of Black Holes, getting to the Galactic Centre / Core "Portal-less" should be much more manageable in PTSd (Reaching the Core from ~700k ly is doable in under 30min with viewable Black Holes and well equipped S Class Explorer).
[*] ﻿ ﻿The various [b]Starship Trail techs[/b] which change the starship engine trail appearance have had their small bonus changed from [b]Boost Speed [/b](+1%) to [b]Hyperdrive Jump Distance[/b] (+10ly). This is because despite the small bonus of an individual Trail tech, in Vanilla the multiplicative adjacency bonuses quickly grew preposterously large, more than doubling Boost Speed with multiple Trails installed next to each other. Adjacency bonuses still provide some multiplicative benefits to Hyperdrive Jump Distance, but a much more reasonable amount (up to roughly ~1.12x Hyperdrive Jump Distance with many adjacent trails). This also synergizes with [b]Explorers & Living Ships[/b], which both have large bonuses to Hyperdrive Range, and the largest Tech inventory size of all starships, so can make the best use of multiple Starship Trail techs to maximize Hyperdrive Range.
[*] ﻿ ﻿[b]Starshield Batteries[/b] now restore [b]100%[/b] of your starship's shield instead of only 50%.
[*] ﻿ ﻿Tweaked the [b]maluses [/b]you get to other ship systems when [b]diverting power[/b] away from them to be roughly ~2/3rds as much as you would gain when diverting power to them. Most significantly, Weapons take a smaller malus when diverting power away from them (now [b]0.9x[/b] instead of 0.7x). (Note that there currently seems to be a vanilla bug where the Shield malus is never applied for some reason)
[/list][list]
[*] ﻿ ﻿All starship class bonuses to [b]shields[/b] have been [b]increased 1.4x,[/b] on top of any changes from vanilla listed in the individual descriptions below. For some reason, by default starship class bonuses for shields only apply at ~71% of the expected strength. E.G. A starship with a class bonus of +100% to shields will only actually have 1.71x more shields than one with a +0% shield bonus. By increasing all class shield bonuses this way, this is equivalent to making the class shield bonuses work at full strength. This allows the different types of starships to feel more distinct from one another, as the difference in their shield strengths will be greater. Most ships have had their Shield bonus at least doubled below, as with how quickly shields deplete in PTSd it takes a big difference in shields to make a noticeable difference. Note also, as in vanilla there appears to be diminishing returns to installing starship Shield upgrade modules, where they quickly become progressively weaker with each additional one you install.
[*]The charts below show how various attributes will compare against each other in-game for S Class starships, factoring in all the changes made by [i]PTSd[/i]. ﻿﻿
[*][url=https://imgur.com/uSlYvno.png][img]https://imgur.com/uSlYvno.png[/img]PTSd Starship Combat Stats chart link[/url]﻿﻿﻿﻿
[/list][list]
[*]﻿[url=https://imgur.com/vRjqW5h.png]PTSd Starship Other Stats chart link[/url]﻿﻿﻿﻿[img]https://imgur.com/vRjqW5h.png[/img]﻿﻿
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿*Solar ships ﻿have 150% pulse jump speed, -25% pulse jump fuel discount
[*] ﻿ ﻿**Interceptor ships have unique recharge materials, base hyperdrive range is 600ly instead of 100ly, 120% pulse jump speed, -10% pulse jump fuel discount, can hover
[*] ﻿***Living ships have unique recharge materials and techs, can visit red/green/blue stars without extra techs, has 120% pulse speed (but unlike other ships can’t install tech to improve it), takes no tech damage from black holes
[*] ﻿ ﻿The increases [url=https://nomanssky.fandom.com/wiki/Starship?so=search#Shuttle_-_Low_&_Balanced_Bonuses][b]from the vanilla stat bonuses[/b][/url]﻿ listed below are for S Class ships, and the increases at lower classes may be lower or higher to ensure each starship type has a smoother progression from C to S class instead of sudden jumps. The adjustments also now [b]avoid the vanilla quirk[/b] where sometimes a lower Class starship could have a larger Stat Bonus than a higher Class starship of the same type. Now higher Class starships should always have larger Stat Bonuses than lower Class starship of the same type.
[*] ﻿[b]Shuttles [/b]("Normal" weight)[b] [/b]have their [b]Damage[/b] bonuses increased by [b]1.4x[/b], [b]Hyperdrive Range[/b] bonuses increased by [b]3.7x[/b], and their [b]Shield [/b]bonus increased by [b]3.75x[/b] at Class S. Their new Class S [b]Agility[/b] bonus is [b]+15%[/b], giving them [b]~1,000 Maneuverability[/b] maxed out before supercharged slots. Additionally, they now get small bonuses to all stats at [b]Class C[/b] ([b]+0.8%~4%,[/b] before factoring in the above increases) instead of no bonuses. They have [b]+5 Cargo [/b]slots maximum capacity, matching their increased early-game storage. This should make them more viable later in the game as a sort of "Jack of all Trades" similar to how Exotics are in Vanilla, and makes it more comfortable to continue using one in the early game before you can afford the more expensive ships. Compared to PTSd Exotics they fall behind in nearly every stat but aside from their price, their Launch Cost & Cargo Slots are also significantly better than Exotics.
[*] [b] ﻿Fighters[/b] ("Light" weight) have their [b]Damage [/b]bonus increased by [b]x1.33 [/b]and [b]Shield [/b]bonus by[b] 1.33x [/b]at all Classes, to make them stand out more clearly as the best damage-dealers, but glass cannons. Their new Class S [b]Agility[/b] bonus is [b]+50%[/b], giving them [b]~1,500 Maneuverability[/b] maxed out before supercharged slots. They have [b]+4 Tech slots[/b] maximum capacity, to potentially hold more weapon tech/upgrades.
[*] [b] ﻿Haulers[/b] ("Heavy" weight) have their [b]Damage [/b]bonus decreased to [b]x0.9, [/b][b]Shield [/b]bonus increased by [b]~2.9x[/b], and their[b] Hyperdrive[/b] Range bonus increased by [b]1.2x[/b] at all Classes. Their new [b]Agility[/b] bonus at all Classes is [b]+0%[/b], giving them [b]~750 Maneuverability[/b] maxed out before supercharged slots. With poor handling and low Damage bonus, it takes a lot of shields to "make up" for a lack of combat-readiness. They have [b]-4 Tech slots[/b], but [b]+25 Cargo slots[/b] maximum capacity. They should now have a viable niche as "haulers".
[*] [b] ﻿Explorers[/b] ("Light" weight) have their [b]Shield [/b]bonus increased by[b] 3.2x[/b] (including small bonuses at C Class instead of 0), and their [b]Hyperdrive Range[/b] bonus increased by [b]2.95x [/b]at [b]Class S[/b], so they should now always noticeably beat other ship types of equivalent Class for Hyperdrive Range bonus. They should be able to reach ~8k ly when maxed out now. Their new Class S [b]Agility[/b] bonus is [b]+30%[/b], giving them [b]~1,300 Maneuverability[/b] maxed out before supercharged slots. They have [b]+10 Tech slots[/b] maximum capacity, to help hold more upgrades & Ship Trail techs to boost Hyperdrive range even farther.
[*] ﻿ ﻿[b]Solars [/b]("Light" weight) have their [b]Damage [/b]bonus decreased to [b]0.94x[/b], [b]Shield [/b]bonus increased by [b]1.88x[/b], and [b]Hyperdrive Range[/b] bonus reduced to [b]0.9x[/b] at S Class. Their new Class S [b]Agility[/b] bonus is [b]-15%[/b], giving them [b]~850 Maneuverability[/b] maxed out before supercharged slots, and their boosting speed starts around 0.75x other "Light" ships, but is roughly the same once maxed out.  Their [b]Pulse Jump[/b] (using spacebar) speed is increased by [b]1.5x[/b] so it will now be faster than all other ships including Corvettes (especially with supercharged Vesper Sails). Their [b]Pulse Engine fuel discount[/b] is reduced to ~[b]0.3x[/b] (from -80% discount to -25% discount, but when factoring in their high Pulse Jump speed this works out to a 50% fuel savings compared to standard starships), and their Launcher Auto-charge bonus is [b]removed[/b], but replaced with a [b]-25% discount to take-off cost[/b]. They have[b] +5 Cargo[/b] slots maximum capacity. This fits them more into a "speedy cargo smuggler" archetype, with their focus being on the best Pulse Jumping.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Note that due to the way that Solar Ships have their boosting speed reduced in PTSd, [b]supercharging [/b]their Vesper Sail tech will [b]reduce [/b]Boosting Speed, while still improving Pulse Jump speed / fuel efficiency & launch cost (description now notes this). (Lore explanation: Perhaps a tradeoff for tuning the delicate solar sails to optimize for Pulse travel vs. normal engine travel) However, again due to the diminishing returns of Boost Speed, once the ship is maxed out, the speed reduction from the Vesper Sail becomes very slight, even when supercharged. 
[*] [b] ﻿Exotics [/b]("Light" weight) have their[b] [/b][b]Damage [/b]bonus decreased to[b] 0.7x[/b][b], Shield [/b]bonus increased by [b]2x[/b], and their [b]Hyperdrive[/b][b] Range[/b] bonus increased by [b]1.7x [/b]at S Class. Their new Class S [b]Agility[/b] bonus is [b]+20%[/b], giving them [b]~1,200 Maneuverability[/b] maxed out before supercharged slots. To fit their old "small inventory" archetype, instead of a bonus they have [b]-5 Cargo slots[/b] maximum capacity. While most other ships have improved even more, they should stay as an appealing all-rounder with a niche of being the only well-protected "combat" ship with the 2nd best Shield bonus. They have a similar stat distribution to Shuttles, however nearly every possible stat is higher for Exotics (including price), with the exceptions of Launch Cost & Cargo Slots. (While Exotics can normally only ever be encountered at Class S, because PTSd allows you to redeem the expedition reward Starborn Runner at Class C instead, the stat bonuses & slot upgrade limits at Classes C, B, & A for Exotics now smoothly progress up to Class S like other starships, instead of being equally high at all Classes.)
[*] [b]Living Ships[/b] ("Heavy" weight) have their [b]Damage[/b][b] [/b]bonus decreased to [b]0.8x, [/b][b]Shield [/b]bonus increased by[b] 2.3x, [/b]and [b]Hyperdrive Range[/b] bonus increased by[b] 2.7x [/b]at S Class, giving them a focus on long-distance travel with the 2nd best Hyperdrive (should reach ~6.4k ly when maxed out) while still OK at combat. Their new Class S [b]Agility[/b] bonus is [b]+50%[/b], giving them [b]~1,000 Maneuverability[/b] maxed out before supercharged slots. Similar to their old vanilla stats, they have [b]+8 Tech[/b] slots maximum capacity compared to the "baseline". The procedural upgrade modules for Launchers for Living Ships now [b]also boost ship speed[/b], as they do for regular ships. And thanks to an adaptation of [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/mods/1598]Living Ship Upgrades﻿ by LazMonk[/url]﻿, their base[b] Maneuverability [/b]has been increased [b]1.25x[/b] to roughly match Shuttles. While their eventual max speed is still tied for slowest with Haulers, they start out initially faster than Haulers until diminishing returns on upgrade modules kicks in. Also, you can [b]install Teleport Receivers[/b] in them ([b]Grasping Tendrils[/b] gives the same distance bonus, and can be installed together to double the distance as now noted in the description), Starshield Batteries can be used to restore their shields, and the mission timers for the Living Ship quests are [b]8 hrs[/b] instead of [b]24 hrs[/b]. Living Ship [b]S Class Launcher upgrades[/b] no longer have [b]auto-charging[/b] as a bonus, as there is a dedicated tech for that on Living Ships now. [b]Psychonic Eggs[/b] now have just a [b]~10% chance[/b] of yielding the [b]Chloroplast Membrane[/b] tech (Launcher auto-charge) or [b]Saline Membrane[/b] (Water Landing) and [b]~50% chance[/b] to give the [b]Wormhole Brain[/b] / [b]Neural Shielding[/b] techs instead of it being virtually guaranteed (though as in vanilla, Psychonic Eggs will never yield a tech you already have in an accessible inventory or installed in your active ship). Since Living Ships cannot install the [b]Sub-Light Amplifier[/b], their core Engine tech now has a weaker version of the same effect, at [b]+20% Pulse Jump speed[/b] (can be further boosted by supercharging). The nanite price for "buying" additional Living Ships after completing Starbirth is reduced 0.8x. Living Ships had a lot against them in vanilla, so they have received a lot of improvements to make them more appealing.
[/list][list]
[*][b] ﻿ ﻿﻿Sentinel Interceptors [/b]("Abnormal" weight) have their[b] Damage [/b]bonus increased by[b] x1.15[/b],[b] [/b][b]Shield [/b]bonus increased by [b]1.5x[/b], and their [b]Hyperdrive[/b][b] Range[/b] bonus increased by [b]1.6x [/b]at all Classes. Their new Class S [b]Agility[/b] bonus is [b]+80%[/b], giving them [b]~1,900 Maneuverability[/b] maxed out before supercharged slots. ﻿This gives them the second best damage and low shields slightly better than a Fighter, but with lower max speed / acceleration and better maneuverability, especially while boosting. They have no inventory bonuses, being optimized for maneuverability instead of storage. Their unique Hyperdrive tech still starts at 600 ly range, but now has the normal warp cell efficiency instead of double. They will start out with the best Hyperdrive range before upgrades or Class bonuses, but quickly lose to most other starships once they gain higher classes and more upgrade modules, ending up roughly tied with Solar ships for second-worst range once maxed out. By forgoing any hyperdrive upgrades and using the generous base jump distance, you can have more tech slots available for other things. Launch cost discount reduced from -50% to -20%. Enough to still make 3 takeoffs on a single tank, but will need at least one other upgrade aside from "Efficient Thrusters" to make 4 takeoffs on a single tank. No longer has innate Launch Fuel recharging without installing special tech. Can now install Teleport Receiver tech, like Living Ship. Increased the 10% bonus to Pulse Jump Speed to 20% (still lower than Solar Ships in PTSd), and in addition they get a -10% discount to Pulse Jump fuel usage. Like Living Ships, Interceptors can now also use [b]Starshield Batteries[/b] to recharge shields in addition to Radiant Shards / Sodium Nitrate, but can no longer use Sodium. [b]Radiant Shard stacksize[/b] is [b]tripled [/b]since you may need to carry many with you to recharge shields in battle. Since Radiant Shards always refill technology to full charge, the "tank size" for the Interceptor's Hyperdrive & Pulse Drive have been [b]reduced 0.4x[/b], so they effectively only give 0.4x as much fuel to the Hyperdrive / Pulse Engine.
[*]﻿﻿ ﻿ ﻿[b]Corvettes[/b][b] [/b]("Corvette" weight) are more difficult to categorize and compare to standard starships due to how heavily they can be customized with [b]Corvette Modules[/b]. With several new debuffs tied to Corvette Cockpits, the main concept for Corvettes is now that they [b]start off worse[/b] than standard starships in many respects, but with the powerful bonuses from modules they can [b]match or exceed[/b] any standard starship in several ways. However due to many bonuses coming from modules in shared "groups" with one another,  the player must choose between "spreading out" the bonuses across various stats to offset the initial Corvette debuffs as a "jack of all trades", or specializing and focusing on a few stats to make the Corvette as good or better than a standard ship in that respect, but worse off in other areas. (As in vanilla, if the player chooses a small Corvette with few modules to grant bonuses, the tradeoff is there will be more tech inventory room to install standard upgrade modules instead)
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Corvette [b]base stats[/b] adjusted to be roughly on the [b]low end[/b] of most "standard" starships (before adding any bonuses from Corvette modules), but with [b]+25 maximum tech[/b] slots to hold all the Corvette module bonuses. Initial slots on a new Corvette are no longer slightly randomized, but should always be exactly [b]9 cargo[/b], [b]21 tech[/b] slots.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Adjusted the strength of bonuses for Corvette modules and [b]eliminated the randomness[/b] of the bonus strength. Now a particular type of Corvette module will always give the exact same strength of bonus when installed, and thus will match the strength shown in the Corvette editor.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Default Corvette launch cost increased [b]1.4x[/b], meaning it [b]cannot be summoned[/b] (unless it is currently hovering in atmosphere, which is always free) without additional landing gear / Azimuth Reactors, or launcher upgrades. However with enough landing gear / Azimuth Reactors, the cost can become extremely low, even below Explorers.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Similarly, Default Corvette Pulse Jump fuel consumption rate increased [b]1.3x[/b], Pulse Jump speed reduced to [b]0.8x[/b], and Boost Speed reduced to [b]0.8x[/b], but these can all be improved with appropriate Corvette modules / Reactors / standard upgrade modules to generally match or exceed a typical starship.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Corvette base Pulse Jump Speed [b]reduced [/b]from 3x down to match standard starships (but can achieve higher Pulse Jump speeds than even Solar ships with the right Corvette Modules)
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Modules which add cargo slots (Habs & Walkways) now also [b]slightly reduce[/b] Boost Speed and Maneuverability, since the vanilla mechanic for making larger Corvettes slower does not appear to be working currently. Like other Corvette module groups, this only applies to at most 5 installed modules
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿The 4 different Reactor modules for Corvettes are now in a [b]single [/b]"reactor" module group, meaning you can only gain stat bonuses from 5 reactors total, instead of 5 of each type of reactor. This both reduces how many tech slots are taken up and allows the option to specialize Corvettes into different roles instead of always being jack-of-all-trades when maxed out. The choice of which combination of Reactor(s) to install should now have a big influence on the performance of the Corvette. (Can be reverted with the MergeCorvetteReactorGroups & MergeCorvetteWeaponGroups toggles in PTSd Starship Tech Changes.lua)
[*] ﻿ ﻿Similarly, all Corvette weapon modules are now in a [b]single [/b]"defensive systems" module group. This means you have the choice between having one extremely powerful weapon with the others being quite weak (due to the Corvette's low Damage bonus stat), or having 2 or 3 weapons which are each moderately powerful, allowing to swap against different defenses or when one is close to overheating, while still remaining strong. However, each Weapon Module also comes with a [b]small malus[/b] to Shield Strength.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Corvette Modules given as [b]expedition awards[/b] (e.g. Deadeye Cannon, Aeron Drive/Powershield, etc.) also require [b]1-3 Recycled Circuitry[/b] to install, in order to have a cost similar to the value of an equivalent "standard" Corvette Module.
[*] ﻿ ﻿Fixed [b]vanilla bug[/b] with Corvette Torpedo Launcher wrongly applying to Cyclotron Ballista instead of Rockets
[*] ﻿ ﻿Shield Generators are now also part of the [b]same [/b]"group" as weapon modules, but also give [b]added bonuses[/b] in different areas, like a [b]mini-reactor[/b]. This allows you to choose to sacrifice offensive power by installing fewer weapon modules and using those "slots" to install a few shield generators instead to further boost other stats and defenses (on top of not getting the Shield Strength malus from weapon modules).
[*] ﻿ ﻿Removed Launcher auto-recharging effect from all Corvette modules which had that bonus
[*] ﻿ ﻿Changed & [b]differentiated[/b] the bonuses for the different styles of Engines. Heavy Booster engines give mostly [b]Boost Speed[/b], Sublight Thrusters give mostly [b]Pulse Jump speed[/b], and small rear-mounted engines give mostly [b]Maneuverability[/b] (twin-thruster versions give even more Maneuverability, single-thruster versions give a little less in exchange for extra Boost speed). This means the player must choose which stat to prioritize, as bonuses will only be granted by up to 5 engines.
[*] ﻿ ﻿Similarly, the different landing gears give a different balance between [b]Launch Cost[/b] and [b]Pulse Jump fuel efficiency[/b], potentially also offering a bonus to [b]Boost Speed[/b] or [b]Maneuverability [/b]in exchange for a smaller Launch/Pulse Jump fuel discount.
[*] ﻿ ﻿Decorative exterior Cargo Pods are now [b]purely cosmetic[/b] and do not add cargo slots or take up tech slots
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿"[b]Basic Corvette Parts[/b]" (purchased directly from the Corvette Workshop) can [b]now be used to trade[/b] for "[b]Advanced Corvette Parts[/b]" at the Workshop. However, this is still much less economical than searching for Advanced Corvette Parts as loot yourself, since Trading for items only counts a fraction of the value of the items you offer for trade.
[*] ﻿ ﻿ ﻿Certain Corvette modules with special animations or particle effects (such as landing gears and certain wings) which only used to animate up to 4 modules, now will [b]animate up to 6 modules[/b] (since PTSd incentivizes installing at least 5 of all the core modules)
[/list][/spoiler]
[b][size=3]Multi-Tool Balance Changes[/size][/b]
[spoiler]
[list]
[*][b]New Multi-Tool features:[/b]
[*]﻿ ﻿ ﻿Your Multi-Tool's [b]Mining stat[/b] now directly affects [b]how much substances you mine[/b], in addition to mining speed (tech & upgrade descriptions now note this). E.G. A Mining stat of +30% means you get 30% more substances than normal (not counting the slow "trickle" you get before you fully destroy the object). This stacks with the "Optical Drill" tech's +33% bonus, or supercharging the base Mining Laser / Optical Drill tech. Also note that this stacks with the mining bonus of Radiation Storms (1.75x in PTSd), as long as you are not in a cave/building/vehicle when you harvest. Also corrected an oversight in vanilla NMS for how it handles Mining Speed bonuses based on Multi-Tool's type stat bonuses. 
[*] ﻿ ﻿Your Multi-Tool's [b]Scan stat[/b] now directly affects [b]how many units you get from scanning Fauna, Flora, & Minerals[/b], in addition to your "scan pulse" radius (tech & upgrade descriptions now note this). E.G. A Scan stat of +100% means you get double the normal amount of units for scanning things. 
[*] ﻿ ﻿Your Multi-Tool's [b]Damage stat[/b] now [b]no longer also increases mining speed[/b], so Multi-Tool types with high "Damage" bonuses but low "Mining" bonuses should be noticeably slower at mining than ones with high "Mining" but low "Damage", as presumably intended. (Technically PTSd causes the "Damage" stat bonus to slow down the "tickrate" the mining laser deals damage at, but since the Damage stat also increased the damage per tick of the mining laser they now cancel each other out)
[*]Multi-Tools can only be found with [b]initial slots[/b] up to [b]16[/b], instead of[b] [/b][b]24~30 [/b]in vanilla, and [b]maximum upgradable[/b] size is now [b]24 slots[/b] instead of 60 in vanilla. Small/Medium/Large style multitools now have more distinct amounts of initial slots. This allows Multi-Tool expansion slots to retain some use, as you won't be finding any already maxed-out Multi-Tools.
[*] ﻿ ﻿A hidden benefit for [b]smaller[/b] sized Multi-Tools is that their supercharged slots are more likely to be grouped towards the left half of their inventories compared to larger Multi-Tools. This both makes it more likely to unlock and discover the supercharged slots sooner while upgrading them, but also a little more likely that supercharged slots [b]might be adjacent[/b] to one another as there are fewer possible slots for them to appear in. (This same behavior also exists in vanilla, but has been amplified in [i]PTSd[/i])
[*]The chart below shows how various attributes will compare against each other in-game for S Class Multi-Tools assuming the Mining Beam (or alternative) is supercharged, factoring in all the changes made by [i]PTSd[/i]. "[b]Resources/object[/b]" shows how much substances you get per mined rock/tree/crystal/metal finger/etc. and "[b]Resources/sec[/b]" shows how quickly you can receive substances while mining, taking into account both how quickly you mine rocks/trees and how much substances each will contain.
[*][img]https://imgur.com/BUWxnxT.png[/img][url=https://imgur.com/BUWxnxT.png]PTSd Multi-Tool Stats chart link[/url]﻿﻿﻿﻿
[/list][list]
[*] ﻿ [b]﻿[/b]*Sentinel Multi-Tools [b]﻿[/b]have a unique Mining Laser variant, Hijacked Laser, explained below
[*] ﻿[b]﻿[/b]**Atlantid Multi-Tools [b]﻿[/b]have a unique Mining Laser variant, Runic Lens, explained below
[*][b]Multi-Tool attribute rebalance[/b]: As with starships, the values below are the changes from [b][url=https://nomanssky.fandom.com/wiki/Multi-Tool?so=search#Class]the vanilla stat bonuses[/url]﻿[/b] at S Class. The full change details can be seen in the .lua﻿, but the main points are:
[*] ﻿﻿[b]Pistols [/b](Small)[b] [/b]have their [b]Mining [/b]bonus increased by [b]1.29x [/b]at Class S, and [b]Scan [/b]bonus reduced to [b]0.7x[/b] at all Classes. This sets them up as a good cheap tool for mining and OK scanning early on, but will eventually become outclassed by other multi-tools you find later on.
[*] ﻿ ﻿[b]Rifles [/b](Large)[b] [/b]have their [b]Damage [/b]bonus increased by [b]1.25x[/b], and [b]Scan[/b] bonus reduced to 0.75x[b] [/b]. This lets them beat Experimentals for damage, but Alien or Royals will still be higher. Along with Pistols they are one of the only tools/ships/exocrafts which can become truly obsolete in PTSd, their role is similar to Vanilla Shuttles for ships: Easy to find early on, and start with a lot of slots, but eventually you will find something better.
[*] ﻿[b]Experimentals [/b](Small/Medium) have their [b]Damage [/b]bonus reduced to [b]0.8x[/b], [b]Mining [/b]bonus increased [b]1.33x[/b], and [b]Scan [/b]bonus increased by [b]1.3x [/b]at all Classes, and now have a small range of possible Scan bonuses at S class instead of a single possible value in vanilla. They won't beat Pistols or Rifles in Mining or Damage, but have the clear best Scan stat of all tools.
[*] [b] ﻿Royals [/b](Medium) are now different from Experimentals, and have their [b]Damage [/b]bonus increased by [b]1.4x[/b], [b]Mining [/b]by [b]1.93x[/b], and [b]Scan [/b]reduced by [b]0.9x [/b]at Class S, and now have a small range of possible Scan bonuses at S class instead of a single possible value in vanilla.  Their final S Class bonuses now put them in a similar spot to vanilla Exotic ships, being a high-level "jack of all trades", although not the highest in any particular stat. They have the second-best Scanning, third-best Resources/sec, and middle-of-the-road Damage.
[*] [b] ﻿Aliens[/b] (Small/Medium) have their [b]Damage [/b]bonus increased by [b]1.71x[/b], and [b]Scan [/b]reduced to [b]0.8x [/b]at all Classes. They are similar to Experimentals: the best at Damage, and just OK at everything else.
[/list][list]
[*][b] ﻿ ﻿﻿Sentinel Multi-Tools[/b] (Medium/Large) have their [b]Damage [/b]bonus reduced to [b]0.8x[/b], [b]Mining [/b]bonus increased by [b]1.67x, [/b]and [b]Scan [/b]increased to [b]~1.1x [/b]at S Class. This gives them the third-best damage just ahead of Royals, and OK scanning in the middle of the pack, a little ahead of Aliens. However, they also come with the unique Hijacked Laser mining laser replacement, which in PTSd has been retooled into both a potent weapon and unconventional way to mine objects very quickly but yielding fewer resources per object and at a high fuel cost, allowing it to reach the highest resources/second in many situations. Also, Hijacked Laser Resources/sec rate only drops to [b]~0.83x[/b] of its supercharged rate when [b]not supercharged[/b], unlike the Mining Beam or Runic Lens which drop to [b]~0.58x[/b] of their supercharged rate when not supercharged. So even if leaving the Hijacked Laser [b]un-supercharged[/b], you can potentially get Resources/sec as good or better than other multi-tools (except for Atlantids) even if they use a supercharged mining beam. (Intended to be used [b]instead of[/b] the Mining Laser, not [b]stacked[/b] with it. See Weapon changes above).
[*][b] ﻿ ﻿﻿﻿Atlantid Multi-Tools [/b](Medium/Large) have their [b]Damage [/b]bonus unchanged, [b]Mining [/b]bonus increased to [b]1.25x, [/b]and [b]Scan [/b]increased to [b]1.6x [/b]at S Class, as a kind of "[b]advanced Pistol[/b]". With adjustments made to the unique Runic Lens laser (detailed in the Weapons section above), this means that it will yield significantly [b]more resources per object[/b] than other multi-tools, but due to the reduced laser damage it will [b]yield slightly fewer resources per second[/b] than Sentinel Multi-tools using the Hijacked Laser. As opposed to the Hijacked Laser, the Runic Lens will shine in situations where you are mining rarer objects you do not often come across or in small groups (such as Metal Fingers, Mutant Plants, Di-Hydrogen Crystals, etc.) to maximise the resources obtained. And unlike the Hijacked Laser, it has the default fuel consumption / recharge rate and a more forgiving heatup time than the regular Mining Laser. (Intended to be used [b]instead of[/b] the Mining Laser, not [b]stacked[/b] with it. See Weapon changes above)
[*][b] ﻿ ﻿﻿﻿Voltaic Staff [/b](Large) have their [b]Damage [/b]bonus reduced to [b]0.9x[/b], [b]Mining [/b]bonus increased to [b]3.33x, [/b]and [b]Scan [/b]increased to [b]1.6x [/b]at S Class. Instead of being identical to Sentinel Multi-tools, now set up as a kind of "[b]alternative jack of all trades[/b]" similar to Royal Multi-tools: Has better damage than Royals, but lower Mining and Scanning. The damage is still below Alien Multi-tools, the Scanning is still below Royals & Experimentals, and the Resources/sec is below Royals, Atlantids, and Sentinels.
[/list][/spoiler]

[size=5][b][center]Usage[/center][/b]
[/size]PTSd alters many relevant [b]in-game item/tech/difficulty setting descriptions and dialogue options[/b] so that generally anything critically important can be found simply by paying attention to [b]in-game text[/b] (in English, for other languages see the [b]Customization [/b]section below). By default PTSd is mainly balanced around using the "[b]Survival[/b]" preset and[color=#ffffff][font=Roboto, sans-serif] not using the the starship target assist, although of course you can choose/change any of the in-game Difficulty Settings or Controls to make things easier/harder as you like[/font][/color]. Also, some of the [b]Recommended Mods[/b] below work very well alongside PTSd.

Generally PTSd aims to address different playstyles / strategies directly, however there were a few things I was unable to change (although again, many of these should have in-game reminders in the relevant UI descriptions / dialogue window):[spoiler]
[list]
[*]While PTSd has the biggest impact when starting a new save file, it also works on existing saves. If continuing an [u]existing non-PTSd save[/u], several things such as which recipes are unlocked from the start, various inventory sizes, the stats of your existing starships / freighter / multitools will retain their old values. Upgrading its Class (A to S, etc.) will cause it to use updated stats, or you can use a [url=https://github.com/goatfungus/NMSSaveEditor]Save Editor[/url]﻿ to manually change the inventory sizes & stats to match PTSd values, or to forget certain recipes such as Freighter Trade, Refiner, or Cultivation Rooms, or Freighter Storage Rooms higher than Room #0. Also be aware of possibly losing some resources from full stacks if changing to a smaller stack size.
[*]It should be safe to disable PTSd and continue playing the savefile in Vanilla, or even to temporarily disable PTSd and re-enable it later on, although you may need to re-install any of the few PTSd-added techs afterwards and may now know some recipes which PTSd leaves unknown by default. Just be aware of how high you have your valuable resources stacked if moving to a lower stack size, or the stats/slots of any starships/freighters/multitools you acquire or upgrade the Class of with PTSd uninstalled.
[*]Since [b]Community Expeditions[/b] often change up the normal gameplay progression, sometimes PTSd will "[b]block[/b]" progression within an expedition by requiring certain items / materials the player can't get access to in order to build items / tech required to advance the expedition. Generally these are the early Atlas Seeds ([i]Captured Nanode[/i], [i]Englobed Shade[/i], [i]Noospheric Orb[/i], [i]Dark Matter[/i], [i]Dawn's End[/i], [i]Photic Jade[/i]), so if starting an Expedition from an existing save you can simply bring these items with you to avoid this issue in most cases. However if you do get stuck, you can try temporarily setting [b]Crafting Costs[/b] to "[b]Free[/b]" in the in-game settings, use a [url=https://github.com/goatfungus/NMSSaveEditor]Save Editor[/url]﻿ to give you the needed items / tech, or temporarily disable the relevant PTSd module while you craft the required item. For most cases with an issue during an Expedition, I believe the only module you should need to temporarily disable while crafting any needed items / techs would be the "PTSd Prices and Tech and Starship Speed and More" module (specifically, to disable the "PTSd Tech + Upgrade + Recipe + Blueprint cost Rebalance.lua" and possibly the "PTSd Resource + Product + Construction Rebalance.lua" .lua files which make changes to tech & item blueprints/recipes).
[*]However enabling the option to set [b]Crafting Costs to "Free"[/b] during an [b]Expedition [/b](as a potential temporary workaround for when gathering the required ingredients for an item's PTSd recipe is not possible during an Expedition), requires manually setting "[b]CraftingIsFree[/b]" to true in the "[b]SEASON_DATA_CACHE.JSON[/b]" file of the cache folder of your savegame folder, "\AppData\Roaming\HelloGames\NMS" by default for Steam on Windows. (This edit just makes it possible to set Crafting to free via the Difficulty Setting menu in the Expedition, it doesn't directly make crafting free)
[*]If playing on [b][u]Permadeath[/u][/b], it's highly recommended to still [b]periodically back up your save files[/b], given how it's possible that some of the changes may inadvertently lead to unexpected insta-kills, especially on top of any vanilla glitches. (E.G. in past PTSd versions planetary [b]Pirate Raids[/b] could be [b]instantly fatal[/b] in certain locations)
[*]The mod is balanced around [b]not using the initial free freighter[/b]. The best workaround I know so far is to just do it on the "honor system": either continually [b]reject the free freighter offers[/b] until you buy your own, or accept the initial free freighter, rename it to "No Man's Freighter" or something, and then [b]never interact with or set foot on it until you are able to purchase a new freighter[/b] of your own (and then take into account the trade-in value of the free freighter when buying your "real" freighter). 
[*]I haven't found way to effectively alter exosuit Cargo inventory, so currently balanced around stopping at [b]40 Exosuit Cargo slots[/b] (only upgrading it 16 times from the initial size of 24) and [b]40 Exosuit Tech Slots[/b] (only upgrading it 35 times from the initial size of 5).
[*][b]Sentinel[/b] & [b]Atlantid[/b] Multi-Tools are balanced assuming that you are using their unique mining laser alternatives ([b]Hijacked Laser[/b] & [b]Runic Lens[/b]) by themselves, not stacked alongside the default Mining Laser.
[*]I haven't yet found a way to make "normal" Sentinel Pillars work the same way the ones do in the "Trace of Metal" questline, so it is just on the "honor system" to actually [b]defeat the nearby drones / Sentinel Mech before using the terminal[/b] to shutdown all planetary Sentinels.
[*]Similarly on the "honor system" to defeat the attacking Pirates before docking with a freighter for the reward.
[*]I wanted to avoid changing much related to Nexus Missions / multiplayer activities, so again it would be on the "honor system" not to use the free system warp that many Nexus missions start with to gather [b]currently unavailable resources such as Cadmium / Emeril / Indium [/b]before you have the appropriate Drive technology.
[*]It's also on the "honor system" to use your starship's warp drive to travel between space stations / trade outposts in different systems for doing bulk buying/selling of trade goods / illegal contraband instead of safely using your Freighter's teleporter / hyperdrive and/or Freighter base Trade Terminal. (There is an optional setting in ﻿[b]gBase Items BasicX.lua[/b] for users to optionally disable the player from constructing Teleporters in bases or freighters. The player can still teleport to their base / freighter regardless. Similarly, there is a toggle [b]FreighterRoomsPlanetside[/b] in [b]gBase Items BasicX.lua[/b] to control whether you can construct Freighter-only objects / rooms in planetside bases or not.)
[*]Finally, as with most gameplay-altering mods, [b]playing in multiplayer[/b] when not all the party members are using the same mod loadout makes it likely that you and others will see / experience more different things. E.G. the number / position of enemy sentinels / starships, or the current weather. However, this is all [b]generally the case in vanilla NMS as well[/b] due to how it handles multiplayer.[/spoiler]
[/list][b][u]Current Known Issue:[/u][/b][list]
[*]When Multi-Tool Mining Lasers overheat, the UI (in 3rd person mode) may incorrectly show a shorter vanilla cooldown time, so you may still need to wait several seconds after the overheat bar empties before you can use the Mining Laser again. These changes to the overheating cooldown can be toggled off in "[b]PTSd Weapons Rebalance.lua[/b]"
[*]In past PTSd versions there have been issues with the buffs to pirates interacting with vanilla bugs resulting in planetary [b]Pirate Raids[/b] in certain locations being instantly fatal. Hopefully these issues are now resolved, but as a failsafe, there is a toggle to completely disable planetary pirate raids at the top of "[b]PTSd Other Difficulty Settings[/b].lua".
[*]There is an existing issue which causes the "[b]Space Rescue[/b]" mission for rescuing a freighter from small pirate starships when warping to a new system to sometimes disappear, I'm still looking into possible solutions. In the meantime, reportedly the mission still works when triggered by hanging out near idle freighters in a system instead of warping to a new systems every X hours & Y warps.
[*][b]Aquarius Expedition[/b] specific issue: [spoiler]To complete the "[b]Freedom of the Sea[/b]" milestone in the [b]Aquarius Expedition[/b], you will need to temporarily disable the [b]PTSd Missions and Rewards[/b] module while you release the 3 fish. (Technically you can just temporarily set [i]ReplaceVanillaFishNanites [/i]to [i]false [/i]in [b]PTSd Rewards Remixer.lua[/b] instead and re-pak the module with AMUSS).[/spoiler]
[/list]
[center][size=5][b]T[/b][b]ips & Expectation-Setting[/b][/size][/center]
Some general advice for the different playstyle PTSd is aimed at:[spoiler][list]
[*]Both planetary and space combat is intended to be difficult enough that while you should still be able to handle minor threats right from the start, ideally [b]you should be unable to defeat every possible enemy with just starting C class Multi-Tools / Ships[/b] and no additional weapons / shields / upgrade Modules. Things such as large groups of pirates, "Hard" level random Bounties / Pirate-hunting space station missions, or Sentinel Mechs / Walkers will typically require much better equipment, tech, and upgrade modules to take down. [b]Avoiding [/b]or [b]bribing [/b]enemy ships early on is much safer, and the less valuables you carry the cheaper bribing will be. And for hostile fauna (which are more active at night) [b]Creature Pellets[/b] can effectively be a way to bribe them into leaving you alone.
[*]The initial trek to your crashed starship on new saves can be one of the most difficult parts of a PTSd playthrough. Aside from the in-game PTSd-added suggestions to find caves to rest & craft Ion Batteries to deal with environmental hazards, some other useful options include destroying hazardous flora for Oxygen, or temporarily reducing the [b]Survival Difficulty[/b] setting until reaching your starship. As a last resort, one might consider using Photo Mode to scout for nearby caves while time is "paused".
[*]Since the starter multi-tool still comes with 0 bonuses just as in vanilla, getting a better C or B Class Multi-Tool as soon as possible can make a noticeable difference, as does getting a few cheap C Class shield/weapon upgrade modules for your starship at your first space station. In particular since your Multi-Tool's [b]Mining[/b] and [b]Scan [/b]stats now directly affect the resources & units you receive from mining & scanning, getting a decent Pistol can help a lot early on. And since the adjacency bonuses for many upgrade modules can be stronger than the modules itself, getting 3~6 C Class upgrades positioned well might be stronger than just one or two A/S class upgrades.
[*]Dealing with the [b]reduced inventory size[/b] can be helped early on by making use of the improved range of the [b]Teleport Receiver[/b] which can make your ship act as a sort of "second backpack", or using [b]Exocraft [/b]as "mobile storage containers" you can summon to any planet if you keep geobay ingredients on you.
[*]Similarly, to help with the [b]increased distance[/b] of many "Target Sweep" missions, using either a [b]ridable pet[/b] buffed with some recommended mods below,  the [b]buffed Rocket Boots[/b] tech, or [b]buffed Exocrafts[/b] can help you get around faster. 
[*]For collecting larger amounts of resources, since the fully automated mineral & gas extractors have more restrictions and require Indium to start using, you may get more use out of the cheaper PTSd-buffed "fuel-powered" alternatives until later in the game (the [b]AMU[/b], [b]Oxygen Harvester[/b], etc.). Since they all now complete a cycle in [b]10 minutes[/b] (or just hit "C" to half-fuel them for 5 minutes if needed), keeping construction materials in your starship and placing multiple nearby when you land on a planet can collect resources while you do other tasks until you return to your ship. Or, consider having some placed at your home base that you refuel & replace each time you return home to run while you sort out your inventory, tend to crops, run refiners, etc. Especially if you use some short-range teleporters to quickly access multiple deposits. Alternatively, making use of how a Multi-Tool's Mining stat increases yield in PTSd, alongside supercharging the Mining Laser and Optical Drill, and using the Mining yield boost of a Radiation Storm, you can get around [b]~6x[/b] the base substance yield with an S Class Pistol.
[*]Higher Ship Class makes a bigger difference in PTSd, as do Pulse Engine / Launcher upgrades if attempting to outrun enemy starships. I recommend first having reserves of Sodium Nitrate / Starshield Batteries on hand if planning to engage in prolonged space combat, as you ship shield will likely go down quickly & often.  The [b]Emergency Warp Unit[/b] and [b]Cargo Scan Deflector[/b] may be very appealing early-game, as they can let you escape or avoid unwinnable space encounters early on (The Cargo Scan Deflector works on Pirates as well as Sentinels).
[*]For both Multi-Tools & Starships, a big advantage of higher Classes in PTSD is the additional Supercharged Tech slots, since for combat having the core weapon tech on a Supercharged slot is almost mandatory to have a fighting chance against many enemies, especially early on.
[*]Remember on death you will only lose items in the Inventory of whatever your current mode of transport is, so if your ship goes down, items in your Exosuit or Exocraft will be safe.
[*]Similarly, [b]do not expect to be able to complete all 5 possible Frigate Expeditions each day[/b] without having high-level Frigates and an assortment of Frigate-boosting upgrade modules in your Freighter.
[*]The intention behind removing many of the "quick & easy" money-making schemes while making most tech / upgrades / blueprints / starships more expensive to obtain, is that when faced with a particular item that is currently out of reach, the player might just [b]continue with other quests / endeavors and making do without the item [/b]while "[b]saving up[/b]" for the item in the meantime. This is opposed to dropping everything else to do nothing but continually grind for the missing resource, which will likely take a while now.
[*]Checking [b]in-game descriptions[/b] for technology/items/equipment can be useful, as PTSd [b]adds some clarification[/b] to certain descriptions to either explain unintuitive vanilla mechanics or list changes made by PTSd.[/spoiler]
[/list]
[size=5][b][center]Customization[/center][/b][/size]
While there was a good deal of testing & spreadsheets involved in tuning PTSd, ultimately balance and difficulty are [b]subjective [/b]things. However, as explained in the first few bullet points of the "[b]General Difficulty Changes[/b]" section above, you can now adjust much of this in-game through the various [b]Difficulty Settings[/b] options. Also, since the [b].lua files[/b] for PTSd are provided, you can open them with most text editors such as Notepad++ and change the values to your liking, then [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/mods/2626]run the .luas through AMUMSS[/url] to make your personal version of the mod with different values. (Note that running all the default PTSd .lua files through AMUMSS will result in 5 Warnings & 4 Notices, which is expected and can be ignored.)

Certain .lua files such as ﻿[b]gDamageX.lua[/b], [b]Space Combat+Larger Space BattlesX.lua[/b], [b]_Extra Savage Sentinels by ExosolarX.lua[/b] and [b]PTSd Weapons Rebalance.lua[/b] all have a few settings right at the top of the .lua file for quickly adjusting many values all at once, for things like damage dealt / received by the player from creatures/sentinels/starships, and enemy starship hull / shields. A [b]search [/b]or [b]grep [/b]tool can make finding particular things to change within all of [i]PTSd[/i]'s .lua files easier, such as [b][url=https://tools.stefankueng.com/grepWin.html]grepWin [/url][/b]to search all the .lua files for "Biodome" to see & modify how [i]PTSd[/i] changes the crafting cost, recipe unlock cost, power usage, etc. of Biodomes.

For users unable to use AMUMSS, in the optional files section there is a version of the [b]PTSd Missions and Rewards[/b] module with the "Farther Target Sweep" changes removed.

﻿While the various changes in PTSd are generally designed to work together and not individually, I made it somewhat modular as a last resort for those with any issues with a particular module; it now comes in multiple folders to be used all together just like before, or you can remove individual modules if absolutely necessary (with the caveat below). E.G. removing the module which increases incoming damage, or the module which increases combat & hazard difficulty.

While the modules are mostly grouped according to similar topics, I'm limited by which files each one affects, so certain topics may have changes spread between multiple modules. E.G. While "[b]PTSd Prices and Tech and Starship Speed and More[/b]" makes unlocking crafting recipes cost 10x more,  "[b]PTSd Missions and Rewards[/b]" is what makes Manufacturing Facilities balance that out by awarding 10x the Factory Override Tokens.
Please check the individual .lua files to see exactly which changes you may be giving up by removing a particular module. Recommended to edit the .lua files and re-pak with AMUMSS rather than removing entire modules to avoid accidentally removing other changes.

If playing on a computer set to a [b]language other than English[/b], by default PTSd's many edits to the descriptions of vanilla items/techs/difficulty descriptions will not be displayed, since they are all in English. If you want to see the accurate info and added context / tips (in English), you can force them to display even when using other language settings by following the instructions at the top of the [b]PTSd UI Description Adjustments.lua[/b] file in the [b]PTSd Miscellaneous[/b] module folder.



[center][b][size=5]Installa[/size][/b][b][size=5]tion[/size][/b][/center]
[size=2][url=https://nomanssky.fandom.com/wiki/Mods#Installing_Mods]From the wiki:[/url]﻿[/size][list=1]
[*]Browse to [b]No Man's Sky\GAMEDATA\MODS[/b].
[*]Place all PTSd module folders into the MODS folder.
[*]Start the game and wait for the splash screen to disappear.
[*]If done correctly the game will display a warning just before displaying the selection of saved games.
[/list][center][size=5][b]

However, the [b].lua files[/b] for PTSd are also provided in the download, so you should be able to easily merge this with most other mods by using [url=https://github.com/HolterPhylo/AMUMSS/releases]AMUMSS[/url] following [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/mods/2626]these steps for merging mods[/url] (in general no merging is required to use with [b].EXML[/b]-type mods).

In particular, PTSd [b]alters the text[/b] for many item/tech/building/difficulty setting descriptions to either give PTSd-specific info or clarify vanilla mechanics, so if using alongside [b]any mod which alters/edits a lot of in-game text[/b], try to ensure that the PTSd LocTable.MXML / .lua files are loaded / processed last.

[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/mods/2290]Keep Talking Chef [/url]﻿﻿and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/mods/2298]Keep Gifting[/url]﻿ by Reikokuu and Babscoole﻿ ﻿   [b](No merging required)[/b][b][/b]
[/list] ﻿While PTSd includes a version of this mod specifically for Iteration Ares, these 2 mods allow you to more quickly trade certain items for nanites or Race Standing, respectively, which can be useful with PTSd's higher nanite costs and Standing cap requirements.[list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/mods/2040]UninstallCoreWeapons [/url]﻿by jackty89 ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿[b](No merging required)[/b]
[/list] ﻿Allows you to uninstall the Photon Cannon or Mining Laser from starships/Multi-Tools. Aside from the QoL, this helps you make the most of the more limited inventory slots with PTSd.

[center][size=5][b]Special Thanks[/b][/size][/center]
A huge thanks to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/users/62067056?tab=user+files]Babscoole[/url], [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/users/38106355?tab=user+files]Gumsk[/url], [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/users/1932252?tab=user+files]jackty89[/url], as well as the rest of the modders here and the No Man's Sky Modding discord for all their help and guidance for getting into NMS modding, and maintaining the tools & mods to do so.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-389-0-2-1651991810.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments, with a few new features.

.lua files included in download.


Compatible with NMS v3.89
files.changelog_html:
Mining Laser damage vs. creatures & Sentinels increased back to vanilla levels, as it was disabling creature critical weakpoints for mining lasers. Exocraft Mining Laser damage vs. creatures is still reduced from vanilla
Mining Laser critical damage multiplier reduced from 4x damage to 2x damage
Starting Hazard Protection charge on new game further increased from ~75% to 99%
Discovered starship shield bonuses from ship type were applying at ~71% effectiveness, not 33% effectiveness, and so lowered my extra shield multiplier from 2x to 1.4x to essentially make starship shield bonuses apply at 100% effectiveness
Doubled most starship shield bonuses from ship type, so in combination with the above change, now overall most ships' shield bonus will be ~40% more than in the previous version of PTSd
Tweaked some specific starship bonuses to create greater range between different types of ships: From the previous version, bonuses for Shuttles had Damage & Hyperdrive buffed ~33% & Shield buffed ~50% and no longer have -7 max Cargo Slots, Exotics Shield bonus buffed ~25% and removed the -10% to Damage & Hyperdrive, Solar Damage bonus buffed ~40%, Shield nerfed ~9%, price increased ~30%, Fighter Damage bonus buffed ~50%, Living Ship Hyperdrive bonus buffed ~16%, Shield nerfed ~36%

files.changelog_html: Reverted new game remaining Hazard Protection charge to previous version, but players now start the game with a single Ion Battery that they can choose to use to bring their survival time up to slightly longer than in vanilla.

Changing the default amount was leading to this bug, and if you were impacted by this issue you can use a Save Editor to reset your inventory size to the appropriate amount.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-389-0-5-1652304866.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments, with a few new features.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v3.89
files.changelog_html:
Lowered the increased chance for tornadoes 50%
Corrected Paraffinium not having the increased purchase price as other substances
Freighter cargo pods take 5x as much damage to destroy
AI Squadron damage +50%
All NPC starships (enemy & ally) Hull & Shield health lowered 25%
Amount of pirates spawned for the "hunting pirates" space station missions lowered 25~50%
Retooled the damage & fire rate bonuses for starship weapon upgrade modules, as certain weapons gained far higher benefits from upgrades than others. Also for certain weapons shifted more of the bonus away from fire rate onto damage instead, to prevent all weapons from becoming machineguns when fully upgraded.
Photon Cannon & Spewing Vents:
+     Critical multiplier now 2x from 1.5x.  Damage from upgrades increased ~10%. Fire rate lowered 40%, but damage increased proportionally to compensate.
-     Base heat capacity lowered -20%.
Phase Beam & Gazing Eyes:
+     Damage increased 40%
-     Cooling rate reduced ~60%.  Overheat recovery time increased ~20%.
Positron Ejector:
+     Initial heat capacity increased 50%.  Base range increased ~16%.
-     Damage lowered -20%.  Overheat recovery time increased ~33%.  Heat capacity from upgrades lowered ~60%.
Infra-Knife Accelerator
+     Fire rate 33% faster, damage lowered proportionally to compensate.
-     Cooling rate reduced ~20%.  Base heat capacity lowered -25%.  Heat capacity from upgrades lowered -20%.  Critical multiplier now 1.2x from 1.5x.  Damage vs. shields lowered to 40% from 80%.  Damage from upgrades reduced ~30%.
Cyclotron Ballista:
+     Larger projectile.  Now 40% effective to hull, from 20%.  Fire rate lowered by 80%, damage is now 5x to compensate.  Damage from upgrades increased ~10%.
-     Overheat recovery time increased ~50%.  Damage reduced 10%.  Heat capacity from upgrades lowered ~30%.
Rockets:
+     Critical multiplier now 2.5x from 1.5x.  Damage vs shields raised to 60% from 40%.  Damage increased ~36%.  Large Rockets Tube tech now also increased damage by 50%, but has 3.5x increased blueprint price.
-     Overheat recovery time increased ~100%.

Sentinel Interceptors adjusted: Now spawn in smaller groups at low wanted levels, but even larger groups at high wanted levels. Weaker but faster shields, only fire ~67% as rapidly, and weaker laser damage.
Strongest tier Pirates' shields now take 50% longer to reactivate and to recharge.

Compatible with NMS v3.89
files.changelog_html:
Enemy starships drop twice as many Starshield Batteries, and Space Station missions / Guild gifts reward roughly ~20% more of them as well.
Lowered number of pirates spawned during space station "hunt pirates" missions by -30% ~ -60%, especially for the Medium difficulty ones.
Solar Ship initial Pulse Drive fuel rate discount lowered from -80% to -60%
Added more convenient settings at the top of certain .lua files to adjust many things at once using a single setting:
*     "gDamage382XTEMP.lua" for adjusting all incoming damage to the player within various categories
*     "Space Combat+LargerX.lua" for NPC ship hull / shields
*     "RebalancedWeaponsX.lua" for damage the player deals while on foot / in Exocraft / in Starships (already present in previous version)

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-397-0-1-1659151821.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v3.97
files.changelog_html:
Living ship initial slots reduced, and maximum inventory slots adjusted to be in line with other PTSd ships, with theme of few General slots, very many Tech slots.
Initial slots 18 / 21 / 10 General / Tech / Cargo
Max slots 25 / 42 / 21 (-10 / +21 / +7 compared to 'baseline') Slightly nerfed Spewing Vents & Gazing Eyes to partially offset new vanilla buffs Reduced the shield leech bonus from Gazing Eyes upgrade modules Slightly buffed Positron Ejector upgrades to partially offset for new vanilla nerfs Increased blueprint unlock cost for some new freighter rooms Nutrition Room in freighter requires a Nutrient Processor to construct Brought Mineral scan values back into line with flora / fauna values now that it is boosted by scanner upgrades Slightly reduced freighter max cargo slots (49 > 42), but doubled initial cargo slots Corrected small error in solar ship maximum inventory slots at Class A

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-398-0-1-1659477886.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v3.98
files.changelog_html:
ACTUALLY updated Reduced Launch costs to also include the special Advanced Launch System expedition reward (accidentally left it out last update))
Reverted Biodomes to not being buildable on freighters
Standing Planter carbon reward reduced by -50%
Harvestable plants on the walls of freighter rooms with greenery carbon reward reduced by -80%
Swapped position of Interstellar Scanner and Matter Beam in Freighter unlock tree to keep Matter Beam as an end-game tech
Adjusted required ingredients for various new freighter rooms / tech to make them a bit harder to acquire and less objectively superior to planetside versions:
•Interstellar Scanner now requires 1 Walker Brain and 1 Hardframe Engine
•Nutrition Room now requires 1 Nutrient Processor
•Refiner Room now requires 8 microprocessors, but less Silver & Gold
•Cultivation & Double Cultivation Rooms now require 6 / 16 Metal Plates and increased Silver & Faecium
•Stellar Extractors now require 1 Gravitino Ball
•Scanner Room now requires 30 Emeril and 1 Quantum Processor
•Orbital Exocraft Materializer now requires 50 Emeril and 1 Portable Reactor
