files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-398-0-3-1659733733.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v3.98
files.changelog_html:
Squadmates  have slightly faster boosting speed
Lowered max combat speed in space of enemy ships to ~800 / ~1,200u/s for slow / fast enemies: fresh C Class ships still won't outrun any enemies, but with some upgrades should reliably outrun weaker enemies, and with enough upgrades even haulers can eventually outrun even the fastest enemies. (Sometimes "Station Defenders" from attacking Space Stations seem to have increased speed for some reason)
Fixed mistake in adjusting Living Ship Gazing Eyes upgrade modules bonus shield leech effect. Now Gazing Eyes starts off with half the shield leech effect of Phase Beam, but with enough upgrade modules can have almost twice the shield leech effect of Phase Beam + Fourier Delimiter.
Increased maximum number of stats that Gazing Eyes upgrades can have, since Shield leech effect is now a possible stat for them.
Addressed an issue with how NMS handles certain items having increased value on space stations, which lead to Suspicious Packets selling for up to 1 million units when sold on space stations:
•To address this while working within NMS' limitations, now most items from Scrap Dealers cost 3x as much Tainted Metal, but all Tainted Metal rewards are also increased by 3x, and refining Tainted Metal consumes 3x as much to compensate. (If you currently have a large amount of Tainted Metal stored, you can use a Save Editor to triple the amount to balance out)
•Substances on space station now only have 30% higher purchase & selling price compared to off-station, instead of double purchase & selling price previously.
•NipNip Buds no longer sell for twice as much on space stations, and instead have the same purchase cost everywhere, which has been increased by +50%.
•Suspicious Packets sell value on space station reduced by -75% for (Tech) and (Weapons), and reduced by -66% for (Goods)
•Suspicious Packets (Tech) & (Weapon) purchase cost in units on Outlaw Stations lowered by -15%, and "effective" purchase cost in tainted metal from scrap dealer increased by +20%
•Repair kit "effective" purchase cost in tainted metal from scrap dealer lowered by -33%
•Suspicious upgrade module "effective" purchase cost in tainted metal from scrap dealer lowered by -67%

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-398-0-4-1660260976.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v3.98
files.changelog_html:
Fixed squadron pilot slot unlock costs accidentally having price for third and fourth pilot swapped
Tripled tainted metal stack size to account for tripled amount found in derelict freighters
Nanite reward for discovering Minerals lowered to 3x vanilla instead of 5x since minerals now award significant units
Stellar Extractor construction now costs 2x Silver & Gold, and 6 Gravitino Balls
Orbital Exocraft Materializer no longer purchasable on Anomaly (must be bought at freighter bridge's unlock station)
Organic Frigate price raised to be 2x that of regular frigates. (In vanilla they cost 5x regular frigates)
Increased cost of Minotaur & Nautilon scanner tech, reduced cost of level 2 & 3 vehicle scanner tech to make total costs more similar across different exocraft
Increased average unit reward for rescuing freighter by 40%
Oxygen Rerouter cost lowered -35%
Cost of Coolant Network, Thermic Layer, Toxic Suppressor, and Radiation Deflector increased +33%
Aeration Membrane underwater breathing time bonus decreased -40%
Tweaked some values for planetary pirate raids / flybys to be less damaging, however there is an (apparently vanilla) issue where pirate raids on Planetary Archives don't use raiding behaviour and instead attack at full strength
Added setting in "gBase Items BasicX.lua" for users to optionally disable the player from constructing Teleporters in bases or freighters. (The player can still teleport to their base / freighter regardless)

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-399-0-1-1660591347.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v3.99
files.changelog_html:
Reduced Boltcaster base damage by -10% and bonuses from Sentinel Weapon upgrades by -25%, so that Boltcaster will start off slightly underpowered, but with both Boltcaster upgrades & Sentinel Weapon upgrades together will still be quite powerful
Increased Positron Ejector base damage by +17% and upgrade module bonus damage by a further +25% to better counteract the recent vanilla nerfs
Made the "Marrow Bulb + Condensed Carbon = Sodium" recipe finish much faster in exchange for the less efficient recipe compared to "Marrow Bulb + Carbon = Sodium" recipe, to fit with the pattern of most other PTSd recipes.
Updated branch of gBase to include some newer fixes:
• Biofuel reactor uses new vanilla behaviour (100 carbon for 45 hours of power)
• Reverted the freighter bulkhead door & internal freighter wall to no longer be free-placeable, as this would make them un-deletable

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-399-1-2-1661280917.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v3.99.1
files.changelog_html:
Adjusted the amounts of certain items required as part of the overall Expanding the Base questlines: Korvax Cube from 10 back to 1 as it made the UI Display confusing for that step, and VyKeen Daggers from 20 to 10 as they can be somewhat rare.
Autonomous Mining Units, Gas Harvesters, and Oxygen Harvesters now only take 10 / 10 / 8 minutes to complete a full cycle instead of 60 / 60 / 12 minutes. Since they are buggy in vanilla and often lose their contents when reloading or leaving the system, now it should be easier to have them complete at least a partial cycle while you are still in the area in one play session.
Damage to Depots or sealed security Doors reduced by -67% from Multi-Tool weapons,  -50% from vehicle weapons, and -80% from starship weapons compared to previous version to make it a bit riskier to try to completely ignore sentinels guarding depots / manufacturing facilities while breaking in early on.
Did some more extensive Multi-Tool weapon testing and rebalance. The base damage & % damage from upgrades have been adjusted for most MT weapons to bring them all roughly a bit closer in performance to where the Pulse Spitter / Blaze Javelin were previously:
• Boltcaster base damage increased +33%, % damage from upgrades increased +300%, % damage & fire rate from Sentinel upgrades decreased -33%
• Pulse Spitter base damage decreased -10%
• Scatter Blaster base damage increased +38%, % damage from upgrades decreased -60%
• Neutron Cannon base damage increased +210%, % damage from upgrades reduced -70%. Also, the base damage of "uncharged" rapid-fire shots increased a further +~48%
• Blaze Javelin base damage reduced -20%, % damage from upgrades increased +150%
• Plasma Launcher base damage increased +45%, % damage from upgrades decreased -30%
• Geology Cannon base damage increased +10%

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-399-1-3-1661629991.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v3.99.1
files.changelog_html:
Increased distance from the player that Patrol Drones spawn by 3x. This means that on Aggressive Sentinel Planets, drones no longer immediately detect the player upon spawning as they now will spawn outside their sight range.
In exchange, the area that Drones will "patrol" within from their starting point has had the radius roughly doubled, and regular & Aggressive Sentinel planets have 1 additional wandering Patrol Drone ("Low" Sentinel planets unchanged). Should now be possible (but risky) to land on Aggressive Sentinel Planets and "sneak" your way around patrol drones if you move cautiously and watchfully (rushing quickly can get you seen by a drone before you realize it's spawned).
Colossus base speed increased slightly
Minotaur fuel usage rate +50%, jumpjet speed +33%. Should now start out a bit faster than the Colossus, although once maxed out the Colossus will slightly outspeed it.
AI-piloted Minotaur hits taken until receiving tech damage +50% (To balance out how PTSd's more frequent and rapidly firing sentinels cause damage faster)
Minotaur AI Pilot recipe cost increased to 8 Quantum Computer, 4 Wiring Loom, and 16 Autonomous Positioning Units (Instead of Antimatter). Along with the nanites cost, this makes it the "costly in nanites & units" option vs. the Trace of Metal quest's "costly in combat" option of achieving the same result.
Oxygen Harvester cycle time increased +25% to 10 minutes (still faster than vanilla)
Antimatter Reactor cycle time reduced -20% to 10 minutes, amount of antimatter produced reduced -60% to 8. Recipe unlock cost increased +67%, now requires 10 each of Storm Crystals, Antimatter, and Experimental Power Fluid (instead of Metal Plates) to construct.
Balance tweaks to some refiner recipes:
• Making Magnetised Ferrite from Ferrite Dust/Pure Ferrite + Carbon/Condensed Carbon requires slightly less Carbon/Condensed Carbon per Magnetised Ferrite produced.
• Recipes for getting more Condensed Carbon / Ionized Cobalt / Chlorine using Oxygen / Carbon as a "catalyst" now more clearly give better efficiency with "low tier" substances (e.g. Carbon) but better speed with "high tier" substances (e.g. Condensed Carbon)
• Adjusted the recipes for getting more Sodium Nitrate using Oxygen / Carbon / Condensed Carbon as a "catalyst", and recipes for getting more Ionised Cobalt using Marrow Bulbs according to the same pattern as the above recipes. (Previously unchanged from vanilla)

files.name: PTSd Missions and Rewards module - No Farther Target Sweep version
files.file_name: PTSd Missions and Rewards module - No Farther Target Sweep version-2225-399-1-3-1661630066.zip
files.description: This is the PTSd Missions and Rewards module, but re-paked without the PTSd Farther Target Sweep.lua file. Use in place of the default module to keep vanilla distances for most Target Sweep missions to ensure mission markers are shown in multiplayer
files.changelog_html:
Increased distance from the player that Patrol Drones spawn by 3x. This means that on Aggressive Sentinel Planets, drones no longer immediately detect the player upon spawning as they now will spawn outside their sight range.
In exchange, the area that Drones will "patrol" within from their starting point has had the radius roughly doubled, and regular & Aggressive Sentinel planets have 1 additional wandering Patrol Drone ("Low" Sentinel planets unchanged). Should now be possible (but risky) to land on Aggressive Sentinel Planets and "sneak" your way around patrol drones if you move cautiously and watchfully (rushing quickly can get you seen by a drone before you realize it's spawned).
Colossus base speed increased slightly
Minotaur fuel usage rate +50%, jumpjet speed +33%. Should now start out a bit faster than the Colossus, although once maxed out the Colossus will slightly outspeed it.
AI-piloted Minotaur hits taken until receiving tech damage +50% (To balance out how PTSd's more frequent and rapidly firing sentinels cause damage faster)
Minotaur AI Pilot recipe cost increased to 8 Quantum Computer, 4 Wiring Loom, and 16 Autonomous Positioning Units (Instead of Antimatter). Antimatter Reactor cycle time reduced -20% to 10 minutes, amount of antimatter produced reduced -60% to 8. Recipe unlock cost increased +67%, now requires 10 each of Storm Crystals, Antimatter, and Experimental Power Fluid (instead of Metal Plates) to construct.
Balance tweaks to some refiner recipes:
• Making Magnetised Ferrite from Ferrite Dust/Pure Ferrite + Carbon/Condensed Carbon requires slightly less Carbon/Condensed Carbon per Magnetised Ferrite produced.
• Recipes for getting more Condensed Carbon / Ionized Cobalt / Chlorine using Oxygen / Carbon as a "catalyst" now more clearly give better efficiency with "low tier" substances (e.g. Carbon) but better speed with "high tier" substances (e.g. Condensed Carbon)

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-399-1-4-1662051461.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v3.99.1
files.changelog_html:
Removed Pugneum / Life Support Gel from recipes for several of the Sentinel Hardframe Minotaur techs so that they only have 3 ingredients total, to ensure the UI properly displays all ingredients
Nanite cost to ask a Traveller directions to a grave for portal glyphs increased 5x (also affects the nanite cost for a few specific alien NPC dialog choices)
Carbon needed to make Creature Pellets in the Nutrient Processor reduced -20% to 20 Carbon for 1 Creature Pellet
Crystal Sulphide unit value reduced -30%, and yield of Sodium Nitrate when refined reduced -25% (still higher than vanilla)
Fixed a mistake in how I calculated how the game handles bonuses to Hyperdrive Range, especially for Living Ships. Previously the buffs to Hyperdrive Range bonuses in PTSd were resulting in some ships in practice only reaching 60~80% of the actual lightyear ranges that I was intending. Most starships & the freighter now have their Hyperdrive bonuses increased a further ~1.5x to ~2.5x to correct this. Additionally, I did some slight rebalancing, mainly to buff Haulers & slightly nerf Solar starships in Hyperdrive range. The new bonus values are in PTSd Ship+MultiTool Rebalance.lua, but the overall effect is that for fully optimized, maxed out S-Class ships, the maximum range should now be around:
• ~10,000 ly for Freighters, ~8,000 ly for Explorers,  ~6,400 ly for Living Ships, ~5,100 ly for Exotics, ~4,000 ly for Shuttles, ~3,200 ly for Haulers, ~2,700 ly for Solars, and Fighters unchanged at ~1,900 ly
• This change will take effect for any newly spawned ships. For existing ships you already own, you will either need to upgrade the class (e.g. Class B to Class A) to apply the new values, or if the ship is a freighter or already at S class, you can manually edit the Hyperdrive bonus in a save editor (Assuming S Class from the previous version of PTSd, multiply the current bonus by 2.79x for Living Ship, 2.75x for Shuttles, 2.5x for Exotics, 2.11x for Explorers, 1.9x for Haulers, 1.38x for Freighters, or by 0.92x for Solars)

files.name: PTSd Missions and Rewards module - No Farther Target Sweep version
files.file_name: PTSd Missions and Rewards module - No Farther Target Sweep version-2225-421-0-1-1681230211.zip
files.description: This is the PTSd Missions and Rewards module, but re-paked without the PTSd Farther Target Sweep.lua file. Use in place of the default module to keep vanilla distances for most Target Sweep missions to ensure mission markers are shown in multiplayer
files.changelog_html:
Updated for Interceptor! Many, many changes in fact, too many to fill in to the changelog, so instead here is a link to a post with all of the 421.0.1 changes in it (at least the ones I can remember): https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/articles/157
Here are the important ones that may need special attention:
- In-game Difficulty settings means that the majority of the challenge/difficulty aspects of PTSd are now "optional", for the most part. IE setting many difficulty options lower can bring the overall challenge closer to vanilla levels, while still getting the other features of PTSd such as: Rewards shifted towards active play vs. passive play, more meaningful & distinctive choices between weapons/ships/multi-tools, new features such as Multi-Tool Mining/Scanning stats having more effects, and a few bug fixes. ﻿Notably, the game's UI does not accurately list all of the actual in-game effects of many options, so read the included "PTSD Other Difficulty Settings.lua" for details and explanation of exactly that each setting does in PTSd.
- All upgrades modules for all kinds of equipment can now be installed 5x times instead of 3x times, though their strength has been adjusted so that when "maxed out" the equipment should be roughly as powerful as in the previous version of PTSd. This was done so it will take more time / Nanites to find enough good upgrade modules to "max out" your equipment, and to make Tech slots more valuable as you will have more things to install.
- Because Supercharged Slots have huge, but varying improvements to different weapons when their core tech is supercharged, all core weapon techs have had their attributes divided by the same factor that Supercharged Slots will multiply them. Essentially, PTSd is balanced around the assumption that you will always have your core weapon / core mining laser tech supercharged, since it provides such a large boost to them.
- I could not find a way to properly adjust the Exosuit Cargo inventory, so PTSd is balanced around only upgrading it to 40 slots and stopping there.
- The new starship "Agility" bonus stat introduced in the Waypoint update has been corrected so it affects maneuverability at all times, not just while boosting. However, it no longer affects boosting speed (since it only really affects the boosting speed of "fresh" starships, not the final max boosting speed of heavily upgraded starships)
- As always, if using PTSd on an existing save you can use a Save Editor﻿ to adjust the stats / inventory size of existing ships/tools/storage containers to match the new PTSd values. (Starships & multitools will automatically adjust their stats when being upgraded to a higher Class).

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-421-0-2-1681419485.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.21
files.changelog_html:
Similar to the change to regular Storage Containers, for Freighter Storage Room blueprints only the first is given for free, and the others can be unlocked in the anomaly for 1 Salvaged Data when the corresponding "regular" Storage container is unlocked.
The number of learned alien words needed to advance each stage of the Base Computer Archives mission chain has been increased 5x (vanilla is 3 - 30 words needed for the 10 stages) as words can be learned more quickly in PTSd.
Opening containers at Crashed Freighters once again has a cost: now requires 10 Chromatic Metal to open each container
New recipe to refine 1 Basalt into 2 Silicate Powder, to give more use to Basalt and a mid-game method of getting Silicate Powder in bulk for building.
Solar Panels need 2x as much Glass to build
Biofuel Reactors cost 2x as much Oxygen to build, and only last half as long when full (25 hours instead of 50) while still costing the same amount to refill, thus are half as efficient
Sentinel interceptors are 0.6x as likely to drop Explosive Drones as loot when destroyed

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-422-0-1-1681507298.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.22
files.changelog_html:
To prevent too easily "sequence breaking" the tech tree by getting a Freighter, the Freighter Refiner Room, Galactic Trade Room, and Cultivation Chamber recipes are no longer known by default but can be unlocked for 1 Salvaged Frigate Module. Their position in the Freighter unlock tree has been adjusted, and they each also have the option to instead be unlocked at the Anomaly for the lower cost of just 1 Salvaged Data after unlocking their corresponding "planetary" equivalent recipe.
Rewards from the first few Space Station missions on a new game are now closer to the standard starting rewards, but with 2~3x boosted chance for Exosuit Upgrade Charts, Navigation Data, Salvaged Data, and Multi-Tool Expansion Slots. (As opposed to in vanilla when essentially the only rewards offered are Exosuit Upgrade Charts with a small chance for Multi-Tool Expansion Slots)
Damage for the Mining Laser, Hijacked Laser, and Animus Beam further reduced so that it should properly be at "base" effective mining rate when on a supercharged slot.
Hungering Tendril / Titan Worm health increased 3x
Rock Creatures now drop multiple Crystal Fragments instead of Meaty Chunks when killed, an extra incentive for doing mining by hand with a laser
Amount of Hypnotic Eyes given from Space Station mission rewards reduced, as they already have greatly increased value from vanilla.
Corrected the price for Exosuit Cargo slots increasing too abruptly when nearing the intended PTSd cap of 40 slots

Damage for the Mining Laser, Hijacked Laser, and Animus Beam further reduced so that it should properly be at "base" effective mining rate when on a supercharged slot.
Hungering Tendril / Titan Worm health increased 3x
Rock Creatures now drop multiple Crystal Fragments instead of Meaty Chunks when killed, an extra incentive for doing mining by hand with a laser
Amount of Hypnotic Eyes given from Space Station mission rewards reduced, as they already have greatly increased value from vanilla.
Corrected the price for Exosuit Cargo slots increasing too abruptly when nearing the intended PTSd cap of 40 slots

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-422-0-2-1681685266.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.22
files.changelog_html:
Further increased the purchase price for Exosuit Upgrade Charts by an additional ~4x, to be more in line with the increased cost to purchase those slots yourself instead.
Corrected the price for Exosuit Cargo slots increasing too abruptly when nearing the intended PTSd cap of 40 slots
Slightly reduced the number of Starship / Multi-tool / Exosuit inventory expansion items awarded for higher-level Space Station Missions, so they are capped at 2x each at most.
Meeting the first of Apollo's contacts at a Space Station no longer immediately teaches you the Roamer Geobay recipe. To learn it you can either progress the Base Computer Archives mission chain far enough, house the Exocraft Technician NPC at your base, or purchase it yourself at the Anomaly if you want it sooner.
Killing planetary creatures now only yields ~0.25x as much "meat" and Mordite, and non-predatory creatures have ~1.5x as much health. Gathering enormous quantities of meat products or Mordite should be a little more difficult, and possibly make the alternative sources/recipes for these items more appealing.
To balance out the reduced amount from killing a creature, Rock Creatures now drop the more valuable Glowing Minerals instead of Crystal Fragments.
Increased refining time for Radiant Shard, Inverted Mirror, Hyaline Brain in line with the vanilla increase (though still reduced according to their reduced Nanite yield)
Added recipes for refining Radiant Shards, Inverted Mirrors, and Hyaline Brains with Microprocessors to yield Salvaged Data, matching the other Nanite-yielding items

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-1-1681848727.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Some tweaks to sentinels on Corrupted Planets:
• Corrupted Drones rate of repairing allies slowed 16%~67% depending on which type of sentinel it is repairing (slowed the most when repairing other Corrupted Drones).
• Corrupted Drones and mini-Arachnids need to have lower health before calling for repair, around half health.
• Various attributes of Corrupted Drone weapons slightly buffed, Large Arachnid weapons received larger buffs, especially the grenade launcher.
• Revamped the types & numbers of sentinels spawned for the various Wanted Levels on Corrupt Planets, to make a smoother progression of more / stronger enemies with more healing drones as the wanted levels increase. Culminates in a wave against 3 Large Arachnids, 4-5 Corrupted Drones, and 5-6 Mini-Arachnids simultaneously at the end of Wanted Level 5.
• The slowed repair rate should make Corrupted waves more manageable. In particular for Corrupted Drones, especially if working around how much like in vanilla they only call for repair once their health is around halfway depleted. IE a good strategy is to get them close to half health, then stop attacking and ready yourself for maximum burst damage to finish them off before the repairing can get well underway, by reloading, switching to a burstier weapon with long reload time like the Scatter Blaster, fully charging a Blaze Javelin, etc.
• Beating Wanted Level 5 on Corrupt planets is still intended to be at the peak of planetary battle difficulty, as challenging or more than defeating a Sentinel Walker. It's expected the player would have access to things like a Minotaur under AI-piloting, or a combo of Voltaic Amplifier with sources of Stun by the point they are trying to clear Wanted Level 5 on Corrupt Planets.
Cost to unlock the recipes for Storage Containers 6-9 reduced to ~0.75x-0.5x of previous cost.
Refiner recipe for combining Cyto-Phosphate & Salt into Glass has had its yield ratio improved 5x, as these ingredients are more valuable than the alternatives for making Glass.
Various costs & attributes for the various methods of growing crops have been further adjusted to give most of them a beneficial niche:
• Both kinds of Hydroponics Trays reverted to vanilla behaviour of not being buildable on Freighters
• Large Hydroponics Tray no longer automatically unlocked by the Farmer NPC, must be purchased at the Anomaly instead, but recipe unlock cost is reduced to 0.5x vanilla
• Hydroponics Tray requires less than half the normal ingredients, so it is now the most cost-effective  option in terms of construction cost per-plant. However its power draw was increased +20%
• Large Hydroponics Tray requires slightly more ingredients to build (1.5x Metal Plates), and thus on a per-plant basis costs 50% more to construct than regular Trays. However its power draw has been reduced -20%, and is now the lowest of all planetary options on a per-plant basis. Thus you can grow 50% more plants than the regular Trays with the same amount of power.
• Biodome needs many more ingredients to construct: ~6.4x more Magnetised Ferrite and now also 320 Oxygen (However as it has 16 plots, on a per-plant basis the cost is actually in between regular & Large Trays). Its power draw is unchanged, so on a per-plant basis is nearly double the regular Tray, but in terms of time needed to harvest it remains the clear best of all options.
• Cultivation Chamber & Double Cultivation Chamber had their required Silver & Faecium increased 1.3x & 1.5x, respectively. They remain by far the highest cost to construct on a per-plant basis, but get all their power from the Freighter for free and are conveniently located on your Freighter.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-3-1682108345.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Integrated a modified version of "New Milestones" by Lo2k. This means that in general, most milestones now have substantially higher requirements to achieve each rank, and additionally the total overall number of milestones needed to progress through the stages of the Atlas Path questline are also increased. The final rank for most milestones has significantly higher requirements than the previous rank, although you can still reach Overall Rank "Magellan" to complete the Atlas Path without reaching any of the final ranks for any of the milestones.
Related to this, ~30 more techs/buildables have had either various Atlas Seeds or resources which now require a particular Atlas Seed to obtain added to their requirements for installing / building. These are an assortment of techs & buildables that are especially game-changing or render other options obsolete, which are now effectively "locked" out of obtaining in the first few hours of the game as you will need enough Milestones to unlock the appropriate Atlas Seed recipe. The vast majority of them require one of the first 5 Atlas Seeds, so after getting 40 Milestones you should have access to almost all tech / buildables. Some notable examples of the new changes:
• The specialised hyperdrive techs required to visit Red/Green/Blue stars to obtain their corresponding unique metals are locked behind the 1st, 3rd, and 5th Atlas Seed (8 / 24 / 40 Milestones). Thus, any items requiring Cadmium / Emeril / Indium are likewise locked behind those Milestone requirements.
• All Exocraft Geobays require either Cadmium or Emeril to construct, so you must first visit a Red star system to begin using exocraft
• The Survey Device tech required for finding power / mineral / gas hotspots in order to use the corresponding automated extractors is locked behind Indium
• Many of the more powerful exocraft Radar techs which can locate desirable planetary locations are locked behind Indium, making planetary charts useful for longer
• The various Exocraft techs which fully protect against a specific Hazard are now locked behind Indium, making hazard management & the Minotaur more important for longer. (As in vanilla, Exocraft still naturally slow down Hazard drain by 3x while inside them)
• As in previous versions of PTSd, the Matter Beam tech for the Freighter requires the final Atlas Seed to build (or temporarily setting the Crafting Costs setting to "Free"), as it effectively eliminates the entire inventory management aspect of the game.
Rebalanced some tech unlock costs, mostly making some fuel-recharging or radar techs more expensive
The Scientist NPC teaches the Medium Refiner recipe instead of the Large Refiner recipe, which must now be purchased at the Anomaly
Living Ship S Class Launcher upgrades no longer have auto-charging as a bonus, as there is a dedicated tech for that on Living Ships now
Psychonic Eggs now have just a ~10% chance of yielding the Chloroplast Membrane tech (Launcher auto-charge) and ~50% chance to give the Wormhole Brain / Neural Shielding techs instead of it being virtually guaranteed (though as in vanilla, Psychonic Eggs will never yield a tech you already have in an accessible inventory or installed in your active ship)
Reverted the rest of the various machines which have dedicated Freighter Room versions (Refiners, Nutrient Processors, Storage Containers, Trade Terminals, etc.) to not be buildable on Freighters as in vanilla, to prevent the player from ignoring the Freighter versions and just using the planetary versions instead.
Added Hardframe Engine to possible rewards offered by Space Station / Outlaw Station missions or guild gifts in place of / alongside where Walker Brains can also be offered. This is to give a rare / unpredictable alternative to fighting Sentinel Mechs to get the components for installing / repairing the hardframe upgrades for the Minotaur.
Destroying Salvageable Scrap deposits is 50% as likely to drop a Sentinel Boundary Map.

files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-4-1682115475.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html: Adjusted how likely various techs are to come pre-installed on "wild" Starships & Multi-Tools. Mostly to make sure that techs which now require Atlas Seeds can't be found "for free", and to make a few powerful weapons / techs more rare.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-5-1682220967.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Correction: Fixed accidentally putting the Atlas Seed requirement intended for Indium Drive onto Emeril Drive instead.
Corrected the refining time accidentally being too long for using Cyto-Phosphate + Salt to make Glass, and further improved the yield ratio 2x as the ingredients are both more valuable and harder to get in bulk than other Glass recipes.
Atlantideum refines into Pugneum at a 3:2 ratio instead of 1:2, so that actually fighting Sentinels should remain more efficient at gathering Pugneum instead of safely harvesting Living Crystals.
Reduced price to unlock Indium Drive -20% to fit the pattern of the other drives.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-6-1682441261.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Lowered the requirement for installing the Optical Drill tech down to the 2nd Atlas Seed instead of Emeril (which needs the 3rd Atlas Seed)
Reduced unlock cost of Colossus Geobay 0.5x
Swapped position of Save Point and Galactic Trade Terminal in Anomaly unlock tree, and added Save Point to the Construction Research Unit unlock tree to make it easier to learn earlier
Increased the construction costs for Biofuel Reactor, Solar Panel, and Battery by roughly ~1.5x-2x to further widen the gap of how much more resource-efficient Electromagnetic Generators are to build on a per-kP basis than the alternatives, so they are more clearly worthwhile. (EM Generators now being roughly ~3-6x more cost-effective to build compared to a mixture of Solar Panels & Batteries, depending on hotspot Class)
Reduced the strength of B Class Electromagnetic hotspots slightly so they match the pattern of the other hotspot Classes.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-7-1682723447.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Corrected placement of the Freighter Galactic Trade Room in the Anomaly unlock tree to match the recent change to the placement of the Galactic Trade Terminal
Split both the Minotaur Radar Array and High-Power Sonar for the Nautilon into a core tech & separate "upgrade tech", the same as how the vehicular Exocraft Radar techs work. This way the ability to search for valuable locations like Crashed Starships & Freighters can remain locked behind Indium with the "upgrade tech", while the simpler locations and ability to scan for nearby plants & resource nodes is available earlier with the "core tech".
Made Pirates roughly ~0.5x as likely to drop either Suspicious (Tech) or (Arms) Packets, with the chance to drop Suspicious (Goods) Packets roughly doubled to compensate. However, the chance for Tech/Arms vs. Goods improves with harder pirates
Reduced unlock cost of Nautilon Cannon to 0.5x and moved it to the top of the Nautilon section of the unlock tree
Increased unlock cost 5x for Standing Planter (gives Carbon for power)

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-8-1682890015.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Corrupted Drones wait until their health is ~10% lower to call for repairs, and repair other Corrupted Drones ~10% more slowly
Lowered amount of Corrupted Drones that spawn at Settlements by ~1 on average
Reduced the cost to upgrade the class of Starships / Multi-Tools to roughly ~0.75x, as there are now many other high Nanite cost items they are competing with. (Multi-Tool upgrade cost is also reduced a further 0.5x, as compared to Starships the cost in units to buy a higher Class outright is much cheaper)
Reduced unlock cost for all Multi-Tool weapon techs to 0.6x, matching the Starship weapon tech prices.
Slight tweaks to other weapon tech unlock prices such as Grenades, Rockets, Voltaic Amplifier, upgrades for Boltcaster / Photon Cannon to keep in line with new prices. Rockets also a little less common to find pre-installed on Starships

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-9-1683072211.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Reduced the speed/distance of "Melee-Boosting" to around ~0.66x of vanilla.
However to compensate, Rocket Boots have received several improvements:
• No longer "auto-jump" when landing/touching terrain while holding spacebar
• Increased the speed, height, and duration of the Rocket Boots effect to roughly ~1.3x-1.5x Vanilla levels. The height increase means it should be much less common to unintentionally "land" prematurely and cut your flight short when trying to Rocket Jump on flat terrain.
• The initial "jump" of activating Rocket Boots only depletes the Jetpack Tanks 0.75x as much as vanilla, though they now deplete 1.3x more quickly for a short period while flying after the initial "jump"
• Rocket Boots should now be superior to even the vanilla Melee-Boost for general movement (at the cost of depleting your Jetpack Tanks more quickly and taking up a Tech slot) but still slower overall than Exocraft or a very fast pet (if using the Companion Riding Improvements mod), especially over longer distances.
However, all these changes to Melee-Boosting & Rocket Boots are contained within "PTSd Rocket Boots Changes.lua" if you wish to easily remove them
Reduced cost to unlock Rocket Boots to 0.8x & Airburst Engine to 0.7x
Increased cost to unlock Trade Rocket by ~1.5x
Reverted the initial base building radius when you first place a Base Computer from 50u back up to 300u, to reduce the hassle of a vanilla bug that sometimes requires you to save & reload your game to restore full functionality to storage containers and certain other base parts that are built outside the initial base building radius.
Swapped one of the possible Gek Settlement products from Stellar Custard to Pastry. It is worth slightly less if sold raw, but has a useful Life Support restoring effect and more importantly has far more possible recipes available to cook using it, increasing the chances it will be useful & profitable with the ingredients the player has on-hand. (May need a Save Editor to adjust an existing Settlement with Stellar Custard)
Increased the required amounts of certain common ingredients used as "additives"/"seasoning" in some Nutrient Processor recipes from 1 to 5:
• Salt for Crunchy Caramel, Salty Custard, Salty Juice
• Carbon for Smoked Meat
• Condensed Carbon for Smoked Meat (uses 2 instead of 5)
• Frost Crystal for various kinds of "Ice Creams"
Replaced some of the less useful "junk" rewards from dismantling plant consumables found in Subterranean Organic Structures such as "Residual Goop" or "Viscous Fluids" with more useful items such as Marrow Bulbs, Sweetroots, or Pulpy Roots. Also increased the amount rewarded for some other items such as Runaway Mould, Carbon, etc. to make these consumables overall more worthwhile & desirable.
Replaced the Cadmium/Emeril/Indium rewards from dismantling broken tech consumables found in Buried Caches with their Activated versions to prevent "sequence breaking" before getting the appropriate hyperdrive techs
Swapped position of Appearance Modifier Room and Galactic Trade Room in Freighter unlock tree.

files.name: PTSd Missions and Rewards module - No Farther Target Sweep version
files.file_name: PTSd Missions and Rewards module - No Farther Target Sweep version-2225-423-0-9-1683072237.zip
files.description: This is the PTSd Missions and Rewards module, but re-paked without the PTSd Farther Target Sweep.lua file. Use in place of the default module to keep vanilla distances for most Target Sweep missions to ensure mission markers are shown in multiplayer
files.changelog_html:
Reduced the speed/distance of "Melee-Boosting" to around ~0.66x of vanilla.
However to compensate, Rocket Boots have received several improvements:
• No longer "auto-jump" when landing/touching terrain while holding spacebar
• Increased the speed, height, and duration of the Rocket Boots effect to roughly ~1.3x-1.5x Vanilla levels. The height increase means it should be much less common to unintentionally "land" prematurely and cut your flight short when trying to Rocket Jump on flat terrain.
• The initial "jump" of activating Rocket Boots only depletes the Jetpack Tanks 0.75x as much as vanilla, though they now deplete 1.3x more quickly for a short period while flying after the initial "jump"
• Rocket Boots should now be superior to even the vanilla Melee-Boost for general movement (at the cost of depleting your Jetpack Tanks more quickly and taking up a Tech slot) but still slower overall than Exocraft or a very fast pet (if using the Companion Riding Improvements mod), especially over longer distances.
However, all these changes to Melee-Boosting & Rocket Boots are contained within "PTSd Rocket Boots Changes.lua" if you wish to easily remove them
Reduced cost to unlock Rocket Boots to 0.8x & Airburst Engine to 0.7x
Increased cost to unlock Trade Rocket by ~1.5x
Reverted the initial base building radius when you first place a Base Computer from 50u back up to 300u, to reduce the hassle of a vanilla bug that sometimes requires you to save & reload your game to restore full functionality to storage containers and certain other base parts that are built outside the initial base building radius.
Swapped one of the possible Gek Settlement products from Stellar Custard to Pastry. It is worth slightly less if sold raw, but has a useful Life Support restoring effect and more importantly has far more possible recipes available to cook using it, increasing the chances it will be useful & profitable with the ingredients the player has on-hand. (May need a Save Editor to adjust an existing Settlement with Stellar Custard)
Increased the required amounts of certain common ingredients used as "additives"/"seasoning" in some Nutrient Processor recipes from 1 to 5:
• Salt for Crunchy Caramel, Salty Custard, Salty Juice
• Carbon for Smoked Meat
• Condensed Carbon for Smoked Meat (uses 2 instead of 5)
• Frost Crystal for various kinds of "Ice Creams"
Replaced some of the less useful "junk" rewards from dismantling plant consumables found in Subterranean Organic Structures such as "Residual Goop" or "Viscous Fluids" with more useful items such as Marrow Bulbs, Sweetroots, or Pulpy Roots. Also increased the amount rewarded for some other items such as Runaway Mould, Carbon, etc. to make these consumables overall more worthwhile & desirable.
Replaced the Cadmium/Emeril/Indium rewards from dismantling broken tech consumables found in Buried Caches with their Activated versions to prevent "sequence breaking" before getting the appropriate hyperdrive techs
Swapped position of Appearance Modifier Room and Galactic Trade Room in Freighter unlock tree.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-10-1683403835.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Reverted chance for Settlement Expedition failure back to vanilla 30% chance. However, Settlement Expeditions now award +1 population on success in addition to the normal reward, and lose only 1 population instead of 2 on failure, so on average you will likely gain population from authorizing these expeditions.
Reverted the "trade-in" value for trading in a freighter for a different freighter back to the vanilla 70% of original value instead of 10% of original value, so that the player isn't overly punished for starting with cheap freighters and upgrading multiple times to progressively better ones.
Reduced cost for Sodium / Sodium Nitrate to recharge starship shields to 0.75x
Increased cost for Uranium to recharge starship Launcher by 1.5x
Increased costs for the Freighter Biological Room to match the other Freighter "expansion" rooms, with added Condensed Carbon cost as it can produce Carbon.
Increased the Silver Cost for the Freighter Nutrition Room back up to the default of 60
Reduced likelihood of Outlaw Station missions rewarding Sentinel Boundary Maps 0.5x
Increased Oxygen from Gassy Pods ~1.66x
Increased yield of Chlorine from "Organic" Rocks to 2x
Reduced yield of Mordite from "Organic" Rocks to 0.4x
Reduced the Gold & Uranium yield from Metal "Fingers" to 0.6x & 0.4x, and also changed the ratio of Gold to Uranium fingers from 1:1 to 2:1
• In practice this means each cluster of fingers should yield around ~80% the amount of Gold in total, and around ~25% the amount of Uranium in total. However keep in mind PTSd allows mining yields to get much higher than Vanilla with the inbuilt Mining stat bonuses for Multi-Tools.
Corrected certain freighter room recipes which may not have started out unknown as intended.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-11-1683579249.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Reduced the chance of Tech Damage to installed Starship tech from enemy starships / freighters a further 0.5x, due to the high enemy fire rate in PTSd
Increased health of the underwater "Eyeball" enemy creature 6x and "Anglerfish" enemy creature 1.5x. Also increased initial speed boost of "Anglerfish" 1.2x
Increased the initial damage from when Anglerfish spawn by 5x, and increased the number of additional jellyfish spawned by ~2x
Reduced the amount of items rewarded from harvesting Alluring Specimens 0.5x, to compensate for how Alluring Specimens in PTSd are no longer destroyed on "bad outcome". (This is a side effect of how PTSd prevents starship weapons from mining planetary objects by making planetary objects immune to explosions)
Reduced the bonus Multi-Tool mining yield during Radiation Storms from 2.55x to 1.9x of normal substance yield.
Broken slots on Sentinel Multi-tools have their requirement of 3 Recycled Circuitry split into 3 separate "components", so using Repair Kits instead of the "intended" resources to fix it will require significantly more Repair Kits to do so. (Note you will have to enter the full zoomed-in "repairing" UI to see the full list of required components, as the Inventory UI overview only displays the first 3 required components)
Reworded in-game descriptions of the new Radar upgrades for the Minotaur and Nautilon to make it more clear they are upgrades to the core Radar techs and not standalone techs.
Corrected the filename of one of the .paks being incorrect / too long

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-12-1683768221.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Increased Scatter Blaster base damage ~1.45x, increased damage bonus from upgrade modules 6x, decreased Critical Hit bonus damage from +50% to +30%. Overall buff since it needs even more extra strength to make up for the very short effective range, poor accuracy, and difficulty hitting critical spots compared to other weapons in PTSd.
Decreased Boltcaster base damage 0.9x, but increased Critical Hit bonus damage from +50% to +80% to reward accuracy more
Decreased Heat Time bonus from Infra-Knife Accelerator upgrade modules 0.5x
As Emergency Signal Scanners (for finding Derelict Freighters) are no longer given weekly for free, added a rare chance for higher-level Space Station missions to offer one as a reward, and a slightly better chance for Outlaw Station missions.
Added guaranteed Units & Nanites rewards to the Exocraft Technician NPC's repeatable daily mission, in addition to the usual random upgrade module/product reward, to make it more worthwhile. On average awards around ~350 Nanites and ~300,000 Units (around half the average Units value of the Farmer/Overseer daily mission rewards).
Multiplied the yield of the biome-specific crops by ~1.11x for both the wild and cultivated versions. This brings the cultivated versions' yield back to the vanilla amount for better QoL of matching vanilla planting/recipe ratios, and no "leftovers" when directly crafting into farming products immediately after harvesting.
Further increased the Chlorine yield from Organic Rocks an additional 2x
Set Standing Planters to no longer be buildable on Freighters, as they get free power there and Freighters already have dedicated rooms for growing Carbon and adding greenery.
Added Tainted Metal as another option to refine with Microprocessors to get Salvaged Data
Rewrote the in-game subtitle/descriptions when performing PTSd-added Refiner/Nutrient Processor recipes to be similar to vanilla recipe descriptions instead of just a placeholder ID

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-13-1683917915.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Corrected an issue with Supply Depot & Mineral / Gas Extractor network storage rounding down the total network storage to the next lowest multiple of 1250, and only delivering extracted substances infrequently in packets of 1250 at a time. Now delivers substances in frequent packets of 125 at a time.
• Improved a related issue which was causing Extractors to round their extraction rate to the nearest multiple of 12.5 units/hr. Now Extractors round their extraction rate to the nearest multiple of 6.25 units/hr (So still requires a little less precision / finickiness to place Extractors for optimal yield compared to vanilla)
• To clarify, overall total extraction rates / storage amounts are unchanged.
Made the Exocraft Technician's repeatable daily mission always give B Class or higher upgrades when awarding upgrade modules, doubled chances for A or S Class upgrades, and also added Minotaur upgrade modules to the possible rewards. Also slightly increased the Units reward by ~50,000 on average

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-14-1684282371.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Increased the sale value of all "geode" style items (Geode<Ferrite>, Geode<Cobalt>, Gold Nugget, Glowing Mineral) by ~2.6x-10.2x so that they each sell for +33% more than opening them and selling their contents (on average).  Tritium Hypercluster & Crystal Fragment were similarly increased to sell for +200% more than selling their contents, as their contents are generally cheaper & harder to get by other means. Now there is a choice of whether you want to break them down for their substances to use for fuel / crafting more valuable items to sell, or to sell them as-is for decent money.
Settlements now complete a production cycle of items every 6 hours instead of 20 hours, though the amount produced per cycle is 0.3x as much so the daily output is the same as before. (Settlement Products also got a 1.2x boost to account for how you may now lose some products due to rounding down). However, this means whenever making a Settlement decision that adds any Debt (which causes the production cycle to reset to 0 once the debt is repaid), you can only lose at most 6 hours' worth of production instead of 20 hours' worth of production. I.E. Visiting your settlement and making decisions more than once a day no longer prevents your settlement from ever producing items; you should most likely be able to collect at least some items every day as long as Productivity > Maintenance costs, and it's more feasible to delay making a Debt-increasing settlement decision until the current production cycle finishes first.
Corrected the UI display time for Settlement production rate, & certain crop "approximate growth times" when viewing the crop in the construction menu, to match the new PTSd times, with some minor corrections to vanilla mistakes as well.
Moved the recipe for Geodesite from under Grantine to under Herox in the unlock tree, since Grantine is not an ingredient for Geodesite but Herox is.
Removed the innate Launcher Auto-charge bonus from Solar Ships, replaced it with a -34% Launch discount (the same as Shuttles). Also rewrote the in-game description for the Vesper Sail to more accurately describe its bonuses in PTSd.
Removed the additional +20% markup on Scanner upgrade Modules (S & X Class upgrades having a chance to come with less than 4 bonuses means there already is a higher cost to "max out" these modules compared to others.)
Decreased unlock cost of Precision Minotaur Laser, Minotaur Cannon, Minotaur Bore ~0.7x, increased unlock cost of Minotaur AI Pilot ~1.1x
Decreased the Nanite cost to "purchase" additional Living Ships after completing the Starbirth mission 0.8x
Increased average waiting time for stages of the Starbirth mission from 4 hours to 8 hours (vanilla is 22 hours)
To prevent heavy "sequence breaking" of the various things locked behind Cadmium/Emeril/Indium, or acquiring an S Class starship too early on, crafting the Consciousness Bridge at the start of the Starbirth mission now requires Emeril. This still allows some leeway in making use of the Living Ship's hyperdrive tech as a "shortcut" from Emeril to Indium, depending on how soon you complete the Starbirth Mission compared to gaining more Milestones.
Reduced the amount of Chromatic Metal required for several vanilla refiner recipes which normally require a staggering 250 Chromatic Metal to 10 or 15, so those recipes are actually worth considering now. (Recipes for making Platinum & Hyperfuel). Also reduced the cost ~0.36x for the refiner recipe for making Ion Batteries so it is actually cheaper than crafting by hand.
Higher level Space Station missions are less likely to offer Exosuit Upgrade Charts / Expansions, as the player has likely reached PTSd's lower Exosuit inventory slot cap by then.

Higher level Space Station missions are less likely to offer Exosuit Upgrade Charts / Expansions, as the player has likely reached PTSd's lower Exosuit inventory slot cap by then.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-15-1684527252.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html:
Further increased the stack size of Radiant Shards 1.5x, to make it easier to hold many of them in your Interceptor for the frequent shield-recharging you often do in PTSd
Sentinel Interceptors can now use Starshield Batteries to recharge shields in addition to either Radiant Shards or Sodium Nitrate, but can no longer use Sodium. (Since many starships often drop Starshield Batteries when destroyed, Interceptors can now also make use of them in combat)
Decreased the "tank size" 0.4x for the Sentinel Interceptor's Hyperdrive & Pulse Engine techs. Since Radiant Shards refill those tanks to full when used, in practice this means that Radiant Shards give only 0.4x as much "fuel" for warping / pulse jumping. E.G. In Vanilla with no hyperdrive upgrades, a Radiant Shard gives enough fuel for 5 warps, but now in PTSd it gives enough fuel for 2 warps. (As a minor side effect, Warp Hypercores also give 0.4x as much fuel for Interceptors)
Enemy Sentinel Interceptors now have 0.8x Hull Health, and their shield delay before recharging is 1.33x longer, and they take 1.33x as long to fully recharge.
The delay between waves of increasing Wanted Levels in space during which you can again use your Pulse Jump / Hyperdrive increased from 3 sec to 12 sec

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-423-0-16-1685034864.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.23
files.changelog_html: Further doubled the stacksize for Refiner (and Nutrient Processor) input & output slots so they are now 2x the exosuit's stacksize at all difficulty settings (vanilla is often 0.5x the exosuit's stacksize). I.E. You can now place 2 stacks of items from your Exosuit inventory into a Refiner / Nutrient Processor at a time (You can press "X" while hovering over an input slot that already has items in it to keep adding items). This should improve the QoL for bulk refining by requiring fewer interactions / refills of the refiner (though it doesn't affect the time required or the actual yields per recipe)

.lua files included in download.

Fixed vanilla issue of Neutron Cannon Class X upgrade modules always having worse damage & charge time bonuses than a good S Class upgrade

Lowered Sentinel Interceptor salvage / trade-in value even further by ~50%

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-443-0-1-1693794608.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.43
files.changelog_html:
A few individual .lua files got renamed as some re-organizing was done
Added option at the top of PTSd Rewards Remixer.lua to make all starships & multitools rewarded from Expeditions & Twitch streams come as C Class with small inventories (set to false by default)
Corrected the ratio for refining Cadmium into Chromatic Metal that got oddly nerfed in NMS v4.4
Increased the hull & shields for newly destructible Freighters, and the number of Pirate Frigates in line with other PTSd buffs (roughly ~2x more Hull & Shields, up to ~1.5x more Pirate Frigate spawns)
Cost for Pirate Frigates lowered to be just 150% "regular" frigates instead of 250%, since they don't appear to be functionally any different from regular Combat Frigates for the player.
Units / Nanites rewards for saving Civilian Freighters from the new Pirate Freighters are increased 2x
Number of Cargo Bulkheads rewarded from destroying Pirate Freighters increased by 1.5x on average
Reduced Sentinel ship selling value to 0.75x previous value, as the vanilla price has also been lowered
Fixed Animus Beam accidentally getting the same damage buff I gave the Hijacked Laser
Increased damage bonus of Alien Multi-Tools by ~1.06x and Sentinel Multi-tools by ~1.14x
Atlantid Multi-tool changes:
• At S Class the bonus for Damage is 1x, Mining is 1.2x, and Scanning is 1.3x vanilla (with possibly different multipliers at lower Classes for a smooth progression)
• Now set up as a kind of "advanced Pistol Alternative": Has notably better Damage and Scanning than the Pistol, but a lower Mining stat (and lower resources per second)
• However, the unique "Runic Lens" laser has been changed to now give 1.25x as much resources and deal 0.7x as much damage as a normal Mining Laser. This means that it will yield more resources per object than the Pistol, but due to the reduced laser damage it will yield fewer resources per second than the Pistol (or the Sentinel Multi-tool using the Hijacked Laser). As opposed to the Hijacked Laser, the Runic Lens will shine in situations where you are mining rarer objects you do not often come across (such as Metal Fingers, Mutant Plants, etc.) to maximise the resources obtained. And unlike the Hijacked Laser, it has the default fuel consumption / recharge rate and a more forgiving heatup time than the regular Mining Laser.
Voltaic Staff changes:
• At S Class the bonus for Damage is 0.7x, Mining is 2.2x, and Scanning is 1.5x vanilla (with possibly different multipliers at lower Classes for a smooth progression)
• Instead of being identical to Sentinel Multi-tools, now set up as a kind of "alternative jack of all trades" similar to Royal Multi-tools: Has slightly better damage than Royals, but lower Mining and Scanning. The damage is still below Sentinel & Alien Multi-tools, the Scanning is still below Royals & Experimentals, and the Mining is below Pistols, Royals, and Atlantids
Neutron Cannon base dispersion (inaccuracy) increased 1.4x (should make it slightly easier to hit multiple enemies at once)
Applied the increase to max damage bonus for X Class Neutron Cannon upgrade modules that was intended in the previous PTSd version (but accidentally left out)
Unlock cost for Personal Refiner reduced to 0.8x previous cost, Personal Refiner Mk2 reduced to 0.4x vanilla cost and now requires Emeril to install instead of Ionised Cobalt
Polyphonic Core now requires Cadmium to install instead of Quantum Computer
Instead of having both Sentinel Exosuit upgrade modules and the new Autophage Exosuit upgrade modules offer the same possible stat bonuses, they have been differentiated: Now only Sentinel Exosuit upgrades offer Shield & Health bonuses, and only Autophage Exosuit upgrades offer Jetpack & Stamina bonuses. (This feature can be toggled off at the top of "!PTSd Procedural Upgrade Adjustment.lua") Thus they now lean into separate roles for combat or exploration. The Life Support tank size & regen rate bonuses for both have been reduced to 0.75x effectiveness, as you can "double up" on those now
Adjusted starship weapon damage effectiveness against Torpedo & Freighter Hulls to match their effectiveness against starship Hulls (with an exception of a 0.7x reduction for Positron Ejector vs. Freighter Hulls, since Freighters are a much larger target and thus easier to land shots against)

files.content_preview_link: https://file-metadata.nexusmods.com/file/nexus-files-s3-meta/1634/2225/PTSd Missions and Rewards module - No Farther Targ-2225-443-0-1-1693794638.zip.json

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-444-0-1-1694110237.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.44
files.changelog_html:
Multiplied the Boosting Speed of all enemy Starships by the same amount as diverting power to Engines does for the player. This should keep it as difficult as it used to be to outrun pirates, so long as you are diverting power to Engines when trying to escape.
Tweaked the maluses you get to other ship systems when diverting power away from them to be roughly ~2/3rds as much as you would gain when diverting power to them. Most significantly, weapons take a smaller malus when diverting power away from them (now 0.9x instead of 0.7x). (Note that there seems to be a vanilla bug where the Shield malus is never applied for some reason)

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-444-0-2-1694549687.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.44
files.changelog_html:
Removed increases to Freighter shield health, since damage from the player (or other starships) seems to be insignificant to them
Increased cost of Rebuilt Exosuit Modules by 2.5x (bought with Void Motes)
Decreased value of Royal Multi-Tools to ~0.33x since you no longer pay for them, to reduce how profitable it is to salvage them
Increased the bonuses at higher Classes (B, A, S) to trade-in / salvage value for Sentinel Interceptor starships
Lowered the maximum possible price for Atlantid Multi-Tools to 0.8x, and narrowed the possible range of prices. Now should cost 2-4k Nanites for a C Class, and 8-16k Nanites for an S Class depending on size (still much cheaper than upgrading one to S Class yourself)
Greatly increased the crafting requirements for the craftable Voltaic Staff components. Now each of the 3 parts requires at least ~1.5 million units worth of Recycled Circuitry (purchasable from most trade terminals in PTSd), as well as higher numbers of Radiant Shards, etc. This should incentivize instead collecting Void Motes to buy the purchasable Staff components, and makes it less feasible to craft your own Staff just to salvage it for a profit.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.45
files.changelog_html:
Slightly raised the Gold & Silver requirement for constructing the freighter Refiner Room back to vanilla levels, and increased the recipe cost 2x (Can purchase with Salvaged Frigate Modules, or with the less valuable Salvaged Data at the Anomaly after unlocking the Large Refiner). This should help further incentivize unlocking the Large Refiner first.
Corrected a formatting error in the previous version for adding custom ship shields, etc.
Applied changes to Sentinel Freighters to mirror recent vanilla changes (less health, more shields)

files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-445-0-2-1696191178.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.45
files.changelog_html:
When giving Travelers 15 nanites, instead of rewarding a large amount of units (~200k on average), they now reward ~30 Di-Hydrogen & Tritium.
Added optional multipliers in "PTSd Rewards Remixer.lua" for users to adjust the % chance of finding various quality levels of upgrade modules in Damaged Machinery (search for "Damaged Machinery" to find section).
For users re-paking individual .lua files themselves, for better organization the resulting .pak filename produced from individual .lua files should now match the .lua filename (sometimes with additional version numbering, etc.)
Tidied up of some .lua files to remove 89 benign "Notices" when running through AMUMSS. Running all PTSd .luas through AMUMSS at once now should only report a total of 20 Warnings & 20 Notices (which can be safely ignored)

files.description: This is the PTSd Missions and Rewards module, but re-paked without the PTSd Farther Target Sweep.lua file. Use in place of the default module to keep vanilla distances for most Target Sweep missions to ensure mission markers are shown in multiplayer
files.changelog_html:
When giving Travelers 15 nanites, instead of rewarding a large amount of units (~200k on average), they now reward ~30 Di-Hydrogen & Tritium.
Added optional multipliers in "PTSd Rewards Remixer.lua" for users to adjust the % chance of finding various quality levels of upgrade modules in Damaged Machinery (search for "Damaged Machinery" to find section).
For users re-paking individual .lua files themselves, for better organization the resulting .pak filename produced from individual .lua files should now match the .lua filename (sometimes with additional version numbering, etc.)
Tidied up of some .lua files to remove 89 benign "Notices" when running through AMUMSS. Running all PTSd .luas through AMUMSS at once now should only report a total of 20 Warnings & 20 Notices (which can be safely ignored)

files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-445-0-3-1696715523.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.45
files.changelog_html: Reduced the purchase cost of most Frigates to ~0.33x previous values (the unique 200,000,000 unit frigates instead reduced to 0.5x cost), though still generally above vanilla costs. With PTSd's decreases to frigate expedition rewards, it was taking too long for the "Return On Investment" for buying a frigate. Now buying a frigate should roughly take in the ballpark of ~10 expeditions to "pay for itself", on average.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-445-0-4-1698952516.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.45
files.changelog_html:
To make sure you never lose value when cooking Hypnotic Eyes, increased the value of Abyssal Stew, Iced Screams, and Horrifying Mush by ~2x. Also increased the value of Syrupy Viscera by ~1.05x to widen the gap in profit with the alternative Hypnotic Eye recipes.
Readjusted the values & growth mechanics of the "trade goods" crops: Albumen Pearls, Gravitino Balls, Sac Venom, & Nipnip Buds due to several issues:
• Nipnip Buds accidentally had +50% intended value due to an error on my part
• When comparing the profitability of these crops against the "crafting" farm crops, I had failed to account for the value of non-farmed components of the "farm goods", e.g. Geodesite, Superconductor, etc.
• A vanilla issue with % chance based crop spawning sets the "seed" for what will be harvested once at time of construction, and never "re-rolls", so a planted crop would either always yield a crop or always yield nanites.
To address these issues, the following changes have been made:
• Nipnip buds value decreased to ~0.55x, and Albumen Pearl value to ~0.9x
• On top of the above change, the value for Albumen Pearls, Gravitino Balls, and Sac Venom have all been reduced a further 0.5x.
• The yield of Albumen Pearls, Gravitino Balls, and Sac Venom have been effectively been doubled. Wild version yield 2x items on harvest, and farmed versions drop the item at 100% rate.
• The nanite yields for the farmed version of these same crops likewise now drop at 100% rate, but at halved amount each time.
• Both the stack size and required ingredient amount for any recipes using these items have been doubled
• Altogether these changes should result in effectively the same yields/outputs as before (aside from the reduction for Albumen Pearls & Nipnip Buds), just without any % chance RNG for the farmed versions anymore
Removed 2 more benign "Notices" when re-pakking certain .lua files with AMUMSS
• Growth time for Sac Venom increased from 12 hours to 16 hours, to ensure it should only get harvested once per day with normal playstyles (with some wiggle room to allow for changing play schedule)

files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-452-0-2-1709435552.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.52
files.changelog_html:
Made the OMEGA expedition reward ship, the Starborn Runner, also come at C Class with fewer inventory slots by default, like the Golden Vector and Utopia Speeder (can be reverted to vanilla Class & size in "PTSd Rewards Remixer.lua")
Increased cost to buy Artifact Charts to 5 Nav Data, and corrected an error that had them at vanilla cost
Chance to receive Exosuit Upgrade Chart instead of Navigation Data from Ancient Data Structures lowered from ~9% to ~5% (editable in "PTSd Rewards Remixer.lua")
I still am not doing a thorough balancing on cooked foods, and while in general most of the new "Biscuit" recipes are still more profitable / efficient than older recipes, a few new Biscuit recipes were incredibly profitable even compared to the others, so I've toned down the outliers such as Cream Fingers & Fish Biscuits. I also raised up a few underperformers, for example increased the value of Biscuits made with Flesh Rope or NipNip Buds so they remain profitable with PTSd values. Full changes in "PTSd Resource + Product + Construction Rebalance.lua"
Similarly, adjusted the ingredients used in some alternative recipes for the Wriggling tack / Haunted Wafer Biscuits to ensure they stay profitable with PTSd ingredient values, such as removing Hypnotic Eyes as a possible ingredient

files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-452-0-3-1709518189.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.52
files.changelog_html: Lowered the stat bonuses for Exotic starships at lower Classes (C, B, & A) so they smoothly progress from C to S Class (S Class stats left unchanged). This change only matters when redeeming the Starborn Runner ship at C Class.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-452-0-4-1710104431.zip
files.description:
Various difficulty/balance/progression adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.

Compatible with NMS v4.52
files.changelog_html:
Added the unique "Atlas Sceptre" staff to the list of expedition rewards that come as C Class with fewer slots by default
Reduced the Cargo & Tech Slot upgrade limit for Exotic starships at lower Classes to match the pattern of other starships (upgrade limits at S Class unchanged, only relevant when redeeming the Starborn Runner at C Class)
Increased the Cargo Slot upgrade limit for Fighter starships by +5 at lower Classes to match the pattern of other starships of the same size (upgrade limit at S Class unchanged)
Reduced starting Cargo Slots for the Radiant Pillar from 12 to 8 to more closely match "wild" small Fighters (Makes buying other low-inventory starships more appealing, makes it less valuable when trading in / salvaging, also encourages upgrading ship storage, buying an exocraft, or more storage containers from the anomaly early on for more storage)
Pre-damaged slots on crashed starships or broken non-Sentinel Multi-Tools (most Multi-Tools including Royals from Sentinel Pillars, but NOT Sentinel Mult-Tools from Abandoned Camps) now have a 50% chance to also cost some Cadmium/Emeril/Indium to repair in addition to their normal costs (~16%/~16%/~16% chance for each metal). They also have a ~67% chance (for starships) / ~42% chance (for Multi-Tools) to cost an additional 1-2 Wiring Looms. This should make it a bit more difficult & costly to fully repair something right when you get it, and further increase the value of Repair Kits, which can be still used instead of the Indium, etc. (Can be changed in "PTSd Tech + Upgrade + Recipe + Blueprint cost Rebalance.lua" with the various SLOT_DMG entries)
