files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-564-0-8-1745615079.zip
files.description:
Various balance/progression/difficulty adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.
Compatible with NMS v5.64
files.changelog_html:
Nutrient Ingestor effects largely reworked (with updated in-game description), as with further testing I've discovered that the vanilla version's glitches still result in preposterously large bonuses when using buffed tech/upgrades in supercharged slots (especially for "multiplicative" stats), regardless of how much I've reduced the food buffs themselves
• Nutrient Ingestor bonuses no longer apply to all tech / upgrade modules with the relevant stat, but only to ones in supercharged slots with the relevant stat
• The strength of the bonus is now always ~1.83x (~+83%) applied multiplicatively to the relevant stat within the tech/upgrade module in the supercharged slot, on top of the usual supercharged slot bonus (regardless of food quality).
• Most Nutrient Ingestor bonuses to "multiplicative" stats have been replaced with bonuses  to "additive" stats that affect something similar, if possible. E.G. The Mining Speed & Resources Mined bonuses have been replaced with a bonus to Exocraft Mining Laser Power, etc. Notably, Breathing Efficiency bonuses are replaced with Exocraft Boost Tank Size bonuses.
• All Nutrient Ingestor buff durations reduced to 0.5x
• While unfortunately this is more restrictive than the vanilla implementation, it offers some interesting choices for supercharging certain techs / upgrades which normally don't benefit as much from being supercharged. It's also nice that it becomes more powerful the more supercharged slots you have access to, and gaining the maximum benefit from it requires you to potentially miss out on supercharging other techs/upgrades you would normally put in the supercharged slots.
Iced Screams and Syrupy Viscera now give a bonus to Words Translated in the Nutrient Ingestor, like most other foods cooked with Hypnotic Eyes
Exocraft Mining Laser & Minotaur Laser base damage increased ~1.22x & 1.12x, and all Exocraft & Minotaur Mining Laser upgrade modules had their Mining Power bonus increased a further 3x to allow them to remain competitive with Multi-Tool mining rates for longer. While the best, maxed out Multi-Tool can still obtain substances faster, the new Nutrient Ingestor bonuses to Exocraft Laser Power are enough to temporarily bring Exocraft mining rates much closer.
Precision Minotaur Laser and Minotaur Laser upgrade modules have their damage bonuses increased a further 1.25x so that the Minotaur Laser always remains ~1.15x stronger than the Exocraft Mining Laser with matching upgrades
As the Minotaur Mining Laser now gains much more damage from upgrade modules and can also benefit from Nutrient Ingestor bonuses to Exocraft Laser Power, the Hardframe Left Arm tech only provides a 2.5x Mining Laser damage bonus to stunned targets instead of 5x
Tethys Beam base damage reduced to ~0.93x and no longer can mine "difficult" minerals by default, but now has an unlockable Advanced Tethys Beam tech like the Exocraft/Minotaur Mining Lasers which enables this and further improves mining power even more
Minotaur Laser and Tethys Beam tech descriptions note their increased power relative to the Exocraft Mining Laser
The Mining Speed bonuses on Mining Laser upgrade modules follow a smoother progression from Class C to Class S/X
B Class Exocraft Boost upgrade modules will no longer have a chance to give a smaller bonus to Boost Tank size than C Class upgrade modules
Supercharging the Scanner multi-tool tech now makes it recharge faster instead of slower, unlike vanilla
Liquidator Body tech requires 1 less Walker Brain but 1 more Recycled Circuitry to install
The Minimal/Hostile levels for the Space Combat Difficulty Setting now adjust enemy health in space to 66%/133% instead of 80%/120%
Added more details to various Difficulty Setting descriptions such as all of the different Combat Settings, Damage Levels, Survival Difficulty, etc. to note the importance of things like supercharging weapon techs and give some basic tips.
PTSd-added technologies and items, such as the Advanced Tethys Beam, Minotaur Ultra Radar Array, Discordant Key, etc. now appear in the in-game Catalogue

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-564-0-9-1746124348.zip
files.description:
Various balance/progression/difficulty adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.
Compatible with NMS v5.64
files.changelog_html:
Corrected a formatting issue since the Worlds Part II update which was causing the value of scanning or discovering fauna, flora, minerals, systems, planets, & waypoints to get multiplied multiple times, making some scanning units rewards smaller and some discovery nanites rewards much larger than intended. (Notably, waypoint discoveries were giving 12x more nanites than intended) On top of this, the nanites for all types of discoveries besides fauna (they already have a huge nanite reward for discovering all fauna on a planet) have all been increased ~1.5x - 2.5x from their previously intended values, as well as waypoints giving 3x the nanites directly from activating them.
All planetary creatures now have a small chance to be found only in the North/South hemisphere. Most planets should now have 1~2 creatures on average which are only found in the North/South hemisphere.
Many more varieties of planetary creatures are either nocturnal/diurnal or mostly active during the night/day, with "Always Active" creatures now being in the minority. Some slight patterns with things like glowing creatures or predators being more likely to be active at night, plant-creatures being more likely to be active during the day, etc.
These 2 above changes not only make the creature you see vary more with your location & time of day, but should also make completing the full fauna discovery nanite bonus for the huge nanite reward require a bit more time & effort than just landing in one spot and scanning for ~30 seconds. This also indirectly makes it a bit harder to find a planet with a convenient variety of creatures you can gather at the same location & time to harvest a particular combination of cooking ingredients from. Neither change should affect creature generation / sync with vanilla discovery data, etc. but just in case, both sets of changes can be toggled off at the top of "PTSd Creature Loot Changes.lua". Alternatively, deleting all folders & files besides "CREATUREPETBEHAVIOURTABLE.MBIN" in MODS\PTSd Incoming Damage and Predators\METADATA\SIMULATION\ECOSYSTEM will disable these changes.
Newly recommended mod, "gCreatures Underground Creature Fix", 3x version. Makes it far more reliable to spawn & find rare/uncommon underground creatures to complete fauna discovery bonuses, offsetting how PTSd now requires more effort overall to discover all fauna on a planet.
Predators which are hostile to the player (including underwater sharks in PTSd) are now mostly active at night, so should be encountered less frequently during the day. In exchange, predators found on planets are now ~1.2x more likely to be hostile to the player.
Foods which restored between 1~3 health when consumed directly (most raw meat, most small cooked fish, etc.) now only restore 1 health. Foods which restored 3 health when consumed directly (certain more complicated dishes, most larger cooked fish, etc.) now restore 2 health.
Most raw meat and small cooked fish now note in their description that they can be consumed directly to restore some health.
In-game guides and tooltips should now note that you can have up to 5 copies of the same type of upgrade module installed, instead of vanilla's limit of 3. Several Difficulty Setting descriptions now mention PTSd's 5 upgrade module limit, and how it allows for more adjacency bonuses
Procedural Hazard Protection upgrade modules which provide a fixed duration of protection (including underwater breathing) now note in their description that there is little benefit to installing multiple copies as they each need to be recharged individually.
Edited descriptions of various buildings like Exocraft Geobays or automated harvesters for clarity. Also clarified that the Exocraft Summoning Station works across any distance, including other star systems.
Scanner Recharge Difficulty Setting description notes more details about the actual functions of the Exosuit, Starship, and Exocraft scanners
Damage Difficulty Setting now notes that like in vanilla, Exosuit health does not automatically regenerate. Various other Difficulty Setting descriptions edited for clarity
The descriptions for Sticky 'Honey', Synthetic Honey, and Syrupy Nectar now note that they add significant value to foods cooked with them

.lua files included in download.

Settlements produce Di-hydrogen and Tritium instead of Launch Fuel and Frigate Fuel

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-572-0-2-1750474268.zip
files.description:
Various balance/progression/difficulty adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.
Compatible with NMS v5.72
files.changelog_html:
Added more items which can be produced by all settlements, such as all settlements being able to produce ~300,000 units/day worth of Trade Goods from the start, or Oxygen as an option from Industrial buildings
Added more race-specific settlement production options, both available from the start or from Entertainment/Bar buildings. In particular, each race should now have a method of generating nanites (Refining Inverted Mirrors / Radiant Shards for Autophage, direct Nanites for Korvax, selling upgrade modules from Salvaged Glass for Vy'keen, donating cakes/pies to Cronus for Gek)
Changed which Trade Goods are available from settlements slightly so that items which are required by some PTSd recipes, such as Star Silk, Autonomous Positioning Unit, etc. are possible options.
Replaced certain production options, such as Warp Cells with Antimatter, or Geknip with NipNip Buds
Greatly increased the production rate of Trade Goods, so now having 4 top-tier settlements can result in ~4.8 million units worth of Trade Goods per day (~1.33x as many units per day as a single pre-Beacon PTSd settlement). Gek settlements can reach a further ~1.5x as many units per day on top of this, compared to other settlements.
Crafting ingredient Products from Industrial buildings such as Enriched Carbon, Semiconductor, etc. have production rates that make them only 0.4x~0.7x as profitable as Trade Goods if sold directly, but 1.6x~1.3x as profitable as Trade Goods if you have the resources to "upgrade" them at least one step further in the crafting tree (even after accounting for the value of the resources needed) before selling them. E.G. Combing the Enriched Carbon with Nitrogen Salt to make Hot Ice and then selling it.
Production rate for most substances roughly doubled, having 4 settlements all producing substances can yield up to ~3,200 per day if making Di-hydrogen/Tritium/most gases (more than 2x what a single pre-Beacon PTSd settlement used to).
Production rates for crops/plants now more closely follow the pattern set by Hydroponic Trays, e.g. Frost Crystal grows faster than other crops, Solanium grows slower, Star Bulb has less yield, etc.
Reworked Settlement production rates & storage caps:
• The new "base" rate for all settlements is 1 product or 40 substances every ~2.4 hours. This works out to ~10 items or ~400 substances per day. The shorter production cycle time of ~2.4 hours means making settlement decisions, adding debt, etc. is much less disruptive to production since at most it can only reset up to ~2.4 hours worth of production time, instead of an entire day's worth. (NOTE: A Vanilla bug causes settlement production rates to become slightly slower as the settlement develops instead of becoming faster, so settlements with low population/happiness/productivity will actually produce items faster)
• By default settlements can store up to 3 day's worth of production before collecting (30 products or 1200 substances)
• However, various items are also adjusted individually across all types of settlements, such as crops/plants having lower production rate (and proportionally lower storage cap, to maintain a 3 day's worth stockpile), or Trade Goods having higher production rate / caps, etc.
• Gek settlements have 1.25x production speed for all items, but can only stockpile 0.6x as many items as other settlements (which works out to 1.5 day's worth of items at Gek rates). This makes them more productive overall if you play often and will visit your settlement every day or so to collect.
• Vy'keen settlements have 0.8x production speed for all items, but can stockpile 1.6x as many items as other settlements (which works out to 6 day's worth of items at Vy'keen rates). This makes them more productive overall if you don't play as often and will only visit your settlement once a week or so.
• Korvax & Autophage settlements use the "base" production rates & storage
In addition to their race-specific items and general rate/cap multipliers, each race is particularly skilled with a specific settlement building type:
• Gek settlements have 1.2x production speed and storage amount (on top of their rate & cap multipliers listed above) for items produced by "Commercial" buildings, ie Trade Goods (De-scented Bottles, Fusion Cores, etc.)
• Vy'keen settlements have 1.2x production speed and storage amount (on top of their rate & cap multipliers listed above) for items produced by "Agricultural" buildings, ie crops/plants (Faecium, Cactus Flesh, etc.)
• Korvax settlements have 1.2x production speed and storage amount for items produced by "Starport" buildings, ie fuels (Di-hydrogen, Tritium, etc.)
• Autophage settlements have 1.2x production speed and storage amount for items produced by "Industrial" buildings, ie crafting ingredients (Enriched Carbon, Semiconductor, etc.)
• This 1.2x rate & cap multiplier also applies to the race-specific item which can be produced from the start without any additional buildings (e.g. Platinum for Gek, Mordite for Vykeen, etc.)
Increased purchase price for Metal Plating, Carbon nanotubes, and Hermetic Seal by ~1.25x, decreased purchase price for Starshield Batteries to ~0.44x to bring them closer to the same ballpark as the cost of buying the substances used to craft them.

Marrow Bulb's production rate and storage cap in settlements reduced to 0.6x, but now only requires a Class B Agricultural building, while the 6 biome-specific crops (Frost Crystal, etc.) require a Class A Agricultural building instead
Kelp Sac's production rate and storage cap in settlements increased 1.2x
Settlement expedition failure rate increased to 15% since gaining population is now easier than pre-Beacon. Expedition description now lists the chance of failure.
Added note to the description of the Settlement Mission Log & Guide entry to list the strengths/weaknesses of the various races' settlements

Various balance/progression/difficulty adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.
Compatible with NMS v6.01
files.changelog_html:
Most Corvette module bonuses not yet adjusted, will likely be unbalanced until I adjust the stats & prices after time to properly out how they interact (especially since PTSd allows 5x module bonuses of the same type)
Corvette base stats & handling roughly adjusted to be on the lower end of the ballpark for "regular" starships (before adding any bonuses from Corvette modules), but with much higher tech slots to hold all the module bonuses
Corvette bonus to Pulse Jump speed decreased from 3x to 1.33x
Solar Ships bonus to Pulse Jump speed increased from 1.2x to 1.5x
Removed Launcher auto-recharging effect from all Corvette modules which had that bonus
Certain functional interior parts for Corvettes (e.g. cargo racks / refiner / cooking / planter walls) now must be unlocked at the Anomaly under their corresponding "normal" versions, and/or require more ingredients to construct
Rewards from Corvette Missions via Mission Radar adjusted to match the equivalent Space Station / Nexus missions in PTSd
Corvette part droprate from Salvageable Scrap nodes greatly reduced, amount given as optional reward at end of Derelict Freighters slightly increased

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-602-0-1-1756796552.zip
files.description:
Various balance/progression/difficulty adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.
Compatible with NMS v6.02
files.changelog_html:
Many adjustments to Corvette modules, both their bonuses/strengths and which "groups" of shared limit of 5 installed bonuses each belongs to. With several new debuffs tied to Corvette Cockpits, the main concept for Corvettes is now that they start off worse than standard starships in many respects, but can also get powerful bonuses from modules. However due to many bonuses coming from modules in shared "groups" with one another,  the player must choose between "spreading out" the bonuses across various stats to offset the initial Corvette debuffs as a "jack of all trades", or specializing and focusing on a few stats to make the Corvette as good or better than any standard ship in that respect, but worse off in other areas. (As in vanilla, if the player chooses a small Corvette with few modules to grant bonuses, the tradeoff is there will be more tech inventory room to install standard upgrade modules instead)
• Adjusted the strength of bonuses for Corvette modules and eliminated the randomness of the bonus strength. Now a particular type of Corvette module will always give the exact same strength of bonus when installed, and thus will match the strength shown in the Corvette editor. Specific values are still slightly WIP and likely to be adjusted
• Default Corvette launch cost increased 1.4x, meaning it cannot be summoned (unless it is currently hovering in atmosphere, which is always free) without additional landing gear / Azimuth Reactors, or launcher upgrades. However with enough landing gear / Azimuth Reactors, the cost can become extremely low, even below Explorers.
• Similarly, Default Corvette Pulse Jump fuel consumption rate increased 1.4x, Pulse Jump speed reduced to 0.8x, and Boost Speed reduced to 0.6x, but these can all be improved with appropriate Corvette modules / Reactors / standard upgrade modules to generally match or exceed a typical starship.
• Modules which add cargo slots (Habs & Walkways) now also slightly reduce Boost Speed and Maneuverability, since the vanilla mechanic for making larger Corvettes slower does not appear to be working currently. Like other Corvette module groups, this only applies to at most 5 installed modules.
• The 4 different Reactor modules for Corvettes are now in a single "reactor" module group, meaning you can only gain stat bonuses from 5 reactors total, instead of 5 of each type of reactor. This both reduces how many tech slots are taken up and allows the option to specialize Corvettes into different roles instead of always being jack-of-all-trades when maxed out. The choice of which combination of Reactor(s) to install should now have a big influence on the performance of the Corvette. (Can be reverted with the MergeCorvetteReactorGroups & MergeCorvetteWeaponGroups toggles in PTSd Starship Tech Changes.lua)
• Similarly, all Corvette weapon modules are now in a single "defensive systems" module group. This means you have the choice between having one extremely powerful weapon with the others being quite weak (due to the Corvette's low Damage bonus stat), or having 2 or 3 weapons which are each moderately powerful, allowing to swap against different defenses or when one is close to overheating, while still remaining strong.
• Changed & differentiated the bonuses for the different styles of Engines. Heavy Booster engines give mostly Boost Speed, Sublight Thrusters give mostly Pulse Jump speed, and Jets/Pyrodrive give mostly Maneuverability. This means the player must choose which stat to prioritize, as bonuses will only be granted by up to 5 engines.
• Similarly, the different landing gears give a different balance between Launch Cost, Boost Speed, and Pulse Jump fuel efficiency
• Decorative exterior Cargo Pods are now purely cosmetic and do not add cargo slots or take up tech slots
Corvette top speed in space increased to slightly above "Normal" weight (Shuttles), while top speed in atmosphere left at "Heavy" weight (Haulers), and base maneuverability in atmosphere slightly lowered.
Life support drain rate in space increased 2.5x
Pulse Jump fuel efficiency bonus from Engine upgrade modules for standard & Living Ships reduced in strength to 0.75x
Launch Cost discount bonus from Launcher upgrade modules for standard & Living Ships reduced in strength to 0.75x
Names/descriptions for PTSd-added items such as the Dissonant Compass should now display regardless of what language setting is used (the text will always be in English). Also added instructions at the top of "PTSd UI Description Adjustments.lua" on how to force PTSd edits to vanilla names/descriptions to display when using other language settings in order to see more accurate info or context & tips for PTSd (this will make edited names/descriptions display in English)
Fixed vanilla bug with Corvette Torpedo Launcher wrongly applying to Cyclotron Ballista instead of Rockets
Fixed mistakenly adding all Corvette modules to the list of buildable parts for bases / freighters in the previous PTSd update
Small adjustments to the base stats of Corvettes (upgrading the Class of a Corvette or building a new one will use the updated stats)
• Shield Generators are now also part of the same "group" as weapon modules, but also give added bonuses in different areas, like a mini-reactor. This allows you to choose to sacrifice offensive power by installing fewer weapon modules and using those "slots" to install a few shield generators instead to further boost other stats and defenses.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-603-0-4-1757120447.zip
files.description:
Various balance/progression/difficulty adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.
Compatible with NMS v6.03
files.changelog_html:
The temporary teleporters to return you to a Corvette from a planet's surface now cost 1 Navigation Data to "unlock" them for that specific location (can keep re-using the same temporary teleporter without paying additional Nav Data, but moving the Corvette to a new location will spawn a new temporary teleporter which will cost 1 Nav Data to "unlock"). So instead of never landing and getting around for free, the intended method in PTSd is to either land normally or spend 1 Nav Data to allow multiple teleport trips at a particular spot. Since teleporting down is always free, if you realize you have no Nav Data the Corvette can always be freely summoned down to the surface if it is currently hovering in atmosphere.
Unlisted change from previous PTSd version: Certain Corvette modules with special animations or particle effects (such as various landing gears) which only used to animate up to 4 modules, now will animate up to 6 modules (since PTSd incentivizes installing at least 5 of all the core modules)
Animation limit for Corvette Wing modules increased from 4 to 6 (e.g. spinning rotors, etc.)
• This can be toggled off with CovetteTeleportCost in "PTSd More Expensive Costs etc.lua" and recompiling with AMUMSS, or by simply deleting "No Man's Sky\GAMEDATA\MODS\PTSd Prices and Tech etc\MODELS\COMMON\SPACECRAFT\BIGGS\TELEPORTER\ENTITIES\TELEPORTER.ENTITY.MBIN"

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-603-0-5-1757266205.zip
files.description:
Various balance/progression/difficulty adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.
Compatible with NMS v6.03
files.changelog_html:
Basic Corvette Parts purchased from the Corvette workshop on space stations can now also be used to trade for Advanced Corvette parts. (Due to how Bartering/Trading only uses a fraction of the value of the items you offer, if you need multiple Advanced parts it will generally be much more economical to search for some of the parts you need via loot instead of trading for everything)
Newly built Corvettes should start with more tech slots unlocked to better accommodate initial Corvette modules, and removed variation for initial slots. Now new Corvettes should always have a base of 9 cargo + 21 tech slots (before factoring in any module bonuses)
Increased Thunderbird Landing Thruster's discount to Launch Cost & Pulse Jump fuel consumption to ~1.9x
Reduced Kineostream Thruster's malus to Pulse Jump fuel consumption to ~0.67x
Reduced the Shield Strength malus from Corvette weapon modules to 0.25x, as it previously could result in negative shield stats with multiple modules installed
Reduced the bonus to Shield Strength from Corvette shield generators to ~0.67x
Updated info for recommended mod Companion Riding Improvements to point to an unofficial .EXML update which doesn't require merging

files.changelog_html:

Decreased Sentinel Interceptor's discount to Pulse Jump fuel consumption from -20% to -10%, but also increased their Pulse Jump Speed bonus from 1x to 1.2x, which should work out to even less fuel spent per distance traveled than before
Fixed the "ADVANCE: DEFEND" Milestone in the Voyagers Expedition not recognizing installed Shield Generators with PTSd (and also fixed a vanilla minor UI bug with the displayed messages for the milestone)

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-604-0-3-1757815546.zip
files.description:
Various balance/progression/difficulty adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.
Compatible with NMS v6.04
files.changelog_html:
Another attempt at a fix for the problem of planetary pirate raids instantly killing the player on foot: When away from any "raidable" buildings, pirate raiders should now attack with a single ship at a time and fire only once every ~2 seconds. When near "raidable" buildings, the behavior is unchanged from previous versions of PTSd where the pirates should not be firing directly at the player, and there should be a long enough warning to give time to hide just in case. This has been a difficult problem to replicate, so please let me know if any issues still remain.
The changes to Base Radius in "gBase Boundary 2k+FarwalkX.lua" have been removed, which allowed for larger bases but also caused other player's bases in Expeditions to "claim" terrain in a larger area. However the base mod "gBase Boundary 2k" is now an .EXML style mod, so it can be safely added & removed as desired when using PTSd for the same effect without any merging required.
In exchange, they will have doubled health, fire their lasers after taking less damage, and drop better loot.

files.name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition
files.file_name: No Man's - Prepare To Sky Edition-2225-604-0-4-1758051099.zip
files.description:
Various balance/progression/difficulty adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.
Compatible with NMS v6.04
files.changelog_html:
The cost of 1 Navigation Data to unlock the teleporter back to the Corvette now works properly both over water as well as on land, instead of unintentionally always being free over water.
Increased the unlock cost of Corvette Cargo Racks from 1 Salvaged Data to the same cost as unlocking the corresponding Storage Container (5-20 Salvaged Data), and shifted their position to be below Freighter Storage Rooms in the unlock tree
Increased the construction cost of Cargo Racks significantly, they now require 5 Metal Plating, and 3 Recycled Circuitry in place of Microprocessors to build, and also added increasingly higher-tier stellar metals (Cadmium, Emeril, etc.) or Atlas Seeds (State Phasure, Novae Reclaiment, etc.) as an ingredient for each of them. (The extra stellar metal / Atlas Seed requirements can be removed in "PTSd Product + Crafting Rebalance.lua" by searching for "Cargo Racks")
These changes should mean that adding 1 or 2 Cargo Racks to a Corvette is still doable early on, but matching the full storage access of a freighter or base will only be possible late-game and will be significantly more expensive. (If you've already built many Cargo Racks but still want to use the new recipe restrictions, simply delete the existing ones and then also delete the refunded crafting ingredients)
Added an optional CorvStorageBuildable toggle in gBase Items BasicX.lua to completely disallow building Corvette Cargo Racks at all
Many Difficulty settings in Expeditions can now be lowered 1 step lower than is normally possible in vanilla if desired, to offset PTSd's increased overall difficulty for users who want a challenge closer to vanilla during an Expedition. (can be toggled off at the top of "PTSd Other Difficulty Settings.lua")
However enabling the option to set Crafting Costs to "Free" during an Expedition (as a potential temporary workaround for when gathering the required ingredients for an item's PTSd recipe is not possible during an Expedition), requires manually setting "CraftingIsFree" to true in the "SEASON_DATA_CACHE.JSON" file of the cache folder of your savegame folder, "\AppData\Roaming\HelloGames\NMS" by default for Steam on Windows. (This edit just makes it possible to set Crafting to free via the Difficulty Setting menu in the Expedition, it doesn't directly make crafting free)

files.name: PTSd Missions and Rewards - No Farther Target Swee
files.file_name: PTSd Missions and Rewards - No Farther Target Swee-2225-501-1-1-1758298705.zip
files.description: This is the PTSd Missions and Rewards module, but re-paked without the PTSd Farther Target Sweep file. Use in place of the default module to keep vanilla distances for most Target Sweep missions to ensure mission markers are shown in multiplayer
files.changelog_html:
Solar starships can now have their Reactor Cores salvaged, like most other starships (Living ships & Interceptors still cannot)
Increased nanite unlock cost of Launch Auto-Charger by 1.2x
Aqua Jets can no longer be found pre-installed on "wild" starships, now require more Vent Gems & the 5th Atlas Seed to craft. This makes it more of a later-game option, so that the Nautilon still has a purpose in the mid-game.
"Saline Carapace", the Aqua-Jets equivalent for Living Ships, is now much less likely to be found in Psychonic Eggs, similar to the "Chloroplast Membrane" Launch Auto-Charger equivalent
The hostile large worm "Hungering Tendrils" / "Titan Worms" have a chance to appear in up to ~1.67x larger groups
Biological Horror spit attack damage increased ~2x
Vile Queen, hostile bugs, and "Titan Worms" combat abilities improved
Vile Queens now always drop 1 Hypnotic Eye & ~250 Runaway Mould, with a 50% chance to also drop a procedural loot item of Uncommon rarity/value. The chance to drop the new bug helmets is now 50%~12.5% depending on how many you've already found, instead of a flat 25%. However, all Vile Queens on the same planet will drop the same loot, so obtaining all the helmets will require visiting multiple planets with Vile Queens.
The crafting recipes for the various Liquidator Mech parts now each require a Hardframe Engine, just like the Sentinel Hardframe parts
Liquidator Mech Flamethrower gains much more damage from upgrade modules, becoming a respectable weapon when maxed out and supercharged (as in vanilla, the listed + damage % bonus on Flamethrower upgrades is incorrectly displayed extremely high for some reason)
New foods adjusted to match PTSd balance for units value. Notably, the new Syrupy Nectar is particularly valuable when cooked in recipes, just like Honey. Some old foods had values slightly tweaked, such as all Thick, Sweet Batter foods value slightly reduced.
Removes the Cake of Eternal Sleep alternative recipe that uses Syrupy Batter (through Monstrous Custard), as it is significantly less profitable than the Wailing Batter recipes
Adds 1 Processed Sugar to the Cake Batter versions of the Syrup-Drenched Delight recipe
Juicy Grub value increased 6x and cooking it now yields 16x Nourishing Slime, so it is less of a loss to cook it
Refining Hypnotic Eye now produces 666 Runaway Mould instead of 50 Living Slime, so it is not a complete waste
Made warnings for planetary Pirate Raids more clear, including prompting to take cover

Various balance/progression/difficulty adjustments to the game, with a few new features & bug fixes.

.lua files included in download.
Compatible with NMS v6.10
files.changelog_html:
Increased crafting cost of Aeron Powershield & Aeron Drive to require roughly the same amount of units as the value of equivalent Corvette shield/engine modules
Adjusted bonus stats granted by new Corvette engine / landing gear / weapon / shield modules to be in line with current PTSd balance (Aeron Powershield & Aeron Drive have slightly more total bonuses than equivalent "standard" versions)
Slightly adjusted the bonuses for some older landing gear / engines to differentiate them from newly added modules. Mag-Field Landing Thrusters now give less fuel discount but added Maneuverability, and now all twin thruster rear-mounted engines give slightly better Maneuverability while single thruster rear-mounted engines give slightly better Boost speed (Kineostream Thruster unchanged)
Destroying the reactors on "derelict corvettes" found in space yields 2x as many corvette modules

files.changelog_html:
Corrected error which was causing most of the many PTSd edits to vanilla text in descriptions, dialogue, difficulty menu, etc. to not be applied in-game for the past several updates
Adjusted the special bonuses to hazard protection given to players during certain phases of the tutorial on new saves, so there is a less sudden drop in hazard protection time when fixing the Scanner. Hazard protection should now last 1.2x longer between fixing your Scanner and reaching your starship for the first time
Added hints to the mission logs & popup tips for the first few stages of the Tutorial on new saves, to suggest seeking shelter in caves & crafting Ion Batteries
Added a new "broken" tech that the Exosuit starts with on new saves which gives the same recommendations as above, similar to the "broken" tech in the starting multitool which gives advice

files.description: This is the PTSd Missions and Rewards module, but re-paked without the PTSd Farther Target Sweep file. Use in place of the default module to keep vanilla distances for most Target Sweep missions.
files.changelog_html: Recompiled to ensure compatibility with latest game version
files.content_preview_link: https://file-metadata.nexusmods.com/file/nexus-files-s3-meta/1634/2225/PTSd Missions and Rewards - No Farther Target Swee-2225-617-0-1-1763496236.zip.json

389.0.2: Mining Laser damage vs. creatures & Sentinels increased back to vanilla levels, as it was disabling creature critical weakpoints for mining lasers. Exocraft Mining Laser damage vs. creatures is still reduced from vanilla
Mining Laser critical damage multiplier reduced from 4x damage to 2x damage
Starting Hazard Protection charge on new game further increased from ~75% to 99%

Discovered starship shield bonuses from ship type were applying at ~71% effectiveness, not 33% effectiveness, and so lowered my extra shield multiplier from 2x to 1.4x to essentially make starship shield bonuses apply at 100% effectiveness
Doubled most starship shield bonuses from ship type, so in combination with the above change, now overall most ships' shield bonus will be ~40% more than in the previous version of PTSd

Tweaked some specific starship bonuses to create greater range between different types of ships: From the previous version, bonuses for Shuttles had Damage & Hyperdrive buffed ~33% & Shield buffed ~50% and no longer have -7 max Cargo Slots, Exotics Shield bonus buffed ~25% and removed the -10% to Damage & Hyperdrive, Solar Damage bonus buffed ~40%, Shield nerfed ~9%, price increased ~30%, Fighter Damage bonus buffed ~50%, Living Ship Hyperdrive bonus buffed ~16%, Shield nerfed ~36%
389.0.3: Reverted new game remaining Hazard Protection charge to previous version, but players now start the game with a single Ion Battery that they can choose to use to bring their survival time up to slightly longer than in vanilla.
389.0.4: Fixed issue with Exosuit General Inventory unlocking random additional slots on game load, by reverting starting General Inventory slots to vanilla amount (24 instead of 20). Changing the default amount was leading to this bug, and if you were impacted by this issue you can use a Save Editor to reset your inventory size to the appropriate amount.
389.0.5: Lowered the increased chance for tornadoes 50%
Corrected Paraffinium not having the increased purchase price as other substances
Freighter cargo pods take 5x as much damage to destroy
AI Squadron damage +50%
All NPC starships (enemy & ally) Hull & Shield health lowered 25%
Amount of pirates spawned for the "hunting pirates" space station missions lowered 25~50%

Retooled the damage & fire rate bonuses for starship weapon upgrade modules, as certain weapons gained far higher benefits from upgrades than others. Also for certain weapons shifted more of the bonus away from fire rate onto damage instead, to prevent all weapons from becoming machineguns when fully upgraded.
Photon Cannon & Spewing Vents:
+     Critical multiplier now 2x from 1.5x.  Damage from upgrades increased ~10%. Fire rate lowered 40%, but damage increased proportionally to compensate.
-     Base heat capacity lowered -20%.
Phase Beam & Gazing Eyes:
+     Damage increased 40%
-     Cooling rate reduced ~60%.  Overheat recovery time increased ~20%.
Positron Ejector:
+     Initial heat capacity increased 50%.  Base range increased ~16%.
-     Damage lowered -20%.  Overheat recovery time increased ~33%.  Heat capacity from upgrades lowered ~60%.
Infra-Knife Accelerator
+     Fire rate 33% faster, damage lowered proportionally to compensate.

-     Cooling rate reduced ~20%.  Base heat capacity lowered -25%.  Heat capacity from upgrades lowered -20%.  Critical multiplier now 1.2x from 1.5x.  Damage vs. shields lowered to 40% from 80%.  Damage from upgrades reduced ~30%.
Cyclotron Ballista:
+     Larger projectile.  Now 40% effective to hull, from 20%.  Fire rate lowered by 80%, damage is now 5x to compensate.  Damage from upgrades increased ~10%.
-     Overheat recovery time increased ~50%.  Damage reduced 10%.  Heat capacity from upgrades lowered ~30%.
Rockets:

+     Critical multiplier now 2.5x from 1.5x.  Damage vs shields raised to 60% from 40%.  Damage increased ~36%.  Large Rockets Tube tech now also increased damage by 50%, but has 3.5x increased blueprint price.
-     Overheat recovery time increased ~100%.
389.0.6: Fixed an issue with not all ingredients for Solar Panels showing in the UI. Solved by reducing the number of ingredients, recipe now needs 3 Metal Plates, 40 Gold, 2 Glass
389.0.7: Sentinel Interceptors adjusted: Now spawn in smaller groups at low wanted levels, but even larger groups at high wanted levels. Weaker but faster shields, only fire ~67% as rapidly, and weaker laser damage.
Strongest tier Pirates' shields now take 50% longer to reactivate and to recharge.
389.0.8: Enemy starships drop twice as many Starshield Batteries, and Space Station missions / Guild gifts reward roughly ~20% more of them as well.
Lowered number of pirates spawned during space station "hunt pirates" missions by -30% ~ -60%, especially for the Medium difficulty ones.
Solar Ship initial Pulse Drive fuel rate discount lowered from -80% to -60%
Added more convenient settings at the top of certain .lua files to adjust many things at once using a single setting:
*     "gDamage382XTEMP.lua" for adjusting all incoming damage to the player within various categories
*     "Space Combat+LargerX.lua" for NPC ship hull / shields
*     "RebalancedWeaponsX.lua" for damage the player deals while on foot / in Exocraft / in Starships (already present in previous version)
390.0.1: Reduced damage from planetary pirate raids to the player while on foot by 20%
Fixed the "Approximate Locations" for the "Under a Rebel Star" missions accidentally not being farther away like all the other missions as intended
391.0.1: Fixed the increases to predator frequency were accidentally missing

Separated the mod into multiple .pak files so that it is somewhat "modular". Editing the .luas and re-paking with AMUMSS is still recommended instead of removing individual "modules", see the "Customization" section on the description page for details.
393.0.1: No longer adds extra Quad Sentinel spawn to Wanted Level 4 Sentinel spawns
Added missing +50% buff to Unit reward for defeating planetary Pirate Raids

Renamed .lua scripts for more clarity of what they change, added fuller descriptions for what each script changes at the top of each .lua file, miscellaneous cleaning up to many .lua scripts to remove some unnecessary warning messages when using AMUMSS.
397.0.1:
Living ship initial slots reduced, and maximum inventory slots adjusted to be in line with other PTSd ships, with theme of few General slots, very many Tech slots.
Initial slots 18 / 21 / 10 General / Tech / Cargo
Max slots 25 / 42 / 21 (-10 / +21 / +7 compared to 'baseline')
Slightly nerfed Spewing Vents & Gazing Eyes to partially offset new vanilla buffs
Reduced the shield leech bonus from Gazing Eyes upgrade modules
Slightly buffed Positron Ejector upgrades to partially offset for new vanilla nerfs
Increased blueprint unlock cost for some new freighter rooms
Nutrition Room in freighter requires a Nutrient Processor to construct
Brought Mineral scan values back into line with flora / fauna values now that it is boosted by scanner upgrades
Slightly reduced freighter max cargo slots (49 > 42), but doubled initial cargo slots
Corrected small error in solar ship maximum inventory slots at Class A
398.0.1: ACTUALLY updated Reduced Launch costs to also include the special Advanced Launch System expedition reward (accidentally left it out last update))
Reverted Biodomes to not being buildable on freighters
Standing Planter carbon reward reduced by -50%
Harvestable plants on the walls of freighter rooms with greenery carbon reward reduced by -80%
Swapped position of Interstellar Scanner and Matter Beam in Freighter unlock tree to keep Matter Beam as an end-game tech
Adjusted required ingredients for various new freighter rooms / tech to make them a bit harder to acquire and less objectively superior to planetside versions:
•Interstellar Scanner now requires 1 Walker Brain and 1 Hardframe Engine
•Refiner Room now requires 8 microprocessors, but less Silver & Gold
•Cultivation & Double Cultivation Rooms now require 6 / 16 Metal Plates and increased Silver & Faecium
•Scanner Room now requires 30 Emeril and 1 Quantum Processor
•Orbital Exocraft Materializer now requires 50 Emeril and 1 Portable Reactor
398.0.2: Fixed accidentally adjusted heat bonus for Infraknife instead of Positron Ejector
398.0.3: Squadmates  have slightly faster boosting speed

Lowered max combat speed in space of enemy ships to ~800 / ~1,200u/s for slow / fast enemies: fresh C Class ships still won't outrun any enemies, but with some upgrades should reliably outrun weaker enemies, and with enough upgrades even haulers can eventually outrun even the fastest enemies. (Sometimes "Station Defenders" from attacking Space Stations seem to have increased speed for some reason)

Fixed mistake in adjusting Living Ship Gazing Eyes upgrade modules bonus shield leech effect. Now Gazing Eyes starts off with half the shield leech effect of Phase Beam, but with enough upgrade modules can have almost twice the shield leech effect of Phase Beam + Fourier Delimiter.
Increased maximum number of stats that Gazing Eyes upgrades can have, since Shield leech effect is now a possible stat for them.
Addressed an issue with how NMS handles certain items having increased value on space stations, which lead to Suspicious Packets selling for up to 1 million units when sold on space stations:

•To address this while working within NMS' limitations, now most items from Scrap Dealers cost 3x as much Tainted Metal, but all Tainted Metal rewards are also increased by 3x, and refining Tainted Metal consumes 3x as much to compensate. (If you currently have a large amount of Tainted Metal stored, you can use a Save Editor to triple the amount to balance out)
•Substances on space station now only have 30% higher purchase & selling price compared to off-station, instead of double purchase & selling price previously.
•NipNip Buds no longer sell for twice as much on space stations, and instead have the same purchase cost everywhere, which has been increased by +50%.
•Suspicious Packets sell value on space station reduced by -75% for (Tech) and (Weapons), and reduced by -66% for (Goods)
•Suspicious Packets (Tech) & (Weapon) purchase cost in units on Outlaw Stations lowered by -15%, and "effective" purchase cost in tainted metal from scrap dealer increased by +20%
•Repair kit "effective" purchase cost in tainted metal from scrap dealer lowered by -33%
•Suspicious upgrade module "effective" purchase cost in tainted metal from scrap dealer lowered by -67%
398.0.4: Fixed squadron pilot slot unlock costs accidentally having price for third and fourth pilot swapped
Tripled tainted metal stack size to account for tripled amount found in derelict freighters
Nanite reward for discovering Minerals lowered to 3x vanilla instead of 5x since minerals now award significant units
Stellar Extractor construction now costs 2x Silver & Gold, and 6 Gravitino Balls
Orbital Exocraft Materializer no longer purchasable on Anomaly (must be bought at freighter bridge's unlock station)
Organic Frigate price raised to be 2x that of regular frigates. (In vanilla they cost 5x regular frigates)
Increased cost of Minotaur & Nautilon scanner tech, reduced cost of level 2 & 3 vehicle scanner tech to make total costs more similar across different exocraft
Increased average unit reward for rescuing freighter by 40%
Cost of Coolant Network, Thermic Layer, Toxic Suppressor, and Radiation Deflector increased +33%
Aeration Membrane underwater breathing time bonus decreased -40%

Tweaked some values for planetary pirate raids / flybys to be less damaging, however there is an (apparently vanilla) issue where pirate raids on Planetary Archives don't use raiding behaviour and instead attack at full strength

Added setting in "gBase Items BasicX.lua" for users to optionally disable the player from constructing Teleporters in bases or freighters. (The player can still teleport to their base / freighter regardless)
399.0.1: Reduced Boltcaster base damage by -10% and bonuses from Sentinel Weapon upgrades by -25%, so that Boltcaster will start off slightly underpowered, but with both Boltcaster upgrades & Sentinel Weapon upgrades together will still be quite powerful
Increased Positron Ejector base damage by +17% and upgrade module bonus damage by a further +25% to better counteract the recent vanilla nerfs

Made the "Marrow Bulb + Condensed Carbon = Sodium" recipe finish much faster in exchange for the less efficient recipe compared to "Marrow Bulb + Carbon = Sodium" recipe, to fit with the pattern of most other PTSd recipes.
Updated branch of gBase to include some newer fixes:
• Biofuel reactor uses new vanilla behaviour (100 carbon for 45 hours of power)
• Reverted the freighter bulkhead door & internal freighter wall to no longer be free-placeable, as this would make them un-deletable
399.1.1: Reduced Unlock cost for Orbital Exocraft Materializer by -67% and Scanner Room by -25%
Adjusted some starship prices to ensure that Haulers have the best "price per inventory slot" value at all ship sizes (with an exception for Shuttles at small ship sizes):
• Explorers & Solar ships minimum ship size cost increased +50%, Hauler minimum ship size cost reduced -50%
• Explorer maximum ship size cost increased +10%, Hauler maximum ship size cost reduced -15%
(Re-uploaded to correct a typo in filename of the "PTSd Prices and Tech and Starship Speed and More.pak" module)
399.1.2: Adjusted the amounts of certain items required as part of the overall Expanding the Base questlines: Korvax Cube from 10 back to 1 as it made the UI Display confusing for that step, and VyKeen Daggers from 20 to 10 as they can be somewhat rare.

Autonomous Mining Units, Gas Harvesters, and Oxygen Harvesters now only take 10 / 10 / 8 minutes to complete a full cycle instead of 60 / 60 / 12 minutes. Since they are buggy in vanilla and often lose their contents when reloading or leaving the system, now it should be easier to have them complete at least a partial cycle while you are still in the area in one play session.

Damage to Depots or sealed security Doors reduced by -67% from Multi-Tool weapons,  -50% from vehicle weapons, and -80% from starship weapons compared to previous version to make it a bit riskier to try to completely ignore sentinels guarding depots / manufacturing facilities while breaking in early on.

Did some more extensive Multi-Tool weapon testing and rebalance. The base damage & % damage from upgrades have been adjusted for most MT weapons to bring them all roughly a bit closer in performance to where the Pulse Spitter / Blaze Javelin were previously:
• Boltcaster base damage increased +33%, % damage from upgrades increased +300%, % damage & fire rate from Sentinel upgrades decreased -33%
• Scatter Blaster base damage increased +38%, % damage from upgrades decreased -60%
• Neutron Cannon base damage increased +210%, % damage from upgrades reduced -70%. Also, the base damage of "uncharged" rapid-fire shots increased a further +~48%
• Blaze Javelin base damage reduced -20%, % damage from upgrades increased +150%
• Plasma Launcher base damage increased +45%, % damage from upgrades decreased -30%
399.1.3: Increased distance from the player that Patrol Drones spawn by 3x. This means that on Aggressive Sentinel Planets, drones no longer immediately detect the player upon spawning as they now will spawn outside their sight range.

In exchange, the area that Drones will "patrol" within from their starting point has had the radius roughly doubled, and regular & Aggressive Sentinel planets have 1 additional wandering Patrol Drone ("Low" Sentinel planets unchanged). Should now be possible (but risky) to land on Aggressive Sentinel Planets and "sneak" your way around patrol drones if you move cautiously and watchfully (rushing quickly can get you seen by a drone before you realize it's spawned).
Minotaur fuel usage rate +50%, jumpjet speed +33%. Should now start out a bit faster than the Colossus, although once maxed out the Colossus will slightly outspeed it.
AI-piloted Minotaur hits taken until receiving tech damage +50% (To balance out how PTSd's more frequent and rapidly firing sentinels cause damage faster)

Minotaur AI Pilot recipe cost increased to 8 Quantum Computer, 4 Wiring Loom, and 16 Autonomous Positioning Units (Instead of Antimatter). Along with the nanites cost, this makes it the "costly in nanites & units" option vs. the Trace of Metal quest's "costly in combat" option of achieving the same result.
Oxygen Harvester cycle time increased +25% to 10 minutes (still faster than vanilla)

Antimatter Reactor cycle time reduced -20% to 10 minutes, amount of antimatter produced reduced -60% to 8. Recipe unlock cost increased +67%, now requires 10 each of Storm Crystals, Antimatter, and Experimental Power Fluid (instead of Metal Plates) to construct.
Balance tweaks to some refiner recipes:
• Making Magnetised Ferrite from Ferrite Dust/Pure Ferrite + Carbon/Condensed Carbon requires slightly less Carbon/Condensed Carbon per Magnetised Ferrite produced.

• Recipes for getting more Condensed Carbon / Ionized Cobalt / Chlorine using Oxygen / Carbon as a "catalyst" now more clearly give better efficiency with "low tier" substances (e.g. Carbon) but better speed with "high tier" substances (e.g. Condensed Carbon)

• Adjusted the recipes for getting more Sodium Nitrate using Oxygen / Carbon / Condensed Carbon as a "catalyst", and recipes for getting more Ionised Cobalt using Marrow Bulbs according to the same pattern as the above recipes. (Previously unchanged from vanilla)
399.1.4: Removed Pugneum / Life Support Gel from recipes for several of the Sentinel Hardframe Minotaur techs so that they only have 3 ingredients total, to ensure the UI properly displays all ingredients
Nanite cost to ask a Traveller directions to a grave for portal glyphs increased 5x (also affects the nanite cost for a few specific alien NPC dialog choices)
Carbon needed to make Creature Pellets in the Nutrient Processor reduced -20% to 20 Carbon for 1 Creature Pellet
Crystal Sulphide unit value reduced -30%, and yield of Sodium Nitrate when refined reduced -25% (still higher than vanilla)

Fixed a mistake in how I calculated how the game handles bonuses to Hyperdrive Range, especially for Living Ships. Previously the buffs to Hyperdrive Range bonuses in PTSd were resulting in some ships in practice only reaching 60~80% of the actual lightyear ranges that I was intending. Most starships & the freighter now have their Hyperdrive bonuses increased a further ~1.5x to ~2.5x to correct this. Additionally, I did some slight rebalancing, mainly to buff Haulers & slightly nerf Solar starships in Hyperdrive range. The new bonus values are in PTSd Ship+MultiTool Rebalance.lua, but the overall effect is that for fully optimized, maxed out S-Class ships, the maximum range should now be around:

• ~10,000 ly for Freighters, ~8,000 ly for Explorers,  ~6,400 ly for Living Ships, ~5,100 ly for Exotics, ~4,000 ly for Shuttles, ~3,200 ly for Haulers, ~2,700 ly for Solars, and Fighters unchanged at ~1,900 ly

• This change will take effect for any newly spawned ships. For existing ships you already own, you will either need to upgrade the class (e.g. Class B to Class A) to apply the new values, or if the ship is a freighter or already at S class, you can manually edit the Hyperdrive bonus in a save editor (Assuming S Class from the previous version of PTSd, multiply the current bonus by 2.79x for Living Ship, 2.75x for Shuttles, 2.5x for Exotics, 2.11x for Explorers, 1.9x for Haulers, 1.38x for Freighters, or by 0.92x for Solars)
399.1.5: Increased scanning speed for scanning new fauna/flora/minerals ~3x
421.0.1: Updated for Interceptor! Many, many changes in fact, too many to fill in to the changelog, so instead here is a link to a post with all of the 421.0.1 changes in it (at least the ones I can remember): https://www.nexusmods.com/nomanssky/articles/157
Here are the important ones that may need special attention:

- In-game Difficulty settings means that the majority of the challenge/difficulty aspects of PTSd are now "optional", for the most part. IE setting many difficulty options lower can bring the overall challenge closer to vanilla levels, while still getting the other features of PTSd such as: Rewards shifted towards active play vs. passive play, more meaningful & distinctive choices between weapons/ships/multi-tools, new features such as Multi-Tool Mining/Scanning stats having more effects, and a few bug fixes. ﻿Notably, the game's UI does not accurately list all of the actual in-game effects of many options, so read the included "PTSD Other Difficulty Settings.lua" for details and explanation of exactly that each setting does in PTSd.

- All upgrades modules for all kinds of equipment can now be installed 5x times instead of 3x times, though their strength has been adjusted so that when "maxed out" the equipment should be roughly as powerful as in the previous version of PTSd. This was done so it will take more time / Nanites to find enough good upgrade modules to "max out" your equipment, and to make Tech slots more valuable as you will have more things to install.

- Because Supercharged Slots have huge, but varying improvements to different weapons when their core tech is supercharged, all core weapon techs have had their attributes divided by the same factor that Supercharged Slots will multiply them. Essentially, PTSd is balanced around the assumption that you will always have your core weapon / core mining laser tech supercharged, since it provides such a large boost to them.
- I could not find a way to properly adjust the Exosuit Cargo inventory, so PTSd is balanced around only upgrading it to 40 slots and stopping there.

- The new starship "Agility" bonus stat introduced in the Waypoint update has been corrected so it affects maneuverability at all times, not just while boosting. However, it no longer affects boosting speed (since it only really affects the boosting speed of "fresh" starships, not the final max boosting speed of heavily upgraded starships)

- As always, if using PTSd on an existing save you can use a Save Editor﻿ to adjust the stats / inventory size of existing ships/tools/storage containers to match the new PTSd values. (Starships & multitools will automatically adjust their stats when being upgraded to a higher Class).
421.0.2: Similar to the change to regular Storage Containers, for Freighter Storage Room blueprints only the first is given for free, and the others can be unlocked in the anomaly for 1 Salvaged Data when the corresponding "regular" Storage container is unlocked.

The number of learned alien words needed to advance each stage of the Base Computer Archives mission chain has been increased 5x (vanilla is 3 - 30 words needed for the 10 stages) as words can be learned more quickly in PTSd.
Opening containers at Crashed Freighters once again has a cost: now requires 10 Chromatic Metal to open each container
New recipe to refine 1 Basalt into 2 Silicate Powder, to give more use to Basalt and a mid-game method of getting Silicate Powder in bulk for building.
Solar Panels need 2x as much Glass to build
Biofuel Reactors cost 2x as much Oxygen to build, and only last half as long when full (25 hours instead of 50) while still costing the same amount to refill, thus are half as efficient
Sentinel interceptors are 0.6x as likely to drop Explosive Drones as loot when destroyed
422.0.1: To prevent too easily "sequence breaking" the tech tree by getting a Freighter, the Freighter Refiner Room, Galactic Trade Room, and Cultivation Chamber recipes are no longer known by default but can be unlocked for 1 Salvaged Frigate Module. Their position in the Freighter unlock tree has been adjusted, and they each also have the option to instead be unlocked at the Anomaly for the lower cost of just 1 Salvaged Data after unlocking their corresponding "planetary" equivalent recipe.

Rewards from the first few Space Station missions on a new game are now closer to the standard starting rewards, but with 2~3x boosted chance for Exosuit Upgrade Charts, Navigation Data, Salvaged Data, and Multi-Tool Expansion Slots. (As opposed to in vanilla when essentially the only rewards offered are Exosuit Upgrade Charts with a small chance for Multi-Tool Expansion Slots)
Damage for the Mining Laser, Hijacked Laser, and Animus Beam further reduced so that it should properly be at "base" effective mining rate when on a supercharged slot.
Hungering Tendril / Titan Worm health increased 3x
Rock Creatures now drop multiple Crystal Fragments instead of Meaty Chunks when killed, an extra incentive for doing mining by hand with a laser
Amount of Hypnotic Eyes given from Space Station mission rewards reduced, as they already have greatly increased value from vanilla.
Corrected the price for Exosuit Cargo slots increasing too abruptly when nearing the intended PTSd cap of 40 slots
422.0.2: Further increased the purchase price for Exosuit Upgrade Charts by an additional ~4x, to be more in line with the increased cost to purchase those slots yourself instead.
Corrected the price for Exosuit Cargo slots increasing too abruptly when nearing the intended PTSd cap of 40 slots
Slightly reduced the number of Starship / Multi-tool / Exosuit inventory expansion items awarded for higher-level Space Station Missions, so they are capped at 2x each at most.

Meeting the first of Apollo's contacts at a Space Station no longer immediately teaches you the Roamer Geobay recipe. To learn it you can either progress the Base Computer Archives mission chain far enough, house the Exocraft Technician NPC at your base, or purchase it yourself at the Anomaly if you want it sooner.

Killing planetary creatures now only yields ~0.25x as much "meat" and Mordite, and non-predatory creatures have ~1.5x as much health. Gathering enormous quantities of meat products or Mordite should be a little more difficult, and possibly make the alternative sources/recipes for these items more appealing.
To balance out the reduced amount from killing a creature, Rock Creatures now drop the more valuable Glowing Minerals instead of Crystal Fragments.
Increased refining time for Radiant Shard, Inverted Mirror, Hyaline Brain in line with the vanilla increase (though still reduced according to their reduced Nanite yield)
Added recipes for refining Radiant Shards, Inverted Mirrors, and Hyaline Brains with Microprocessors to yield Salvaged Data, matching the other Nanite-yielding items
423.0.1: Some tweaks to sentinels on Corrupted Planets:
• Corrupted Drones rate of repairing allies slowed 16%~67% depending on which type of sentinel it is repairing (slowed the most when repairing other Corrupted Drones).
• Corrupted Drones and mini-Arachnids need to have lower health before calling for repair, around half health.
• Various attributes of Corrupted Drone weapons slightly buffed, Large Arachnid weapons received larger buffs, especially the grenade launcher.

• Revamped the types & numbers of sentinels spawned for the various Wanted Levels on Corrupt Planets, to make a smoother progression of more / stronger enemies with more healing drones as the wanted levels increase. Culminates in a wave against 3 Large Arachnids, 4-5 Corrupted Drones, and 5-6 Mini-Arachnids simultaneously at the end of Wanted Level 5.

• The slowed repair rate should make Corrupted waves more manageable. In particular for Corrupted Drones, especially if working around how much like in vanilla they only call for repair once their health is around halfway depleted. IE a good strategy is to get them close to half health, then stop attacking and ready yourself for maximum burst damage to finish them off before the repairing can get well underway, by reloading, switching to a burstier weapon with long reload time like the Scatter Blaster, fully charging a Blaze Javelin, etc.

• Beating Wanted Level 5 on Corrupt planets is still intended to be at the peak of planetary battle difficulty, as challenging or more than defeating a Sentinel Walker. It's expected the player would have access to things like a Minotaur under AI-piloting, or a combo of Voltaic Amplifier with sources of Stun by the point they are trying to clear Wanted Level 5 on Corrupt Planets.
Cost to unlock the recipes for Storage Containers 6-9 reduced to ~0.75x-0.5x of previous cost.
Refiner recipe for combining Cyto-Phosphate & Salt into Glass has had its yield ratio improved 5x, as these ingredients are more valuable than the alternatives for making Glass.
Various costs & attributes for the various methods of growing crops have been further adjusted to give most of them a beneficial niche:
• Both kinds of Hydroponics Trays reverted to vanilla behaviour of not being buildable on Freighters
• Large Hydroponics Tray no longer automatically unlocked by the Farmer NPC, must be purchased at the Anomaly instead, but recipe unlock cost is reduced to 0.5x vanilla
• Hydroponics Tray requires less than half the normal ingredients, so it is now the most cost-effective  option in terms of construction cost per-plant. However its power draw was increased +20%

• Large Hydroponics Tray requires slightly more ingredients to build (1.5x Metal Plates), and thus on a per-plant basis costs 50% more to construct than regular Trays. However its power draw has been reduced -20%, and is now the lowest of all planetary options on a per-plant basis. Thus you can grow 50% more plants than the regular Trays with the same amount of power.

• Biodome needs many more ingredients to construct: ~6.4x more Magnetised Ferrite and now also 320 Oxygen (However as it has 16 plots, on a per-plant basis the cost is actually in between regular & Large Trays). Its power draw is unchanged, so on a per-plant basis is nearly double the regular Tray, but in terms of time needed to harvest it remains the clear best of all options.

• Cultivation Chamber & Double Cultivation Chamber had their required Silver & Faecium increased 1.3x & 1.5x, respectively. They remain by far the highest cost to construct on a per-plant basis, but get all their power from the Freighter for free and are conveniently located on your Freighter.
423.0.3: Integrated a modified version of "New Milestones" by Lo2k. This means that in general, most milestones now have substantially higher requirements to achieve each rank, and additionally the total overall number of milestones needed to progress through the stages of the Atlas Path questline are also increased. The final rank for most milestones has significantly higher requirements than the previous rank, although you can still reach Overall Rank "Magellan" to complete the Atlas Path without reaching any of the final ranks for any of the milestones.

Related to this, ~30 more techs/buildables have had either various Atlas Seeds or resources which now require a particular Atlas Seed to obtain added to their requirements for installing / building. These are an assortment of techs & buildables that are especially game-changing or render other options obsolete, which are now effectively "locked" out of obtaining in the first few hours of the game as you will need enough Milestones to unlock the appropriate Atlas Seed recipe. The vast majority of them require one of the first 5 Atlas Seeds, so after getting 40 Milestones you should have access to almost all tech / buildables. Some notable examples of the new changes:

• The specialised hyperdrive techs required to visit Red/Green/Blue stars to obtain their corresponding unique metals are locked behind the 1st, 3rd, and 5th Atlas Seed (8 / 24 / 40 Milestones). Thus, any items requiring Cadmium / Emeril / Indium are likewise locked behind those Milestone requirements.
• All Exocraft Geobays require either Cadmium or Emeril to construct, so you must first visit a Red star system to begin using exocraft
• The Survey Device tech required for finding power / mineral / gas hotspots in order to use the corresponding automated extractors is locked behind Indium
• Many of the more powerful exocraft Radar techs which can locate desirable planetary locations are locked behind Indium, making planetary charts useful for longer

• The various Exocraft techs which fully protect against a specific Hazard are now locked behind Indium, making hazard management & the Minotaur more important for longer. (As in vanilla, Exocraft still naturally slow down Hazard drain by 3x while inside them)

• As in previous versions of PTSd, the Matter Beam tech for the Freighter requires the final Atlas Seed to build (or temporarily setting the Crafting Costs setting to "Free"), as it effectively eliminates the entire inventory management aspect of the game.
Rebalanced some tech unlock costs, mostly making some fuel-recharging or radar techs more expensive
The Scientist NPC teaches the Medium Refiner recipe instead of the Large Refiner recipe, which must now be purchased at the Anomaly
Living Ship S Class Launcher upgrades no longer have auto-charging as a bonus, as there is a dedicated tech for that on Living Ships now

Psychonic Eggs now have just a ~10% chance of yielding the Chloroplast Membrane tech (Launcher auto-charge) and ~50% chance to give the Wormhole Brain / Neural Shielding techs instead of it being virtually guaranteed (though as in vanilla, Psychonic Eggs will never yield a tech you already have in an accessible inventory or installed in your active ship)

Reverted the rest of the various machines which have dedicated Freighter Room versions (Refiners, Nutrient Processors, Storage Containers, Trade Terminals, etc.) to not be buildable on Freighters as in vanilla, to prevent the player from ignoring the Freighter versions and just using the planetary versions instead.

Added Hardframe Engine to possible rewards offered by Space Station / Outlaw Station missions or guild gifts in place of / alongside where Walker Brains can also be offered. This is to give a rare / unpredictable alternative to fighting Sentinel Mechs to get the components for installing / repairing the hardframe upgrades for the Minotaur.
Destroying Salvageable Scrap deposits is 50% as likely to drop a Sentinel Boundary Map.
423.0.2: (Corrected unlock cost for Large Hydroponic Tray to be lower than vanilla)
423.0.4: Adjusted how likely various techs are to come pre-installed on "wild" Starships & Multi-Tools. Mostly to make sure that techs which now require Atlas Seeds can't be found "for free", and to make a few powerful weapons / techs more rare.
423.0.5: Correction: Fixed accidentally putting the Atlas Seed requirement intended for Indium Drive onto Emeril Drive instead.

Corrected the refining time accidentally being too long for using Cyto-Phosphate + Salt to make Glass, and further improved the yield ratio 2x as the ingredients are both more valuable and harder to get in bulk than other Glass recipes.
Atlantideum refines into Pugneum at a 3:2 ratio instead of 1:2, so that actually fighting Sentinels should remain more efficient at gathering Pugneum instead of safely harvesting Living Crystals.
Reduced price to unlock Indium Drive -20% to fit the pattern of the other drives.
423.0.6: Lowered the requirement for installing the Optical Drill tech down to the 2nd Atlas Seed instead of Emeril (which needs the 3rd Atlas Seed)
Reduced unlock cost of Colossus Geobay 0.5x
Swapped position of Save Point and Galactic Trade Terminal in Anomaly unlock tree, and added Save Point to the Construction Research Unit unlock tree to make it easier to learn earlier

Increased the construction costs for Biofuel Reactor, Solar Panel, and Battery by roughly ~1.5x-2x to further widen the gap of how much more resource-efficient Electromagnetic Generators are to build on a per-kP basis than the alternatives, so they are more clearly worthwhile. (EM Generators now being roughly ~3-6x more cost-effective to build compared to a mixture of Solar Panels & Batteries, depending on hotspot Class)
Reduced the strength of B Class Electromagnetic hotspots slightly so they match the pattern of the other hotspot Classes.
423.0.7: Corrected placement of the Freighter Galactic Trade Room in the Anomaly unlock tree to match the recent change to the placement of the Galactic Trade Terminal

Split both the Minotaur Radar Array and High-Power Sonar for the Nautilon into a core tech & separate "upgrade tech", the same as how the vehicular Exocraft Radar techs work. This way the ability to search for valuable locations like Crashed Starships & Freighters can remain locked behind Indium with the "upgrade tech", while the simpler locations and ability to scan for nearby plants & resource nodes is available earlier with the "core tech".

Made Pirates roughly ~0.5x as likely to drop either Suspicious (Tech) or (Arms) Packets, with the chance to drop Suspicious (Goods) Packets roughly doubled to compensate. However, the chance for Tech/Arms vs. Goods improves with harder pirates
Reduced unlock cost of Nautilon Cannon to 0.5x and moved it to the top of the Nautilon section of the unlock tree
Increased unlock cost 5x for Standing Planter (gives Carbon for power)
423.0.8: Corrupted Drones wait until their health is ~10% lower to call for repairs, and repair other Corrupted Drones ~10% more slowly
Lowered amount of Corrupted Drones that spawn at Settlements by ~1 on average

Reduced the cost to upgrade the class of Starships / Multi-Tools to roughly ~0.75x, as there are now many other high Nanite cost items they are competing with. (Multi-Tool upgrade cost is also reduced a further 0.5x, as compared to Starships the cost in units to buy a higher Class outright is much cheaper)
Reduced unlock cost for all Multi-Tool weapon techs to 0.6x, matching the Starship weapon tech prices.

Slight tweaks to other weapon tech unlock prices such as Grenades, Rockets, Voltaic Amplifier, upgrades for Boltcaster / Photon Cannon to keep in line with new prices. Rockets also a little less common to find pre-installed on Starships
423.0.9: Reduced the speed/distance of "Melee-Boosting" to around ~0.66x of vanilla.
However to compensate, Rocket Boots have received several improvements:
• No longer "auto-jump" when landing/touching terrain while holding spacebar

• Increased the speed, height, and duration of the Rocket Boots effect to roughly ~1.3x-1.5x Vanilla levels. The height increase means it should be much less common to unintentionally "land" prematurely and cut your flight short when trying to Rocket Jump on flat terrain.

• The initial "jump" of activating Rocket Boots only depletes the Jetpack Tanks 0.75x as much as vanilla, though they now deplete 1.3x more quickly for a short period while flying after the initial "jump"

• Rocket Boots should now be superior to even the vanilla Melee-Boost for general movement (at the cost of depleting your Jetpack Tanks more quickly and taking up a Tech slot) but still slower overall than Exocraft or a very fast pet (if using the Companion Riding Improvements mod), especially over longer distances.
However, all these changes to Melee-Boosting & Rocket Boots are contained within "PTSd Rocket Boots Changes.lua" if you wish to easily remove them
Reduced cost to unlock Rocket Boots to 0.8x & Airburst Engine to 0.7x
Increased cost to unlock Trade Rocket by ~1.5x

Reverted the initial base building radius when you first place a Base Computer from 50u back up to 300u, to reduce the hassle of a vanilla bug that sometimes requires you to save & reload your game to restore full functionality to storage containers and certain other base parts that are built outside the initial base building radius.

Swapped one of the possible Gek Settlement products from Stellar Custard to Pastry. It is worth slightly less if sold raw, but has a useful Life Support restoring effect and more importantly has far more possible recipes available to cook using it, increasing the chances it will be useful & profitable with the ingredients the player has on-hand. (May need a Save Editor to adjust an existing Settlement with Stellar Custard)
Increased the required amounts of certain common ingredients used as "additives"/"seasoning" in some Nutrient Processor recipes from 1 to 5:
• Salt for Crunchy Caramel, Salty Custard, Salty Juice
• Condensed Carbon for Smoked Meat (uses 2 instead of 5)
• Frost Crystal for various kinds of "Ice Creams"

Replaced some of the less useful "junk" rewards from dismantling plant consumables found in Subterranean Organic Structures such as "Residual Goop" or "Viscous Fluids" with more useful items such as Marrow Bulbs, Sweetroots, or Pulpy Roots. Also increased the amount rewarded for some other items such as Runaway Mould, Carbon, etc. to make these consumables overall more worthwhile & desirable.

Replaced the Cadmium/Emeril/Indium rewards from dismantling broken tech consumables found in Buried Caches with their Activated versions to prevent "sequence breaking" before getting the appropriate hyperdrive techs
Swapped position of Appearance Modifier Room and Galactic Trade Room in Freighter unlock tree.
423.0.10: Reverted chance for Settlement Expedition failure back to vanilla 30% chance. However, Settlement Expeditions now award +1 population on success in addition to the normal reward, and lose only 1 population instead of 2 on failure, so on average you will likely gain population from authorizing these expeditions.

Reverted the "trade-in" value for trading in a freighter for a different freighter back to the vanilla 70% of original value instead of 10% of original value, so that the player isn't overly punished for starting with cheap freighters and upgrading multiple times to progressively better ones.
Reduced cost for Sodium / Sodium Nitrate to recharge starship shields to 0.75x
Increased cost for Uranium to recharge starship Launcher by 1.5x
Increased costs for the Freighter Biological Room to match the other Freighter "expansion" rooms, with added Condensed Carbon cost as it can produce Carbon.
Increased the Silver Cost for the Freighter Nutrition Room back up to the default of 60
Reduced likelihood of Outlaw Station missions rewarding Sentinel Boundary Maps 0.5x
Increased yield of Chlorine from "Organic" Rocks to 2x
Reduced yield of Mordite from "Organic" Rocks to 0.4x
Reduced the Gold & Uranium yield from Metal "Fingers" to 0.6x & 0.4x, and also changed the ratio of Gold to Uranium fingers from 1:1 to 2:1

• In practice this means each cluster of fingers should yield around ~80% the amount of Gold in total, and around ~25% the amount of Uranium in total. However keep in mind PTSd allows mining yields to get much higher than Vanilla with the inbuilt Mining stat bonuses for Multi-Tools.
Corrected certain freighter room recipes which may not have started out unknown as intended.
423.0.11: Reduced the chance of Tech Damage to installed Starship tech from enemy starships / freighters a further 0.5x, due to the high enemy fire rate in PTSd
Increased health of the underwater "Eyeball" enemy creature 6x and "Anglerfish" enemy creature 1.5x. Also increased initial speed boost of "Anglerfish" 1.2x
Increased the initial damage from when Anglerfish spawn by 5x, and increased the number of additional jellyfish spawned by ~2x

Reduced the amount of items rewarded from harvesting Alluring Specimens 0.5x, to compensate for how Alluring Specimens in PTSd are no longer destroyed on "bad outcome". (This is a side effect of how PTSd prevents starship weapons from mining planetary objects by making planetary objects immune to explosions)
Reduced the bonus Multi-Tool mining yield during Radiation Storms from 2.55x to 1.9x of normal substance yield.

Broken slots on Sentinel Multi-tools have their requirement of 3 Recycled Circuitry split into 3 separate "components", so using Repair Kits instead of the "intended" resources to fix it will require significantly more Repair Kits to do so. (Note you will have to enter the full zoomed-in "repairing" UI to see the full list of required components, as the Inventory UI overview only displays the first 3 required components)
Reworded in-game descriptions of the new Radar upgrades for the Minotaur and Nautilon to make it more clear they are upgrades to the core Radar techs and not standalone techs.
