Corrected the filename of one of the .paks being incorrect / too long
423.0.12: Increased Scatter Blaster base damage ~1.45x, increased damage bonus from upgrade modules 6x, decreased Critical Hit bonus damage from +50% to +30%. Overall buff since it needs even more extra strength to make up for the very short effective range, poor accuracy, and difficulty hitting critical spots compared to other weapons in PTSd.
Decreased Boltcaster base damage 0.9x, but increased Critical Hit bonus damage from +50% to +80% to reward accuracy more
Decreased Heat Time bonus from Infra-Knife Accelerator upgrade modules 0.5x

As Emergency Signal Scanners (for finding Derelict Freighters) are no longer given weekly for free, added a rare chance for higher-level Space Station missions to offer one as a reward, and a slightly better chance for Outlaw Station missions.

Added guaranteed Units & Nanites rewards to the Exocraft Technician NPC's repeatable daily mission, in addition to the usual random upgrade module/product reward, to make it more worthwhile. On average awards around ~350 Nanites and ~300,000 Units (around half the average Units value of the Farmer/Overseer daily mission rewards).

Multiplied the yield of the biome-specific crops by ~1.11x for both the wild and cultivated versions. This brings the cultivated versions' yield back to the vanilla amount for better QoL of matching vanilla planting/recipe ratios, and no "leftovers" when directly crafting into farming products immediately after harvesting.
Further increased the Chlorine yield from Organic Rocks an additional 2x
Set Standing Planters to no longer be buildable on Freighters, as they get free power there and Freighters already have dedicated rooms for growing Carbon and adding greenery.
Added Tainted Metal as another option to refine with Microprocessors to get Salvaged Data
Rewrote the in-game subtitle/descriptions when performing PTSd-added Refiner/Nutrient Processor recipes to be similar to vanilla recipe descriptions instead of just a placeholder ID
423.0.13: Corrected an issue with Supply Depot & Mineral / Gas Extractor network storage rounding down the total network storage to the next lowest multiple of 1250, and only delivering extracted substances infrequently in packets of 1250 at a time. Now delivers substances in frequent packets of 125 at a time.

• Improved a related issue which was causing Extractors to round their extraction rate to the nearest multiple of 12.5 units/hr. Now Extractors round their extraction rate to the nearest multiple of 6.25 units/hr (So still requires a little less precision / finickiness to place Extractors for optimal yield compared to vanilla)
• To clarify, overall total extraction rates / storage amounts are unchanged.

Made the Exocraft Technician's repeatable daily mission always give B Class or higher upgrades when awarding upgrade modules, doubled chances for A or S Class upgrades, and also added Minotaur upgrade modules to the possible rewards. Also slightly increased the Units reward by ~50,000 on average
423.0.14: Increased the sale value of all "geode" style items (Geode<Ferrite>, Geode<Cobalt>, Gold Nugget, Glowing Mineral) by ~2.6x-10.2x so that they each sell for +33% more than opening them and selling their contents (on average).  Tritium Hypercluster & Crystal Fragment were similarly increased to sell for +200% more than selling their contents, as their contents are generally cheaper & harder to get by other means. Now there is a choice of whether you want to break them down for their substances to use for fuel / crafting more valuable items to sell, or to sell them as-is for decent money.

Settlements now complete a production cycle of items every 6 hours instead of 20 hours, though the amount produced per cycle is 0.3x as much so the daily output is the same as before. (Settlement Products also got a 1.2x boost to account for how you may now lose some products due to rounding down). However, this means whenever making a Settlement decision that adds any Debt (which causes the production cycle to reset to 0 once the debt is repaid), you can only lose at most 6 hours' worth of production instead of 20 hours' worth of production. I.E. Visiting your settlement and making decisions more than once a day no longer prevents your settlement from ever producing items; you should most likely be able to collect at least some items every day as long as Productivity > Maintenance costs, and it's more feasible to delay making a Debt-increasing settlement decision until the current production cycle finishes first.

Corrected the UI display time for Settlement production rate, & certain crop "approximate growth times" when viewing the crop in the construction menu, to match the new PTSd times, with some minor corrections to vanilla mistakes as well.
Moved the recipe for Geodesite from under Grantine to under Herox in the unlock tree, since Grantine is not an ingredient for Geodesite but Herox is.

Removed the innate Launcher Auto-charge bonus from Solar Ships, replaced it with a -34% Launch discount (the same as Shuttles). Also rewrote the in-game description for the Vesper Sail to more accurately describe its bonuses in PTSd.

Removed the additional +20% markup on Scanner upgrade Modules (S & X Class upgrades having a chance to come with less than 4 bonuses means there already is a higher cost to "max out" these modules compared to others.)
Decreased unlock cost of Precision Minotaur Laser, Minotaur Cannon, Minotaur Bore ~0.7x, increased unlock cost of Minotaur AI Pilot ~1.1x
Decreased the Nanite cost to "purchase" additional Living Ships after completing the Starbirth mission 0.8x
Increased average waiting time for stages of the Starbirth mission from 4 hours to 8 hours (vanilla is 22 hours)

To prevent heavy "sequence breaking" of the various things locked behind Cadmium/Emeril/Indium, or acquiring an S Class starship too early on, crafting the Consciousness Bridge at the start of the Starbirth mission now requires Emeril. This still allows some leeway in making use of the Living Ship's hyperdrive tech as a "shortcut" from Emeril to Indium, depending on how soon you complete the Starbirth Mission compared to gaining more Milestones.

Reduced the amount of Chromatic Metal required for several vanilla refiner recipes which normally require a staggering 250 Chromatic Metal to 10 or 15, so those recipes are actually worth considering now. (Recipes for making Platinum & Hyperfuel). Also reduced the cost ~0.36x for the refiner recipe for making Ion Batteries so it is actually cheaper than crafting by hand.
Higher level Space Station missions are less likely to offer Exosuit Upgrade Charts / Expansions, as the player has likely reached PTSd's lower Exosuit inventory slot cap by then.
423.0.15: Further increased the stack size of Radiant Shards 1.5x, to make it easier to hold many of them in your Interceptor for the frequent shield-recharging you often do in PTSd

Sentinel Interceptors can now use Starshield Batteries to recharge shields in addition to either Radiant Shards or Sodium Nitrate, but can no longer use Sodium. (Since many starships often drop Starshield Batteries when destroyed, Interceptors can now also make use of them in combat)

Decreased the "tank size" 0.4x for the Sentinel Interceptor's Hyperdrive & Pulse Engine techs. Since Radiant Shards refill those tanks to full when used, in practice this means that Radiant Shards give only 0.4x as much "fuel" for warping / pulse jumping. E.G. In Vanilla with no hyperdrive upgrades, a Radiant Shard gives enough fuel for 5 warps, but now in PTSd it gives enough fuel for 2 warps. (As a minor side effect, Warp Hypercores also give 0.4x as much fuel for Interceptors)
Enemy Sentinel Interceptors now have 0.8x Hull Health, and their shield delay before recharging is 1.33x longer, and they take 1.33x as long to fully recharge.
The delay between waves of increasing Wanted Levels in space during which you can again use your Pulse Jump / Hyperdrive increased from 3 sec to 12 sec
423.0.16: Further doubled the stacksize for Refiner (and Nutrient Processor) input & output slots so they are now 2x the exosuit's stacksize at all difficulty settings (vanilla is often 0.5x the exosuit's stacksize). I.E. You can now place 2 stacks of items from your Exosuit inventory into a Refiner / Nutrient Processor at a time (You can press "X" while hovering over an input slot that already has items in it to keep adding items). This should improve the QoL for bulk refining by requiring fewer interactions / refills of the refiner (though it doesn't affect the time required or the actual yields per recipe)
436.0.1: Fixed vanilla issue of Neutron Cannon Class X upgrade modules always having worse damage & charge time bonuses than a good S Class upgrade
Slightly increased the rate at which Corrupted Drones can repair Large Spider quads or other Corrupted drones, as they can now be interrupted by damaging them.
Reduced  the Corrupted Drone repair cooldown on receiving damage from 5 seconds to 3 seconds
Lowered Sentinel Interceptor salvage / trade-in value even further by ~50%
443.0.1: A few individual .lua files got renamed as some re-organizing was done
Added option at the top of PTSd Rewards Remixer.lua to make all starships & multitools rewarded from Expeditions & Twitch streams come as C Class with small inventories (set to false by default)
Corrected the ratio for refining Cadmium into Chromatic Metal that got oddly nerfed in NMS v4.4

Increased the hull & shields for newly destructible Freighters, and the number of Pirate Frigates in line with other PTSd buffs (roughly ~2x more Hull & Shields, up to ~1.5x more Pirate Frigate spawns)
Cost for Pirate Frigates lowered to be just 150% "regular" frigates instead of 250%, since they don't appear to be functionally any different from regular Combat Frigates for the player.
Units / Nanites rewards for saving Civilian Freighters from the new Pirate Freighters are increased 2x
Number of Cargo Bulkheads rewarded from destroying Pirate Freighters increased by 1.5x on average
Reduced Sentinel ship selling value to 0.75x previous value, as the vanilla price has also been lowered
Fixed Animus Beam accidentally getting the same damage buff I gave the Hijacked Laser
Increased damage bonus of Alien Multi-Tools by ~1.06x and Sentinel Multi-tools by ~1.14x
Atlantid Multi-tool changes:
• At S Class the bonus for Damage is 1x, Mining is 1.2x, and Scanning is 1.3x vanilla (with possibly different multipliers at lower Classes for a smooth progression)
• Now set up as a kind of "advanced Pistol Alternative": Has notably better Damage and Scanning than the Pistol, but a lower Mining stat (and lower resources per second)

• However, the unique "Runic Lens" laser has been changed to now give 1.25x as much resources and deal 0.7x as much damage as a normal Mining Laser. This means that it will yield more resources per object than the Pistol, but due to the reduced laser damage it will yield fewer resources per second than the Pistol (or the Sentinel Multi-tool using the Hijacked Laser). As opposed to the Hijacked Laser, the Runic Lens will shine in situations where you are mining rarer objects you do not often come across (such as Metal Fingers, Mutant Plants, etc.) to maximise the resources obtained. And unlike the Hijacked Laser, it has the default fuel consumption / recharge rate and a more forgiving heatup time than the regular Mining Laser.
Voltaic Staff changes:
• At S Class the bonus for Damage is 0.7x, Mining is 2.2x, and Scanning is 1.5x vanilla (with possibly different multipliers at lower Classes for a smooth progression)

• Instead of being identical to Sentinel Multi-tools, now set up as a kind of "alternative jack of all trades" similar to Royal Multi-tools: Has slightly better damage than Royals, but lower Mining and Scanning. The damage is still below Sentinel & Alien Multi-tools, the Scanning is still below Royals & Experimentals, and the Mining is below Pistols, Royals, and Atlantids
Neutron Cannon base dispersion (inaccuracy) increased 1.4x (should make it slightly easier to hit multiple enemies at once)
Applied the increase to max damage bonus for X Class Neutron Cannon upgrade modules that was intended in the previous PTSd version (but accidentally left out)
Unlock cost for Personal Refiner reduced to 0.8x previous cost, Personal Refiner Mk2 reduced to 0.4x vanilla cost and now requires Emeril to install instead of Ionised Cobalt
Polyphonic Core now requires Cadmium to install instead of Quantum Computer

Instead of having both Sentinel Exosuit upgrade modules and the new Autophage Exosuit upgrade modules offer the same possible stat bonuses, they have been differentiated: Now only Sentinel Exosuit upgrades offer Shield & Health bonuses, and only Autophage Exosuit upgrades offer Jetpack & Stamina bonuses. (This feature can be toggled off at the top of "!PTSd Procedural Upgrade Adjustment.lua") Thus they now lean into separate roles for combat or exploration. The Life Support tank size & regen rate bonuses for both have been reduced to 0.75x effectiveness, as you can "double up" on those now

Adjusted starship weapon damage effectiveness against Torpedo & Freighter Hulls to match their effectiveness against starship Hulls (with an exception of a 0.7x reduction for Positron Ejector vs. Freighter Hulls, since Freighters are a much larger target and thus easier to land shots against)
444.0.1: Multiplied the Boosting Speed of all enemy Starships by the same amount as diverting power to Engines does for the player. This should keep it as difficult as it used to be to outrun pirates, so long as you are diverting power to Engines when trying to escape.

Tweaked the maluses you get to other ship systems when diverting power away from them to be roughly ~2/3rds as much as you would gain when diverting power to them. Most significantly, weapons take a smaller malus when diverting power away from them (now 0.9x instead of 0.7x). (Note that there seems to be a vanilla bug where the Shield malus is never applied for some reason)
444.0.2: Removed increases to Freighter shield health, since damage from the player (or other starships) seems to be insignificant to them
Increased cost of Rebuilt Exosuit Modules by 2.5x (bought with Void Motes)
Decreased value of Royal Multi-Tools to ~0.33x since you no longer pay for them, to reduce how profitable it is to salvage them
Increased the bonuses at higher Classes (B, A, S) to trade-in / salvage value for Sentinel Interceptor starships

Lowered the maximum possible price for Atlantid Multi-Tools to 0.8x, and narrowed the possible range of prices. Now should cost 2-4k Nanites for a C Class, and 8-16k Nanites for an S Class depending on size (still much cheaper than upgrading one to S Class yourself)

Greatly increased the crafting requirements for the craftable Voltaic Staff components. Now each of the 3 parts requires at least ~1.5 million units worth of Recycled Circuitry (purchasable from most trade terminals in PTSd), as well as higher numbers of Radiant Shards, etc. This should incentivize instead collecting Void Motes to buy the purchasable Staff components, and makes it less feasible to craft your own Staff just to salvage it for a profit.
445.0.1: Slightly raised the Gold & Silver requirement for constructing the freighter Refiner Room back to vanilla levels, and increased the recipe cost 2x (Can purchase with Salvaged Frigate Modules, or with the less valuable Salvaged Data at the Anomaly after unlocking the Large Refiner). This should help further incentivize unlocking the Large Refiner first.
Corrected a formatting error in the previous version for adding custom ship shields, etc.
Applied changes to Sentinel Freighters to mirror recent vanilla changes (less health, more shields)
445.0.2: When giving Travelers 15 nanites, instead of rewarding a large amount of units (~200k on average), they now reward ~30 Di-Hydrogen & Tritium.

Added optional multipliers in "PTSd Rewards Remixer.lua" for users to adjust the % chance of finding various quality levels of upgrade modules in Damaged Machinery (search for "Damaged Machinery" to find section).

For users re-paking individual .lua files themselves, for better organization the resulting .pak filename produced from individual .lua files should now match the .lua filename (sometimes with additional version numbering, etc.)

Tidied up of some .lua files to remove 89 benign "Notices" when running through AMUMSS. Running all PTSd .luas through AMUMSS at once now should only report a total of 20 Warnings & 20 Notices (which can be safely ignored)
445.0.3: Reduced the purchase cost of most Frigates to ~0.33x previous values (the unique 200,000,000 unit frigates instead reduced to 0.5x cost), though still generally above vanilla costs. With PTSd's decreases to frigate expedition rewards, it was taking too long for the "Return On Investment" for buying a frigate. Now buying a frigate should roughly take in the ballpark of ~10 expeditions to "pay for itself", on average.
445.0.4: To make sure you never lose value when cooking Hypnotic Eyes, increased the value of Abyssal Stew, Iced Screams, and Horrifying Mush by ~2x. Also increased the value of Syrupy Viscera by ~1.05x to widen the gap in profit with the alternative Hypnotic Eye recipes.
Readjusted the values & growth mechanics of the "trade goods" crops: Albumen Pearls, Gravitino Balls, Sac Venom, & Nipnip Buds due to several issues:
• Nipnip Buds accidentally had +50% intended value due to an error on my part

• When comparing the profitability of these crops against the "crafting" farm crops, I had failed to account for the value of non-farmed components of the "farm goods", e.g. Geodesite, Superconductor, etc.

• A vanilla issue with % chance based crop spawning sets the "seed" for what will be harvested once at time of construction, and never "re-rolls", so a planted crop would either always yield a crop or always yield nanites.
To address these issues, the following changes have been made:
• Nipnip buds value decreased to ~0.55x, and Albumen Pearl value to ~0.9x
• On top of the above change, the value for Albumen Pearls, Gravitino Balls, and Sac Venom have all been reduced a further 0.5x.
• The yield of Albumen Pearls, Gravitino Balls, and Sac Venom have been effectively been doubled. Wild version yield 2x items on harvest, and farmed versions drop the item at 100% rate.
• The nanite yields for the farmed version of these same crops likewise now drop at 100% rate, but at halved amount each time.
• Both the stack size and required ingredient amount for any recipes using these items have been doubled

• Altogether these changes should result in effectively the same yields/outputs as before (aside from the reduction for Albumen Pearls & Nipnip Buds), just without any % chance RNG for the farmed versions anymore
Removed 2 more benign "Notices" when re-pakking certain .lua files with AMUMSS
• Growth time for Sac Venom increased from 12 hours to 16 hours, to ensure it should only get harvested once per day with normal playstyles (with some wiggle room to allow for changing play schedule)
446.0.1: Reverted several Freighter rooms back to not being buildable on planets, such as Stellar Extractor, Refiner Room, some NPC Specialist rooms, etc.

Added an optional toggle (FreighterRoomsPlanetside) in "gBase Items BasicX.lua" to disallow any Freighter rooms or buildables (stairs, hallways, etc.) from showing up in the build menu on planets, as in vanilla
446.0.2: Fixed an error I made when compiling the mod, which led to certain NPC/upgrade terminal dialog options being unavailable, among other possible issues
446.0.3: Updated formatting of change to nanite cost for Traveler grave location
451.0.1: Doubled the number of Gravitino Balls required to construct the Gravitino Host and Stellar Extractor, to compensate for how PTSd 445.0.4 doubled the yield of wild & farmed Gravitino Balls.
Lowered unit reward for making a Pirate Dreadnought surrender to 0.8x
As the new procedural planetary missions mainly use the same reward pool as the space station missions, their rewards are likewise improved in PTSd
Cost to buy "Artifact Charts" increased from 3 to 4 Navigation Data
Increased the amounts of Salt / Carbon / Condensed Carbon / Frost Crystal required for the new Biscuit recipes, in line with all other recipes in PTSd
Sentinel Multitool Scanning multiplier at S class is unchanged from the previous version of PTSd, although in vanilla it was increased slightly
452.0.2: Made the OMEGA expedition reward ship, the Starborn Runner, also come at C Class with fewer inventory slots by default, like the Golden Vector and Utopia Speeder (can be reverted to vanilla Class & size in "PTSd Rewards Remixer.lua")
Increased cost to buy Artifact Charts to 5 Nav Data, and corrected an error that had them at vanilla cost
Chance to receive Exosuit Upgrade Chart instead of Navigation Data from Ancient Data Structures lowered from ~9% to ~5% (editable in "PTSd Rewards Remixer.lua")

I still am not doing a thorough balancing on cooked foods, and while in general most of the new "Biscuit" recipes are still more profitable / efficient than older recipes, a few new Biscuit recipes were incredibly profitable even compared to the others, so I've toned down the outliers such as Cream Fingers & Fish Biscuits. I also raised up a few underperformers, for example increased the value of Biscuits made with Flesh Rope or NipNip Buds so they remain profitable with PTSd values. Full changes in "PTSd Resource + Product + Construction Rebalance.lua"

Similarly, adjusted the ingredients used in some alternative recipes for the Wriggling tack / Haunted Wafer Biscuits to ensure they stay profitable with PTSd ingredient values, such as removing Hypnotic Eyes as a possible ingredient
452.0.3: Lowered the stat bonuses for Exotic starships at lower Classes (C, B, & A) so they smoothly progress from C to S Class (S Class stats left unchanged). This change only matters when redeeming the Starborn Runner ship at C Class.
452.0.4: Added the unique "Atlas Sceptre" staff to the list of expedition rewards that come as C Class with fewer slots by default

Reduced the Cargo & Tech Slot upgrade limit for Exotic starships at lower Classes to match the pattern of other starships (upgrade limits at S Class unchanged, only relevant when redeeming the Starborn Runner at C Class)
Increased the Cargo Slot upgrade limit for Fighter starships by +5 at lower Classes to match the pattern of other starships of the same size (upgrade limit at S Class unchanged)

Reduced starting Cargo Slots for the Radiant Pillar from 12 to 8 to more closely match "wild" small Fighters (Makes buying other low-inventory starships more appealing, makes it less valuable when trading in / salvaging, also encourages upgrading ship storage, buying an exocraft, or more storage containers from the anomaly early on for more storage)

Pre-damaged slots on crashed starships or broken non-Sentinel Multi-Tools (most Multi-Tools including Royals from Sentinel Pillars, but NOT Sentinel Mult-Tools from Abandoned Camps) now have a 50% chance to also cost some Cadmium/Emeril/Indium to repair in addition to their normal costs (~16%/~16%/~16% chance for each metal). They also have a ~67% chance (for starships) / ~42% chance (for Multi-Tools) to cost an additional 1-2 Wiring Looms. This should make it a bit more difficult & costly to fully repair something right when you get it, and further increase the value of Repair Kits, which can be still used instead of the Indium, etc. (Can be changed in "PTSd Tech + Upgrade + Recipe + Blueprint cost Rebalance.lua" with the various SLOT_DMG entries)
452.0.5: Reworked how the extra stellar metals & Wiring Looms were added to requirements for fixing damaged slots in crashed starships / broken Multi-Tools, to account for how the game places damaged slots. Now in practice damaged slots in either crashed starships or broken Multi-Tools should have a roughly ~25% chance to require no special metals, and a ~25%/~25%/~25% chance to require Cadmium/Emeril/Indium. However due to how damaged slots are placed, the actual chances depend on the inventory size of the starship/Multi-Tool, with larger inventories having progressively "worse" chances than smaller inventories. E.G. A damaged slot on a ~15 slot Multi-Tool has a ~27% chance to require no extra stellar metals, and a ~20% chance to require Indium, while a damaged slot on a ~20 slot Multi-Tool has a ~15% chance to require no extra stellar metals and a ~40% chance to require Indium.

Adding a higher "units cost" to repairing these same starships / Multi-Tools through Wiring Looms has been similarly reworked. In addition to requiring 1 or 2 extra Wiring Looms on many slots, a few damaged slots might require 2-3 Recycled Circuitry (purchasable in many shops in PTSd), like all damaged slots in Sentinel Multitools already do in PTSd. This is more likely for larger inventory sizes, so the end result is that for example in total smaller broken multi-tools (~15 slots) or starships (~25 slots) could require an additional ~1.5 million units worth of components to fully repair, while larger multi-tools (~20 slots) or starships (~40 slots) may require an additional ~5.5 million units worth of components compared to vanilla. Thus while it should still be significantly cheaper to repair a crashed ship / broken Multi-Tool compared to buying a fresh one, it will generally be significantly harder & more costly to fully(or mostly) repair a large starship/Multi-Tool compared to a smaller (and thus less valuable) one.
Number of Recycled Circuitry required for repairing broken slots in Sentinel Multi-Tools reduced from 3 to 2 per broken slot.
Various changes to Multi-Tool balance based on new "live-fire" testing:

• Boltcaster - Deals 1.35x damage, reload time increased 1.44x. Sentinel Upgrade modules no longer grant any bonuses to Fire Rate, but now their bonuses to damage are increased ~30x. (Now using 5 Sentinel Upgrades should increase DPS around ~1.4x instead of ~2x, although the base Boltcaster is stronger to compensate)
• Pulse Spitter - Deals 1.23x as much damage, reload time increased 1.2x, Impact Igniter Burn DOT damage increased 3x and DOT duration increased from 3.5 to 5 seconds
• Scatter Blaster - Deals 1.25x as much damage, recoil reduced to 0.75x

• Neutron Cannon - Base damage reduced to 0.53x, but the damage of uncharged shots increased ~2.8x. The way charging time interacts with supercharged slots has been "fixed", so unlike the Blaze Javelin supercharging the core tech will now decrease charge time. This means that it is now always optimal to supercharge the core tech of Neutron Cannon for both rapid & charged shots, and so most stats for the Neutron Cannon now start "un-supercharged" like other weapons in PTSd, so various attributes start ~0.85x as strong as before. Overall, a Neutron Cannon optimized for charged shots now only has ~0.69x as much time needed to charge as before.
• Blaze Javelin - Deals ~0.86x as much damage, time to charge a full shot reduced from 4 to 3 seconds
• Geology Cannon - Deals 1.1x as much damage, and ammo reduced from 12 to 10 shots,
• Hijacked Laser - Deals 1.25x damage vs. Sentinels & creatures (mining rate unchanged)

Some broad rebalancing on the units value of many cooked foods based on their "type"/"main ingredient". Very roughly brings many other foods types closer to the balance point of Doughnut type foods, in terms of units value for ingredients used:
• Sugar Dough foods (Biscuits) value are now 0.55x
• Pie Case foods (Pies) value are now 0.8x
• Wailing Batter (Larval Core) foods are now 0.9x
• Writhing, Roiling Batter (Larval Core) foods are now 0.92x
• Doughnut foods value are now 1.15x
• Proto Batter foods value are now 1.15x
• Thick, Sweet Batter foods value are now 1.4x
• Cake Batter foods value are now 1.25x
• Extra Fluffy Batter foods value are now 2.1x
Some foods in these groups were individually adjusted if the above changes made them especially over/under valued

This rebalancing takes into consideration that Milk & Eggs are inherently more valuable than Flour & Sugar, as they cannot be bulk-refined from farmable crops. Also makes it more consistent that Sticky Honey adds significant value to foods. Cooked food value balance is still pretty loose overall, but many of the major "trees" of recipes are a bit closer together now.
Herbal Crunchie requires 1 more Processed Sugar to cook, and no longer can be made with Geknip instead of NipNip Buds, as that would lose money in PTSd

Baked Eggs, Delicate Meringue, & Soft Custard Fancy can no longer be made with Larval Cores, as this loses money even in vanilla. Similarly, the alternative recipes for Cake of the Lost or Abyssal Stew that use 2 Larval Cores / Hypnotic Eyes instead of 1 have been removed.

Crystal Sulphide is worth 0.5x as many units, and refines into ~0.47x as much Sodium Nitrate, to account for how Thermal Vents were made to yield double Crystal Sulphide in PTSd. (Alluring Specimens now yield 2x Crystal Sulphide to maintain the same amount of total value)
Organic Rocks yield ~0.67x as much Mordite
Wonder Projector blueprint costs 0.5x as much Salvaged Data to unlock
Fighter starship Agility bonus increased from +40% to +50% at S Class (and increased similarly at lower Classes)
Royal Multi-Tools no longer have "boosted" stat bonuses at C & B Class, as they can be found at all Classes just like other Multi-Tools due to a vanilla update I had missed last year.
• Ice Cream foods value are now 1.23x
462.0.1: Starship Reactor Cores can no longer be found as rewards from destroying Pirate Freighters, completing Derelict Freighters, or Space Station / Outlaw Station Missions (Can still be found on Nexus Missions). Pirate Freighters instead continue to have a chance to drop 3-6 Cargo Bulkheads.

Starship Reactor Core purchase price increased 4x~5x (~13.3x for C Class). This works out such that building a C-Class starship costs 4,000 Nanites, and building a higher Class starship costs the equivalent of the base 4,000 plus  what you would pay in PTSd to upgrade a C Class starship up to that Class. E.G. an S Class Reactor Core costs 4,000 + 8,000 + 16,000 + 32,000 = 60,000 Nanites. However unlike upgrading the class of a normal starship, you can get up to a -20% discount on the nanite price of Reactor Cores from your Standing with the local race. Reactor Core selling price reduced to ~0.25x

Maximum discount at space station tech shops from high Standing with local race is now -20% instead of -50%. Base price for all upgrade modules at space stations increased 1.125x to partially offset the ability to get discounts
When trading Trade Products, the maximum price you can sell for is reduced from 1.2x to 1.15x base price. However, this is increased to 1.3x base price during a Trade Surge
Increased unit price for intervening in frigate expedition Trade activities by 2x

Neutron Cannon now effectively consumes 2x as much fuel per shot, and deals ~0.7x as much damage. The AOE effect is still quite strong vs. grouped enemies such as groups of Sentinel Drones that have just spawned or are huddling behind a shield barrier, Repair / Corrupted Drones & their patients, or mini-fiends on Derelict Freighters, and the AOE even on uncharged shots tends to trigger critical hits on weakpoints easily such as on Sentinel Quads. This should make it still very useful vs. groups, when you can't easily get line-of-sight, or on normally hard to hit weakpoints, but less strong otherwise.

Discovered that the in-game "Natural Resources" difficulty setting applies to many substance rewards, not just mined objects and wild plants. Made adjustments including a new .lua multiplier specifically just for mined objects at the top of "PTSd Rewards Remixer.lua", with the overall result being now mined objects yield ~0.94x substances, while most other affected sources of substances yield ~1.33x compared to the previous version. Certain things are adjusted individually, such as Resource Depots or opening buried plants instead being increased ~1.66x. Notably, none of these changes apply to sources of substances unaffected by the "Natural Resources" difficulty setting, including the output slot of machines/drills, Settlement output, or the buildable version of farmable plants.
Starship Launch Fuel now costs 1.5x Di-Hydrogen and 2x Metal Plating to craft, and comes in ~0.5x the amount from Space Station Mission rewards
Unlocking the Cadmium/Emeril/Indium hyperdrive tech recipes costs ~1.5x as many nanites

The "free fuel recharging" techs for starships / exocraft now require completing 8 more Milestones in order to install. Icarus Fuel System requires the 6th Atlas Seed instead of just Indium, and Launch Auto-Charger now requires the 7th Atlas Seed instead of the 6th. Living Ships can still gain Chloroplast Membrane tech at any point from Psychonic Eggs.
Similarly, the advanced versions of the radars for the Minotaur & Nautilon (which can detect crashed starships) now require the 6th Atlas Seed instead of just Indium
Distress Beacons at starship crashsites now yield 1 upgrade module of random Class (More likely to be C/B Class) instead of teaching 1-2 unknown tech blueprint in cases where they would before
Most damaged slots on crashed starships or broken Multi-Tools which required Wiring Loom to repair, now require +1 Wiring Loom.
Increased Shield bonus on Explorer starships by 1.23x
Increased Damage bonus on Living Ships by ~1.07x
Increased Damage & Shield bonus on Hauler starships by 1.2x

Units option to "Bargain for Relic" with space traders reduced from 850k to 400k units in most cases (will instead be equal to 1% of the total value of your cargo, if that is higher). This should now make paying units for the relic turn a profit on average instead of overwhelmingly losing money (now should be 40% chance to lose 200-300k, 40% chance to make 0-300k, and 20% chance to make 400k - 1.6 million units), although in PTSd you can always turn a profit if you are able to trade the relic in at a Colossal Archive.

The chance of Resource Depots yielding valuable products such as Enriched Carbon or Aronium increased from 60% to 80%, chance to yield metal substances such as Gold reduced from 20% to ~13%, and chance to yield gas substances such as Radon decreased from 20% to ~7%. Amounts for substances like Gold or Radon also increased ~2.3x to be more substantial
Nanite cost to buy a random chart/map, or to trade for a small gift to Travelers increased from 15 to 20 nanites. Reward gift of Di-Hydrogen & Tritium from Travelers increased 1.33x in return

Amounts of claimable supplies in the airlock entrance room of Derelict Freighters reduced roughly by half Notably, this includes the 3 Repair Kits normally claimable in the crate now being 1-2 (~1.5 on average)
Balanced the rest of the refiner recipes for making Sodium / Sodium Nitrate to match the speed & efficiency of other similar recipes in PTSd

Some cooked food value tweaks: Starbirth Delight value increased ~1.12x, Interstellar & Prickly Curiosity value decreased to 0.9x, Cake Batter foods value increased ~1.02x, Jammy Rounds increased 1.4x, Honey Waffle increased 1.6x
463.0.1: When extracting customisation modules from a starship (e.g. Wings, but not when salvaging into generic scrap), you will also receive a Reactor Core matching the class of the starship. You can also now extract Reactor Cores from Shuttles & Exotic starships in the same way, although since they cannot be customized instead of customisation modules like Wings you will just receive some generic scrap worth ~300,000 or ~500,000 units, respectively. (Unfortunately this does not work for Solar ships or Interceptors, and fortunately won't be done to Living Ships either)

In line with this change, purchasing C-Class Reactor Cores now only costs 150 nanites, and the higher Class Reactor Cores have their cost reduced -4,000 nanites since any time you have enough parts to build a ship, by definition you would have at least 3 Reactors of C-Class or better already.
Sale value of Starship Reactor Cores reduced to ~0.67x, so should be worth roughly 67% of the average nanite value of scrapping a starship of that Class and selling all the upgrade modules.
• Only some basic supplies at the lowest rank are free
• All other items are either useful or tradable items / upgrade modules at a -20~85% discount, or items that can't normally be purchased, but at a high price

• Donatable items are now generally either more valuable or more difficult to acquire, although some of them will grant significantly more "standing" than in vanilla. Notably, the Explorers Guild no longer accept Ancient Bones, but now accept a wider variety of procedural items such as ones found from digging up buried caches / plants, or Crew Manifests etc. from Derelict Freighters

"Standing" rewards for a race or Guild from procedural Space Station or Planetary missions have been doubled (other sources of "standing" rewards unchanged, such as space battles, rescuing stranded pilots, dialogue choices with NPCs, etc.)

Amount of "standing" required to reach each Reputation Rank for all races or Guilds increased 3x (Pirates & Autophages are unchanged). Alongside the above change, this makes donations to Guilds for "standing" relatively less effective than they are in vanilla.
Expedition Intervention attempt failures that lose units, will lose 5x as many units (Intervention attempt successes still grant even more units)

The new interactable objects in Space Stations (Data Silos, Storage Containers, etc.) are now roughly ~5x more likely to yield Navigation Data, can now yield Pure Ferrite, yield ~0.1x as much Ferrite Dust/Pure Ferrite/Magnetised Ferrite with lower chances for higher-tier Ferrite. Units yields have already been increased ~100x as PTSd automatically increases small unit rewards, and the rewards of 10-15 Units from some objects have been changed to Nanites as that is presumably what was intended.

Nexus Mission rewards have been rebalanced in line with other mission rewards in PTSd, IE many underwhelming rewards removed for better chance of greater numbers of valuables in general. Notably, they no longer reward any Reactor Cores

Normalized the chances for "wild" starships to have various types of upgrade modules pre-installed. IE, should be a more even mix of different types of upgrades found instead of almost always Shield upgrades. Similar change for "wild" Multi-Tools & Mining Laser upgrades, etc.
Number of Cargo Bulkheads dropped by destroying Pirate Freighters reduced to ~2-4 on average
Fixed the Staff Multi-Tool accidentally having 30 maximum slots instead of 24 like others
Spool of Nano-Cables reverted back to Vanilla price (Only should matter in a rare Expedition Intervention reward)

Some new convenience options placed at the top of some .lua files: Stacksize multipliers for Substances & Products in "PTSd Suit Inventory and Stack Sizes.lua", toggle to revert changes to Multi-Tool grip animation style (also increases max slots on affected tools to 30) in "PTSd Ship+MultiTool Rebalance.lua", toggle to revert increases to mining laser cooldown time after overheating in "PTSd Weapons Rebalance.lua"
464.0.1: Increased Minotaur Bore Charge tank size 1.4x and charging efficiency 2x, to bring it closer to the new vanilla amounts. In PTSd it should now be slightly more effective overall than the Terrain Manipulator instead of being slightly worse in the previous version.
464.0.2: Fixed a bug that could cause a crash when attempting to donate to Explorer Guild Envoys in some situations.
465.0.1: Re-paked for compatibility with NMS v4.65
465.0.2: Added the Pirate Transponder item which had been missing from the lootpool for the custom "Easy" and "Hard" pirate variants in PTSd. (Easy pirates have about a 50% chance to drop one, Hard pirates drop about 1.5 on average)
465.0.3: Procedural Freighter Upgrade Modules found by destroying Freighters are now always B Class instead of always S Class
Substance reward for destroying Freighter Cargo Pods increased 5x (for some reason even in vanilla, the game only awards ~1/5th of the value set in the files)

Doubled the Tritium yield of Sac Venom when refined together with Gravitino Balls again to account for the recent patch halving it's value, so that it's still worth filling up an inventory slot while exploring
470.0.1: Added Iron Vulture to the list of unique expedition reward ships which come with reduced Class and inventory by default
When destroying Freighters, lowered the amount of Cargo Bulkhead from 2-4 to 1. Also added 1 Salvaged Frigate Module as a possible reward.
Made the Albumen Pearl + Gravitino Ball --> Di-Hydrogen recipe work with smaller amounts of ingredients (recipe time & efficiency unchanged)
471.1.1: For users who use re-pak the .lua files themselves with AMUMSS, added "___MOD_BATCHNAME.lua" files in each of the module folders to automatically rename each module's .pak file with the appropriate filename
471.1.2: Reorganized the way that PTSd splits the Minotaur & Nautilon Radar techs into separate Basic & Advanced versions. Now when a Mission or Expedition reward teaches or gives you one of these techs, it should award the Basic version instead of the Advanced version. (As a side effect, existing saves which have only one tech from the Basic/Advanced pair unlocked/installed will swap to the other one)
472.0.1: Re-paked for compatibility with NMS v4.72
472.0.2: Fixed a UI oversight for part of the Living Ship mission tooltip still referencing the vanilla ingredients for the Consciousness Bridge instead of the PTSd ingredients (Emeril instead of Pugneum)
501.1.1: Solar starships can now have their Reactor Cores salvaged, like most other starships (Living ships & Interceptors still cannot)
Increased nanite unlock cost of Launch Auto-Charger by 1.2x

Aqua Jets can no longer be found pre-installed on "wild" starships, now require more Vent Gems & the 5th Atlas Seed to craft. This makes it more of a later-game option, so that the Nautilon still has a purpose in the mid-game.
"Saline Carapace", the Aqua-Jets equivalent for Living Ships, is now much less likely to be found in Psychonic Eggs, similar to the "Chloroplast Membrane" Launch Auto-Charger equivalent
The hostile large worm "Hungering Tendrils" / "Titan Worms" have a chance to appear in up to ~1.67x larger groups
Biological Horror spit attack damage increased ~2x
Vile Queen, hostile bugs, and "Titan Worms" combat abilities improved

Vile Queens now always drop 1 Hypnotic Eye & ~250 Runaway Mould, with a 50% chance to also drop a procedural loot item of Uncommon rarity/value. The chance to drop the new bug helmets is now 50%~12.5% depending on how many you've already found, instead of a flat 25%. However, all Vile Queens on the same planet will drop the same loot, so obtaining all the helmets will require visiting multiple planets with Vile Queens.
The crafting recipes for the various Liquidator Mech parts now each require a Hardframe Engine, just like the Sentinel Hardframe parts

Liquidator Mech Flamethrower gains much more damage from upgrade modules, becoming a respectable weapon when maxed out and supercharged (as in vanilla, the listed + damage % bonus on Flamethrower upgrades is incorrectly displayed extremely high for some reason)

New foods adjusted to match PTSd balance for units value. Notably, the new Syrupy Nectar is particularly valuable when cooked in recipes, just like Honey. Some old foods had values slightly tweaked, such as all Thick, Sweet Batter foods value slightly reduced.
Removes the Cake of Eternal Sleep alternative recipe that uses Syrupy Batter (through Monstrous Custard), as it is significantly less profitable than the Wailing Batter recipes
Adds 1 Processed Sugar to the Cake Batter versions of the Syrup-Drenched Delight recipe
Juicy Grub value increased 6x and cooking it now yields 16x Nourishing Slime, so it is less of a loss to cook it
Refining Hypnotic Eye now produces 666 Runaway Mould instead of 50 Living Slime, so it is not a complete waste
Made warnings for planetary Pirate Raids more clear, including prompting to take cover
501.1.2: The Advanced Exocraft/Minotaur Mining Lasers and Aqua-Jets now require 1 tier higher of Atlas Seeds to craft
Damage for Exocraft/Minotaur Cannon decreased to 0.85x, and knockback to Sentinel Drones reduced to 0.15x so it should no longer effortlessly push them over the horizon at high fire rates

Liquidator Mech Flamethrower base damage increased ~2x, damage from upgrades increased a further ~1.5x, and Fire DOT DPS increased 10x. It should now have noticeably higher DPS than the Minotaur Cannon to make up for its short range, although both of them should have slightly lower DPS than equivalent Multi-Tool weapons like Pulse Spitter or Scatter Blaster.
Vile Queen Spit attack number of projectiles increased 2.25x and projectile explosion AOE increased 1.5x

For users re-paking the .lua files themselves with AMUMSS, cleaned up a few more Warning/Notice messages, the Report.lua for the default PTSd .luas should have just 19 Warnings and 21 Notices (which can be safely ignored)
503.0.1: Biological Horror spit attack damage increased 2x, Vile Queen & Titan Worm spit attack damage increased ~1.16x
Biological Horror spawn count & active attackers count increased ~1.5x
Rancid Flesh & Purged Ribs value increased ~1.5x
Walking Buildings now have damage resistance, taking only 0.15x as much damage as before since they drop a fair amount of nanites when killed and are also buildings.
The "Robot Antelope" rarely found in empty systems now drop 1~2 Industrial-Grade Batteries instead of 1~2 nanites when killed
Salvaged Data refines into 1.33x more nanites, and Navigation Data refines into 0.8x as many nanites
Various starship procedural upgrades now use Chromatic Metal instead of Cadmium to repair. This prevents players from buying & dismantling them to get early access to Cadmium.

Corrected X Class upgrades accidentally selling for double their intended value, allowing you to buy upgrades from planetary smugglers and sell them at space stations at a 100% profit margin. Note that Class X upgrades should be sold at any type of space station to get the full value (which is double the listed value in your inventory)
When pirates drop nanites on defeat, they drop ~1.5x as many (should roughly compensate for the reduced nanites from selling Class X upgrades from Suspicious packets from pirates)
Cleaned the .luas some more. For users re-paking with AMUMSS, the default PTSd .luas should be down to 5 "Warnings" and 5 "Notices" (which can be safely ignored)
503.0.2: Re-paked after accidentally being paked for previous game version
503.0.3: Iteration Ares' daily offer to trade certain items for nanites at the Anomaly should be much more appealing now: Increased nanite reward 2x~10x per item, trades items in batches of 3~10 items at a time, now accepts Glowing Minerals & Pirate Transponders in place of Gravitino Balls & Salvaged Data, and thanks to an adaptation of Reikokuu & Babscoole's "Keep Talking Chef", you can now repeatedly trade batches of items with Ares without exiting & restarting their dialogue interaction each time.
Fixed a typo in the previous change which accidentally replaced the Cadmium repair component of some starship upgrade modules with nothing instead of Chromatic Metal
Some small tweaks to the rarities of a few pre-installed techs on starships / freighters
Solar starship Pulse Jump fuel discount further reduced from -60% to -50%
Slight decrease to Royal Multi-Tool Damage bonus and slight increase to Staff Mining bonus.
Vortex Cubes are no longer sold in certain shops (was a side effect of a sloppy earlier change)
Added comparison charts to the Description page to more clearly show how different starships / multi-tools compare to each other in PTSd
503.0.4: Fixed issue with weapon grip animations: all Multi-Tools should now use their proper vanilla grip animations, so Rifles etc. should be held in two hands like normal again.

• On average, new Multi-Tools should have ~0.7x as many initial slots on them, between 6~16 depending on their size category(maximum upgradeable size is unchanged at 24 slots). There is also no longer any "overlap" in slot amounts between size categories, i.e. all "Medium" (Like Royals) will always be found with more slots than any "Small" Multi-Tools (like Pistols) and fewer slots than any "Large" Multi-Tools (like Rifles)

• A hidden benefit for smaller sized Multi-Tools is that their supercharged slots are more likely to be grouped towards the left half of their inventories compared to larger Multi-Tools. This both makes it more likely to unlock and discover the supercharged slots sooner while upgrading them, but also a little more likely that supercharged slots might be adjacent to one another as there are fewer possible slots for them to appear in. (This same behavior also exists in vanilla, but has been amplified in PTSd)
The Exocraft / Minotaur Cannon's critical hit multiplier is now just 1.1x instead of 1.5x, as its large AOE makes it very easy to strike critical weak points no matter where it actually hits enemies.

The refiner recipes to convert Residual Goop --> Viscous Fluids --> Living Slime --> Runaway Mould now each complete 5x faster, and Runaway Mould --> Nanites completes 1.5x faster. This should make it less prohibitively time-consuming to make use of all the Goops & Slimes found while exploring.

Also buffed the Atlantideum + Mordite --> Living Slime recipe, as on top of taking an extraordinarily long time, it was vastly less efficient at converting Atlantideum into Runaway Mould than simply using some of the Atlantideum to create Pugneum and make Runaway Mould directly. It now completes 120x faster, and is ~20x more efficient, but makes Residual Goop instead of Living Slime. This makes it a bit more efficient, but require more time & steps than the alternative (Atlantideum + Pugneum --> Runaway Mould)

Removed the 1.2x bonus to Settlement products output rate, as it seems the game may not actually round down the products per cycle as the UI implies it does after all. Also lowered the "stocked" item cap for Settlement output from 9999 items to 3600 items, which should still hold ~3 days worth of Substance production for a highly-developed Settlement, and still holds ~120 days worth of Product production (although anything past a week or two is already straining the "normal gameplay" situation)
Added clarification to the in-game descriptions of the various Difficulty presets on how they fit with PTSd

Added clarification to the in-game description for the Ground Combat Difficulty Setting that the "Hostile" option also increases the chances for some planets to have Aggressive Sentinels, particularly Lush planets (this is a vanilla effect, it just normally isn't explained to the player)
A tiny bit more .lua cleaning: AMUMSS should no longer should give a Conflict warning about "MOD_BATCHNAME.LUA" (which could be safely ignored)
503.0.5: (This change was accidentally not implemented in PTSd v503.0.3) Significantly increased the crafting cost of the Liquidator Mech parts. They now all require several Recycled Circuitry and potentially other trade / farm crafting products, at least 1 million units worth of materials each.

Corrected an oversight in vanilla NMS for how it handles Mining Speed bonuses based on Multi-Tool's type stat bonuses. Now a Multi-Tool's "Damage" stat bonus no longer also increases mining speed, so Multi-Tool types with high "Damage" bonuses but low "Mining" bonuses should be noticeably slower at mining, as intended.
Vile Queen health increased a further ~1.33x
Rebalanced the possible items found in all kinds of Suspicious Packets:

• (Tech) Packets now can also have Pulse Engine & Launcher X-Class upgrades, and both (Tech) and (Arms) Packets can have various upgrades for Exocraft / Minotaur / Nautilon. Since those upgrades don't come in X-Class, they will randomly be C/B/A/S Class, with lower chances for higher Classes.

• (Goods) packets have the chances to award Repair Kits or Walker Brains reduced 0.5x, various Trade Goods reduced ~0.15x, and the possible amounts for many items such as Trade Goods, Geodes, Larval Cores, Gravitino Balls, etc. increased 2~4x
The unsalvageable "mini-shipwrecks" added in NMS 5.0 are now roughly half as likely to yield Suspicious Packets (Tech) instead of Suspicious Packets (Goods) or Anomaly Detectors

Removed Conflict Scanner and all starship/multi-tool weapon techs except for Pulse Spitter, Plasma Launcher, and Phase Beam from the random tech reward pools. In exchange, added more low-level "utility" techs to the random tech reward pools such as Simple Translator, Shield Lattice, Personal Refiner, Emergency Warp Unit, Instability Engine, etc. In PTSd these random tech rewards mostly come up in the "Expanding the Base" missions, and default to a related upgrade module instead if you've already learned all the techs.
Similarly, the Armourer NPC now awards Efficient Thruster & Ablative Armour techs alongside a tech from the random ship tech pool instead of the Cyclotron Ballista and Infra-knife Accelerator techs.
Emergency Warp Unit blueprints now also sold by shops in Minor Settlements, not just at the Anomaly
Hex Core value increased ~1000x (was worth 16 units previously)
Slight adjustments to possible loot for killing anomalous creatures on Weird / Exotic / Anomalous planets, they now drop less Mordite / Hex Cores
Increased number of Gravitino Balls required for some "Expanding the Base" missions from 10 to 24
503.0.6: Updated the Multi-Tool comparison chart on the Description page to give a better idea of each Multi-Tool's actual mining performance. Split the previous "Mining" stat bonus for each Multi-Tool type into showing both the resulting "Resources/object" (how much substances you get per mined rock/tree/crystal/metal finger/etc.) and "Resources/sec" (how quickly you can receive substances while mining, taking into account both how quickly you mine rocks/trees and how much substances each will contain).

Increased the "Resources/object" amount on the unique Mining Laser variants Hijacked Laser by 1.6x and Runic Lens by ~1.16x, to make the Sentinel & Atlantid Multi-Tools more competitive with Pistols for mining:

• Now Sentinel Multi-Tools can reach the highest "Resources/sec" in theory, however in practice this may be a bit lower due to the increased time you will need to take to keep aiming at new rocks/trees with how quickly they get destroyed, plus needing to walk to new areas after destroying all nearby rocks/trees, plus needing to pause more frequently to cool down the laser as it heats up more quickly. And this is on top of consuming fuel at ~6x the rate of other mining lasers.

• Now Atlantid Multi-Tools are closer to Pistols for "Resources/sec" (though still below them & Sentinel Multi-Tools), however in practice it may be a bit higher as they will take less time aiming at new rocks/trees with how slowly they get destroyed, slower heating up, etc. (essentially the opposite of all the points above for Sentinel Multi-Tools, aside from having default fuel consumption)
Scanning stat bonus increased ~1.07x for Atlantid & Staff Multi-Tools
Damage stat bonus increased ~1.1x for Alien Multi-Tools

Starship Rockets were working a little too well early on, so their overheat cooldown is increased 1.5x and base damage decreased to ~0.85x, so you will have to be a little more choosy when to fire them. However, the damage bonus from the Large Rocket Tubes tech is increased to now be +100% instead of +50% of the base damage, so the final maxed damage is slightly higher than before. Also clarified in the in-game description that the Large Rocket Tubes tech improves damage, not cooldown (not improving cooldown appears to be a vanilla bug).

Further increased how much having an active shield protects against Technology Damage/Breaking: tech breakage is now ~0.67x as likely as before while your shield still remains. As usual, breakage chance still increases the lower your shields get like in vanilla (and no change to tech breakage chances with shields down). Can be adjusted in "PTSd Other Difficulty Settings.lua".

Adjusted some space station / nexus mission reward chances: higher chances for low-level missions to award Defence Chits, much lower chances for high-level Nexus missions to just award trade goods / storm crystals, replaced Hexite reward with more valuable Hex Cores, a few other tweaks
Adjusted some prices for items bought from Scrap Dealers (w/ Tainted Metal) / Outlaw Stations (w/ Units):
• Repair Kit: Tainted Metal price decreased 0.8x, Units cost increased 2x
• Suspicious Packets (Tech): Tainted Metal & Units price increased 1.25x, (Arms) Packet: Tainted Metal & Units price decreased 0.8x (their prices should now be closer together)

Possibly fixed an edge case where in some situations, sending a frigate fleet with a rating 2 stars above the frigate expedition difficulty rating may still have had a chance to take damage. As a side effect, 4 star difficulty expeditions are now rarer and 3 star difficulty ones are more common.
If re-paking the default PTSd .luas, down to 5 Warnings & 4 Notices
505.0.1: Hopefully addressed (at least partially) the issue of Pirate Raiders one-shotting the player at certain buildings / POI locations:

• Planetary Pirate Raids have been disabled from spawning at Planetary Colossal Archives in "PTSd Longer Space Wanted Level Countdowns.lua" (due to a vanilla bug where they directly target the player when spawning at that location). If you notice the bugged "directly targeting & one-shotting the player" Pirate Raid behaviour elsewhere, please let me know what the nearest building / POI was so I can potentially disable that as well.

• Pirate Raiders now spawn ~4x farther away from the player, which should now give enough warning time to get indoors / underground just in case there are any other locations which are also bugged. They also now spawn in groups of up to 8 starships instead of up to 12.
• As a failsafe, added a new toggle to completely disable planetary pirate raids at the top of "PTSd Other Difficulty Settings.lua"

Decreased the substance mining rate for C/B/A Class Mineral/Gas hotspots by ~0.14x-0.29x (S Class unchanged). Previously, despite differences in mining rates, any class hotspot could easily fill up all attached Silos overnight, which is a common use case. While 8 extractors over either an A & S Class hotspot can still fill a full set of 16 Silos in a day (and on A Class can even fill a half-set of 8 silos overnight, for bases splitting silos between 2 or more substances such as for gas & mineral), only S Class will mine fast enough to accumulate significant amounts during a typical play session. B Class needs just over 2 days to fill a full set of silos, or can get a half-set ~77% full after a day. C Class needs ~3 days to fill a full set of silos, or can get a half-set ~55% full after a day.
Overhaul to increase Pirate Dreadnought battle difficulty & rewards, overview below:

• The battle is more of a true "race against time" / "DPS check" now, with the role of the Anti-Freighter Cannons & Pirate Frigates essentially swapped from vanilla. In PTSd it is no longer feasible to destroy the Cannons fast enough to extend the battle, so the civilian freighter will essentially be taking constant slow damage the whole time. However, you can now destroy most of the Pirate Frigates (the Dreadnought will continually summon replacements once it is down to 2 Frigates) at the start of the battle so that you waste less time taking out the Torpedos, which still need to be continually shot down to prevent the Dreadnought from warping away too soon.
• In order of increasing difficulty (& rewards), the ways to succeed at a Dreadnought battle are now:
• • A) Deal enough damage (via destroying Exposed Fuel Rods) to cause the Dreadnought to warp away, while the civilian freighter survives, for a "small" bounty.

• • B) Fully destroy the Dreadnought (can deal some extra hull damage before destroying the final few Exposed Fuel Rods to prevent it from warping), while the civilian freighter survives, for a "medium" bounty.

• • C) Force the Dreadnought to surrender (by destroying the Warp Drives before all the Exposed Fuel Rods) while letting the civilian freighter die, then demanding a "large" tribute from the Dreadnought.

• • D) Force the Dreadnought to surrender as in C, but do it fast enough that the civilian freighter survives, then collect both the "medium" bounty and demand a "large" tribute from the Dreadnought (this is difficult to pull off & likely only possible with a fairly late-game setup)

• Each of the above success methods requires approximately ~1.5x as much damage output / DPS as the previous method, and the units/nanites reward is roughly ~1.5x as valuable (with more rare items such as Salvaged Frigate Modules / Cargo Bulkheads, etc.). However even if you fail, you should at least now get a few consolation items from destroying some Pirate Frigates & most of the destructible parts on the Dreadnought

• Claiming a Pirate Dreadnought now costs 350,000,000 units instead of being free (still potentially a good deal if the Dreadnought has high slots and Class). However due to modding limitations I haven't found a way around yet, this cost is currently paid each time you inspect the Dreadnought, not when actually confirming the exchange. Added notes about this to the dialogue window to tell the player to use their Analysis Visor instead to inspect the Dreadnought and decide whether to purchase it (and summon their freighter to uninstall any technology first) before making the purchase.
Dreadnought battle change specific details:

• Added a few additional Pirate starship spawns to the battle for a little added hazard, however they essentially remain stationary in a cluster where they spawn and act as a sort of turret/obstacle to avoid due to some sort of vanilla pathing issue.
• Health for Dreadnought hull increased 4x, Shield Generators/Exposed Fuel Rods/Anti-Ship Turrets increased ~8x-22x, Anti-Freighter Cannons increased ~35x, and Warp Drives increased ~52x
• Pirate Frigate health reduced 0.5x, but battle starts with 8 instead of 6 initial Pirate Frigates

• Destroying Exposed Fuel Rods now deal 1.12x as much Dreadnought hull damage. Dreadnought attempt to warp away at 16% remaining health instead of 25% remaining health (this breakpoint can still be achieved by destroying all 10 Exposed Fuel Rods)
• Dreadnought only summons reinforcement Pirate Frigates when down to 1 remaining Frigate instead of 5. Will now only summon 1 Frigate at a time instead of 3
• Dreadnought Anti-Freighter Cannon damage to civilian freighter reduced to ~0.89x, Pirate Frigate Torpedo damage reduced to ~0.77x

• Shield Generators now have a chance to drop Starshield Batteries, Warp Drives & Exposed Fuel Rods have a chance to drop Frigate Fuel (50t), Anti-Ship/Freighter Turrets/Cannons drop ~16/~100 Nanites, and Pirate Frigates drop the same loot as "Easy" PTSd Pirate starships.

• Fixed UI countdown for Dreadnought warp to display accurate time remaining, which doesn't actually get increased by destroying Warp Drive likes the vanilla UI shows (apparently a vanilla bug) Added some other notes/hints to some of the UI for Dreadnought battles to make some things clearer

• Reduced units reward for saving civilian freighter back to vanilla amounts, however added several hundred nanite & a Salvaged Frigate Module or Cargo Bulkhead reward alongside them. Demanding tribute from surrendered Dreadnought units reward increased 1.75x, added ~1,300 nanites, Salvaged Frigate module, & Cargo Bulkhead alongside it
Player-controlled Dreadnought Anti-Freighter Cannons no longer one-shot unshielded Sentinel Freighters / other Dreadnoughts
Slightly increased Phase Beam & Cyclotron Ballista damage vs. Freighter Hulls, slightly decreased Infra-Knife Accelerator damage vs. Freighter Hulls
Increased Shield health for neutral freighters by ~2x (not Sentinel freighter, Pirate Dreadnought, or lead civilian freighter attacked by Pirate Dreadnought)
Decreased base starship weapon damage vs. Planetary Sentinels & Walking Buildings ~0.1x (explosion AOE from starship weapons still deals significant damage)

Decrease the shield-leech effect of Phase Beam & Grafted Eyes to 0.8x. Added notes to in-game descriptions explaining that the relative shield leech effect is greater the higher the user's max shield capacity is. E.G. A Hauler gains much more shields per second using a Phase Beam than a Fighter does, since it has larger shields and they get restored on a & basis.

Increased Hijacked Laser resource yield by ~1.44x to account for how supercharging it divides its yield by 1.2 instead of multiplying it by 1.2 like all other mining laser variants do, and using an un-supercharged mining laser will always be inferior for mining. The Multi-Tool comparison chart left as-is since it already shows the correct proportional comparisons once they're all supercharged.
Freighter Scanner Room requires an Atlas Seed of 1 tier lower, but now costs 3 Navigation Data to scan each star system (in-game description updated to reflect this)

Reduced the % chance for Cargo Scan Deflector / Neural Shielding to succeed on each attempt from 50% to 30%. However since you can make multiple attempts during each scan, using it 2-3 times will still have an overall ~51%-66% chance to work by the end.
Increased units bounty for the weakest version of the "wild" wandering pirate bounties by 1.5x
Destroying the components surrounding Salvageable Scrap cores yields Rusted Metal instead of Ferrite Dust and yields ~0.25x as much

Replaced two of the Gek-specific settlement item outputs with ones worth ~2x more (and can still be cooked / crafted into even more valuable forms): Pie Case changed to Cake Batter, Magno-Gold changed to Enriched Carbon.
Applied the relevant PTSd price modifiers to various uncooked "batters" themselves like Cake Batter, Thick, Sweet Batter, etc.

Added in-game notes to relevant dialogue windows regarding the main "honour-system"/"recommended" PTSd actions such as refusing free rescued freighters, stopping Exosuit slot upgrades at 40 tech & 40 cargo, defeating nearby Sentinel Mechs before shutting down Sentinel Pillars, etc.

Added more clarifications to the in-game Difficulty Setting descriptions to list the actual numerical effects of the various options (based on the PTSd modifiers), or to clarify some unintuitive side effects for some of the settings
Added clarification to in-game description for Cargo Scan Deflector / Neural Shielding that it also works for Pirate Scans as well (like in vanilla).

Added some more PTSd-specific details to in-game descriptions for the Analysis Visor and various types of Mining Lasers to explain how the yield is affect by Multi-Tool stats, note not to combine different types of Mining Lasers, and for Boltcaster/Photon Cannon/Positron Ejector to note any unintuitive features.
Added note to description and Installation.txt about using search tools like grepWin to more easily find things in the PTSd .lua files.
505.0.2: Further increased the amount of hits the AI-piloted Minotaur must take before getting damaged by ~1.17x
Corrected Phase Beam / Grafted Eye shield leech effect accidentally getting reduced 0.75x instead of 0.8x in previous update
Corrected Ares initially using the wrong item name when asking to trade for Gold Nuggets / Glowing Minerals
Corrected Shuttle & Explorer Shield Bonus at Class C accidentally being ~0.72x as high as intended

Fixed the vanilla quirk where some starships could sometimes can have a Stat Bonus be lower at a higher Class than a lower Class, by making small adjustments to certain Stat Bonuses at certain Classes for Fighters, Haulers, Solars, Interceptors, and Freighters. Now higher Class starships should always have higher Stat Bonuses than lower Class starship of the same type.
Updated some weather event values: Meteor Storms should last 1.5x longer, greater chance of tornadoes being in clusters, some other small tweaks to match things to newer vanilla values
Added Runaway Mould to the list of items which can be refined together with Microprocessors to create Salvaged Data
Added notes to in-game descriptions of all items which can be refined directly into nanites or Salvaged Data (with Microprocessors), and Basalt into Silicate Powder

Added notes to in-game descriptions for Gravitino Balls/Albumen Pearls/Sac Venom and their plantable versions on how they can be refined together to make Di-Hydrogen / Tritium and their relative strengths as "profit" crops
Added hint to in-game descriptions for various "Junk" items like Living Slime or Rusted Metal on how they can be refined into more useful items
Added notes to in-game mission log & popups for handing in Derelict Freighter Crew Manifest / Captain Logs to clarify the different rewards for turning in to different NPCs in PTSd
505.0.3: Changed Shield Generators in Dreadnought / Sentinel Freighter battles to use the same damage multipliers as starship shields, so anti-shield weapons will work better against them. (added "Shielded" note to their UI name popup in the yellow shield font color to indicate this)

Changed the damage multipliers vs. non "boss" Freighter Hulls (all except Dreadnought or Sentinel Freighter) for Phase Beam, Cyclotron Ballista, and Infraknife Accelerator back to the same as vs. regular ship Hulls. Positron Ejector still has reduced damage vs. all freighter hulls since it is easy to stay in optimal range against them, but it's damage vs all freighter hulls is now increased ~1.16x to be more competitive with Infraknife Accelerator
Increased the health for some variants of Cargo Pods attached to freighters by 2x to match the other variants.

All kinds of Cargo Pods no longer display their contents before destroying them, the UI now says "Contents Unknown". Will cost more time & standing loss to gather specific items from raiding freighters now.

Reduced rewards from Cargo Pods attached to/nearby freighters in Outlaw systems due to their relatively light defenses: amounts of substances and illegal trade goods reduced ~0.3x-0.5x, relative chance for getting the higher-value illegal trade goods reduced ~0.5x

The value markup for selling illegal goods in non-Outlaw systems reduced from +200% to +100%. However, the base value of illegal goods (including Nip Nip Buds) increased 1.5x so the final selling value outside Outlaw systems remains the same. The main difference is that now there is a smaller profit margin when buying illegal goods in an Outlaw Station to resell in non-Outlaw stations
505.0.4: Increased the required standing for the Outlaw reputation ranks by 3x, but also increased the Outlaw standing awarded by Outlaw station missions by 4.5x, similar to the changes for race/guild standing & reputation ranks
Increased Atlantid Damage bonus by 1.25x, Royal & Staff Mining bonus by ~1.25x

For convenience, rearranged the position of the "core" techs (Pulse Engine, Shield, Launcher, Hyperdrive) on Expedition reward starships when you redeem them, to ensure that they always appear in the unlocked inventory slots to skip the hassle of having to install them from scratch on certain ships like the Iron Vulture where they otherwise wouldn't fit into the smaller tech inventory with PTSd.
Fixed X-Class Pulse Engine upgrade modules accidentally being given double chances to be found in Suspicious Packets (Tech) in a previous PTSd update
Updated some minor .lua formatting for latest version of AMUMSS
510.0.1: Exo-Skiff now requires Cadmium and larger amounts of Salt, Crystal Sulphide to build
Automated Trap now requires Emeril, Living Pearls, and larger amounts of Metal Plating to build

Increased the crafting costs for all Fishing Baits, especially for higher grade baits. They all now require increasingly large amounts of either raw or cooked fish, so that you cannot sustainably use the highest quality bait forever without sometimes using lower quality/no bait to replenish your "bait fish" supply.
Adjusted bonus values on Rusted upgrade modules from fishing to fit PTSd patterns
Did some rough units value balancing on foods cookable with any fish, or ones requiring additional non-fish ingredients (Will need to do more in-depth balancing on cooked fish in general)
Corrected vanilla issue where Rusted Launcher upgrade modules from fishing had higher Boost Speed bonuses than C Class Launcher upgrade modules
Added clarification to settlement expedition prompts that in PTSd they generally increase settlement population on average
511.0.1: Corrected vanilla issue of Optical Drill being removed from multi-tool tech unlock tree in the Anomaly
Reduced average waiting time between fish bites/catches to approximately ~0.75x, and reduced the window where you can catch a fish after it bites from ~2 seconds to ~1 second.

Improved the bonuses to fish quality for all kinds of bait (including using food as bait), especially Spicy Chum and Bionic Lure. Specialized Baits (Mealworms, Bionic Lure, Dangling Orb, etc.) now also give small improvements to fish size chances, not just fish quality.
Slight adjustments to fish size chance based on sea depth for smoother transition of Medium size fish appearing and less Small fish in deep waters
Bionic Lures now require Circuit Boards instead of Living Glass to craft

Greatly increased units value of raw fish (~10x vanilla value) to be more competitive with other activities for earning units such as collecting Storm Crystals, Ancient Bones, etc. Raw fish no longer have increased sale value on space stations.

Value of foods cooked with fish are balanced around always using the cheapest fish possible. Generally this means only Common (C Class) fish are worthwhile to cook in most cases (Exceptions are Starfish are worth cooking at B Class, and Squid & Turtles are worth cooking at A Class), and recipes requiring "any fish" are balanced around using Common, Small fish.
Slightly reduced nanite value for releasing fish (~0.9x vanilla value), added clarification to UI that releasing fish yields nanites
Automated Traps now take ~2 hours per catch instead of ~1 hour, and can only hold 0.5x as many Common / Uncommon fish per stack
Fixed Automated Traps accidentally being buildable unlimited times per planet in last PTSd patch. Automated Traps can now be built 9x per planet, but still only 3x per base or nearby cluster.
Medium & Large Refiners can now be built 4x each in a nearby cluster (still unlimited amount per base, as long as you put a little spacing between clusters)
Increased nanite unlock price for Fishing Rig tech 2x
511.0.2: Fixed Mealworms crafting not working by now requiring 1 Living Pearl instead of 4x "Any Seafood" (which only worked in the nutrient processor)
Spicy Chum requires 3x the Firewater to craft
Spicy Chum, Dangling Orb, Shadow Lure, and Magpulse Lure all require 0.8x Assorted Roe to craft
Slightly increased the rarity bonus for Dangling Orb, Shadow Lure, & Magpulse Lure so they are now just slightly below Spicy Chum's rarity bonus
Dangling Orb, Shadow Lure, & Magpulse Lure should now be ~1.5x - 2x more effective at attracting their specific time/weather based fish

Added clarification to the in-game descriptions for the various specialised baits on their relative bonuses to rarity & size, as well as noting the weather/time based baits only work during their relevant weather/time of day.
Slightly tweaked the in-game Difficulty Setting for "Relaxed" Fishing Timing, and added more detailed explanation of the setting's effects to the description.
Exo-Skiff cold storage reduced from 60 to 30 slots (may only affect new saves?)
512.0.1: Further reduced time needed to reel in a fish after it bites to ~0.5x-0.67x the time in the previous update

Reduced Common (C) & Uncommon (B) raw fish units value to 0.5x & ~0.8x, increased Rare (A) & Legendary (S) raw fish units value ~1.1x & 1.5x. All Colossal fish now only worth 400% of Small fish units value instead of 500%.
Reduced nanites value for releasing Common & Uncommon fish to ~0.3x & ~0.5x, increased nanites value of Rare fish by 1.1x and Legendary fish by ~2.3x to better match their high units sale value
Mealworms rarity bonuses slightly reduced so that it catches noticeably more Common fish than Uncommon fish

With the above changes, now the pattern is that Mealworms / Spicy Chum / Bionic Lure each increase your average units or nanites profits while fishing by roughly ~1.4x / ~2.1x / ~2x compared to the next lowest tier of bait (or no bait in the case of Mealworms) when considering the units cost of bait. E.G. using Bionic Lure gives roughly double the units or nanites profits compared to Spicy Chum. Fishing in 90+ depth waters with Spicy Chum can beat the units/minute profits of collecting Gravitino Balls with an upgraded speedy Exocraft, though still a bit below Salvageable Scrap / Ancient Bones.

Additionally, Diurnal & Nocturnal raw fish now have a 1.15x multiplier to their units value, and Storm-only raw fish have a 1.3x multiplier to give a little incentive to seek out these harder to find fish or use their targeted baits.

Adjusted units value for all cooked fish dishes, with smaller, more common fish given larger values relative to their raw ingredients to better compete with using them for bait or releasing them for nanites as they have the most efficient nanite:unit ratio.  Notably now Seafood "Feast" is almost always worthwhile to make (IE all Colossal fish of Uncommon (B) rarity or lower are worth cooking, except for Giant Sunray (B) ). Otherwise usually only Common (C) fish are worth cooking alone, or usually just Small Common fish if combining with other fish / ingredients (with exceptions for the various species-specific recipes for species which don't come in Common and/or Small varieties like turtles, squid, octopus, starfish, eels, etc.)
Cooking 1 Kelp Rice now requires 5x Kelp Sacs (matching how cooking 1 Marrow Flesh takes 5 Marrow Bulbs in PTSd)
Increased the rate that debt is paid off for your settlement ~3x to roughly match the vanilla / expected rate based on settlement daily profits
Small tweaks to Scanning bonus for various Multi-Tools (+ or - 5%/10% bonus): Pistol bonus reduced ~0.88x, Rifle bonus reduced 0.75x, Sentinel bonus increased ~1.1x, Atlantid bonus increased ~1.14x
Unlock cost for Nautilon Geobay at Anomaly reduced ~0.5x
Added to description for Automated Traps to clarify that they will trap fish from various depths regardless of where you place them
Added to description for starship Teleport Receiver to clarify that in PTSd it extends the item interaction range for your starship to 800u.

Added to the descriptions for Autonomous Mining Unit, Oxygen Harvester, Atmosphere Harvester, and Antimatter Reactor to clarify their 10 minute cycle duration time in PTSd and tips for avoiding the vanilla glitch which sometimes clears their inventory

Restored the ability to view the growth time remaining for Sac Venom when viewing a planted Venom Urchin through the Analysis Visor, which was removed in a recent vanilla patch presumably as a mistake
512.0.2: Reduced the quality of Freighter/Frigate upgrade modules looted from destroying civilian freighters or Dreadnoughts from Class B to Class C due to the ease of obtaining them and to incentivize exploring Derelict Freighters more.
