Increased the base time between planetary pirate raids by ~1.2x in high-conflict systems and ~1.6x in medium-conflict systems (planetary pirate raids still don't occur in low-conflict systems). In addition, the "Hostile" setting for the "On-Foot Combat" in-game difficulty setting now uses 50% of the base time for planetary pirate raids / sentinel drone spawns instead of 33%

Starship Launcher tech requires ~1.67x as much Uranium to fully recharge, Pulse Engine tech requires 10x as much Pyrite to fully recharge. PTSd changes to starship Launcher & Pulse Engine charging effectiveness now also apply to the special Advanced Launch System & Waveform Engine alternatives

Living Ship shields tech requires 0.5x as much Mordite / Pugneum / Di-hydrogen to fully recharge, launcher tech requires 2x as much Oxygen / Condensed Carbon to fully recharge, pulse engine tech requires 2x Carbon to fully recharge, hyperdrive tech requires ~1.33x Chromatic Metal or Living Slime to fully recharge and can now feasibly be recharged with Processed Meat
Sentinel Interceptor launcher tech requires 0.5x as much Pugneum to fully recharge, pulse engine tech requires 1.25x as much Tritium to recharge, shield tech requires 1.5x Sodium Nitrate to recharge
Warp Hypercore requires 2x the materials to craft
Animus Beam requires 0.5x as much Di-hydrogen to fully recharge
Exocraft Cannon & Nautilon Cannon now consume fuel at 0.5x the vanilla rate
Unlock cost for Tethys Beam and Automated Trap at the Anomaly reduced to ~0.5x, unlock cost for Nautilon Cannon reduced to 0.75x
Increased shield bonus for the Ablative Armour starship tech by ~2.6x so it is no longer weaker than Class C Starshield upgrade modules and perhaps now worth unlocking/installing.

Biological Horror health increased ~1.5x, weakpoint size reduced to ~0.67x, and spit attack damage increased 2x. Number of Horrors spawned at a time decreased to 0.75x, however the number of Horrors which can be actively attacking the player at a time is unchanged.
Rancid Flesh & Purged Ribs value reduced to ~0.75x

Strengthened the reduced Sprinting stamina drain effect from Toxic Storms 5x and the Mining Beam cooling effect from Cold Storms 3x, since these effects are generally much less impactful than the Hot Storm Jetpack efficiency effect or Radiation Storm mining yield effects.

Added clarifications in the mission descriptions & tips for Dreams of the Deep that the High-Power Sonar blueprint needs to be purchased from the Space Anomaly & installed to progress, not the Basic Sonar (due to PTSd splitting the Sonar tech into 2 different techs)

Added to the descriptions for Emeril & Indium Drives to clarify that they also work for red & green star systems. Similarly clarified for AtlasPass v2 & v3 that they also work on low & medium-level security locks.
Added a little more context to the Goods Availability difficulty setting description
512.0.3: The cost to buy Emergency Signal Scanners for Derelict Freighters have the initial price reduced to 0.75x, and the price increases approximately ~0.5x as quickly for each additional one purchased the same day, up to 64k units after the 12th purchase of the day.

Containers / Datapads on Derelict Freighters award ~4x as many nanites. This incentivizes exploring them thoroughly rather than rushing to the end, since more rooms & containers means more nanites. This should make Derelict Freighters one of the very best methods in terms of nanites/minute if also selling/refining other loot into nanites (at the cost of increasingly expensive Emergency Signal Scanners if trying to do them multiple times per day)

Increased nanite reward option at the end of a Derelict Freighter by 3x to make it more competitive with the other choices. Added note to the dialogue choices to display the approximate amount of nanites to be awarded. (Added similar note to nanite reward option dialogue at Manufacturing Facilities)

The Class of Freighter upgrade modules received as a reward option at the end of Derelict Freighters is now truly randomized each run instead of being static based on the star system/region you're in (dialogue window now clarifies that the Tech will be truly random). However they are given generous chances (10% C, 40% B, 30% A, & 20% S Class), and this can be toggled back to vanilla spawn rules with UsePTSdFreiUpgradeClassChances in "PTSd Rewards Remixer.lua"

The amount of Tainted Metal received for trading Crew Manifests / Captain's Logs to Scrap Dealers is now unaffected by the in-game "Natural Resources" difficulty setting. On the "Standard" setting this means you will receive 1.25x more Tainted Metal for trading them in than previously.

As a solution for the vanilla bug where sometimes the mission required to be able to trade in Crew Manifests / Captain's Logs disappears/fails to spawn, you can now activate any Crew Manifest / Captain's Log from your inventory (once outside the Derelict Freighter) to reactivate the "trade in Derelict items at Scrap Dealers or Guild Reps" mission. (Item description now indicates how to do so)

As a backup just in case you're still unable to trade in Derelict Freighter Crew Manifests / Captain's Logs for some other reason (perhaps using the gLonely mod with fewer NPCs available), they can now at least be sold as items for ~0.85x the units you would get for trading them to Guild Reps in PTSd.

The ability to access the secret "discordant interface" terminals at Monoliths in Korvax systems and purchase Atlantid Multi-Tools now unlocks during the "A Leap in the Dark" main story mission after inspecting some Monoliths, instead of after completing the entire main story and starting Autophage missions. This spaces out the unlocking of Atlantid & Staff multi-tools further apart from each other, especially since the large Mining & yield bonuses of Atlantid Multi-Tools are more useful earlier in the game. Added notes to the in-game dialogue and mission tip during "A Leap in the Dark" when Atlantid multi-tools become available.
Amount of Atlantideum required to charge & activate Discordant Interfaces at Korvax Monoliths increased ~2x
Health of Pirate Dreadnoughts hull & all exterior parts reduced to ~0.85x. Pirate Frigate health reduced an additional 0.5x on top of this.
Tweaks to chances & amounts of loot in freighters/cargo pods in regular/outlaw systems. Mainly reducing both the amounts & chances for illegal trade goods in outlaw systems to ~0.8x
Starship Launcher tech requires 1.2x as much Uranium to fully recharge
Reduced the duration of Trade Surges from 3 hours to 1 hour 20 minutes

Adjusted the minimum & maximum possible number of bonuses that can appear on certain upgrade modules that didn't fit the general pattern of other upgrade modules. Mostly lowered the max possible number of bonuses that can appear on some "Rusted" fishing Class upgrades, and made the A & S Class Scanner upgrades always have at least 3 & 4 bonuses.

Since A & S Class Scanner upgrade modules now consistently have at least 3 & 4 bonuses on them, increased the nanite value/price for Scanner upgrades 1.2x again as it was in the past. (X-Class Scanner upgrade price is unchanged since there still is a good chance to get less than 3 or 4 bonuses on those)

Caught a few Monolith rewards I had missed which were still awarding techs from an old tech pool, so they now can teach a wider variety of techs (but not as many weapon techs) and will give random related upgrade modules if you know all the tech in the pool.

Fixed the recipe for refining Flesh Rope + Microprocessors into Salvaged Data not working. Also adjusted the time required for the various PTSd recipes for refining certain items into nanites to scale with the amount of nanites yielded (most of the recipes are now faster)
Added notes to descriptions for the time & weather based baits that diurnal/nocturnal/storm-only fish are more valuable than normal fish.
512.0.4: Adjustments to the bonus stats for most Multi-Tools, mostly to Mining & Damage bonuses (As usual, currently owned multi-tools will need to have their class upgraded to update to the new stats, or use a Save Editor to increase their stat bonuses by the amounts listed below):
• Experimental Mining bonus increased 1.33x, Scanning bonus increased 1.04x
• Royal Damage bonus increased ~1.17x, Mining bonus increased ~1.17x
• Hijacked Laser damage increased 1.55x (to compensate for apparently some recent vanilla change seems to have reduced the effective DPS vs. Sentinels), substance yield decreased 0.65x
• Staff Damage bonus increased ~1.29x, Mining bonus increased 1.11x
• All versions of the Mining Beam (Hijacked Laser, Runic Lens, etc.) have their fuel consumption rate increased 1.2x to compensate for how supercharging them reduced their fuel consumption

• Multi-Tool chart on the Mod Description page now changed to display the relevant stats with the Mining Beam (or alternative) supercharged, since it's assumed you'd always be using a supercharged Mining Beam (or alternative) when doing significant mining
Now both Rifles & Pistols act as "starting" weapons which eventually become "obsolete" compared to other multi-tools, as several other tools will have better Resources/sec than Pistols now.

Hijacked Laser Resources/sec rate only drops to ~0.83x of its supercharged rate when not supercharged, unlike the Mining Beam or Runic Lens which drop to ~0.58x of their supercharged rate when not supercharged. So even if leaving the Hijacked Laser un-supercharged, you can potentially get Resources/sec as good or better than other multi-tools (except for Atlantids) even if they use a supercharged mining beam.

• Also, when mining minerals & di-hydrogen the yield from opening Geodes or Crystal Fragments is unchanged, so the Hijacked Laser is especially effective when mining objects with a chance to drop set items like those. Objects which always drop a set amount of items, such as Glowing Minerals, Subterranean Organic Structures, Salvageable Scrap, etc. are even better, essentially having no downside to using Sentinel multi-tool on them, which destroys such objects more than ~7x faster than a Royal multi-tool.
Refining Faecium + Oxygen to make mor Faecium now requires 2x Oxygen
Removed the optional "PTSd Missions and Rewards - No Farther Target Sweep 512.0.3.pak" file from being in the main download zip file by accident last version
520.0.1: Increased damage from new Cursed Expedition enemies
Added Boundary Herald to list of expedition ships which are redeemed with smaller size / lower Class by default
Making Frost Crystals into Glass by using the Refiner now takes 0.5x as long and uses 0.75x as much Frost Crystal instead of the same amount as crafting it directly in the inventory.
Refining the other 5 biome-specific crops (all except Frost Crystal) into Carbon now yields ~0.75x as much Carbon
Advanced Exocraft Laser unlock cost reduced ~0.7x
521.0.1: Re-paked for compatibility with NMS v5.21
522.0.1: (Cursed expedition) Reduced amount of Shattered Qualia required when crafting Elixirs to 0.2x, to balance how creatures only drop ~0.2x as much loot when killed in PTSd
525.0.1: Re-paked for compatibility with NMS v5.21
526.0.1: Re-paked for compatibility with NMS v5.26
528.0.1: Re-paked for compatibility with NMS v5.28
528.0.2: Greatly reduced the size, duration, and intensity of the impact effects and screen shake for the player's starship in first-person view during space combat to counteract the greatly increased enemy fire rate in PTSd (adjustable in the new "PTSd Reduced Ship Combat VFX.lua")
529.0.1: Added "HideCargo" toggle in "Space Combat+Larger Space BattlesX.lua" to change whether the content of Cargo Pods is hidden or displayed like in vanilla (Added in PTSd v525.0.1 but forgot to list in changelog)
558.0.1Alpha: This is still an "alpha" version, and so several existing/new features are not yet implemented, and proper bugtesting has not been done. Check the stickied Post for more details

Purple systems can now also be revealed & accessed earlier by taking a new item (Dissonant Compass) unlocked from Hyperion at the Space Anomaly to a Discordant Interface (which become available partway through the Artemis questline in PTSd), then purchasing the Atlantid Drive plans from Hyperion for 12,000 nanites. Revealing purple systems and learning the plans for the Atlantid Drive can instead still be done for free the vanilla way by fully completing the Artemis, Atlas, and Autophage questlines (although the Atlas questline takes much longer to complete in PTSd than vanilla).
Most new techs & products given harder crafting recipes in order to fit into PTSd's progression, requiring Atlas Seeds, new substances, etc.
Various existing products & techs which required the 6th Atlas Seed to craft now require substances found in Purple Systems such as Quartzite, Lithium, etc.
Heart of the Sun now requires Quartzite instead of Gold to craft
Exo-Skiff now requires a Nutrient Processor instead of Cadmium to craft, since it now has a built-in nutrient processor
Vile Queens no longer drop Hypnotic Eye since they now drop Vile Cortex with similar value
Unit value & refining recipes for new substances adjusted to PTSd standards
558.0.2Alpha: Planetary sentinels should now spawn with the PTSd adjusted amounts & types once again
Re-added the Dredging Laser to the unlock tree at the Space Anomaly after accidentally removing it
Adjusted position of Exocraft Summoning Unit in the unlock tree
Defeating a Deepsea Guardian now also awards ~4 Flesh Rope and ~10 Jellymeat each time
558.0.3: Gas Giants now have constant hazard effects of all kinds: high heat during the day or in storms, then freezing cold at night due to the different unmixed gases swirling around. There are also constant, low level toxins & radiation due to the types of gases in the air & the exotic materials being crushed. Unlike other planets, even being underground or in caves will still have a slight cold drain from trapped gases.

• In practice, this means that while you still may want to use a rechargeable hazard protection upgrade module for Heat & Cold for storms on gas giants or on extreme gas giants, it's also useful to have decent %-based hazard protection for Toxin & Radiation (since those hazards are weak enough that your base hazard protection will last a decent amount of time)

Adjusted the maximum strength of certain effects from the Nutrient Ingestor to be roughly in the ballpark of the strength of a single powerful upgrade module, as in vanilla some are extremely weak or overly strong.

• E.G. The max mining yield bonus effect and hazard protection effects reduced from +50% to +33%, the max sprint recovery effect increased from +6% to +60%, the max jetpack tank size effect reduced from +300% to +210%, etc.
Nutrient Ingestor only requires Cadmium instead of Emeril, and unlock price is reduced a further 0.5x
Base duration for holding breath underwater reduced to 0.67x (still a net 1.33x increase from pre-World Part II PTSd)
Procedural Underwater Hazard upgrade duration reduced to ~0.8x (still roughly 10% longer duration than pre-World Part II PTSd)

Since planets now have ~4-6 fewer plants to scan (hazardous plants & oxygen/sodium/deuterium plants are no longer scannable), the unit & nanite reward for scanning plants is now increased 1.33x. Also animals now reward ~1.5x more nanites for scanning.
The strength of procedural Exocraft Engine & Humboldt Drive upgrade modules follows a smoother progression from the lower to the higher classes
The max speed bonus from Humboldt Drive upgrade modules remains as strong as before Worlds Part II (~1.33x stronger than vanilla currently)
Increased chances of Lightning & Tornadoes on Gas Giants, some small tweaks to other new weather events such as slightly longer durations, etc.
Hopefully fixed issue of meteor strikes not occurring in PTSd
Refining Deuterium from Di-Hydrogen + Silicate Powder now requires 5x Silicate Powder
Changes to types/amounts of enemy starships in space are still missing (Enemy starships will still have PTSd stats, but spawn according to vanilla amounts & types)
558.0.4: Fixed some item names & descriptions missing from last version
Nautilon Float unlock cost increased 1.5x, and now requires Emeril to craft just like the Nautilon Platform

Heart of the Sun reverted to using Gold instead of Quartzite to craft (so that the Atlas path missionline can still be completed without visiting purple systems if choosing the vanilla method of accessing purple systems)
558.0.5: Sea Glass can now only be found at depths of 800u or below (~160u past the point where "Hyperpressure" is in effect), instead of at 220u or below to make it less accessible

Sea Glass value increased 1.2x, now replaces Gold Nuggets as a daily option to trade to Iteration Ares in the Anomaly for ~160 nanites each, and also has 3 new glass-related refining recipes, hinted at in its new description:
• Refine 2x alone to create Salvaged Glass
• Refine together with 2x Radiant Shards to create 2x Inverted Mirror
• Refine together with 3x Glass to create 3x Living Glass
Added hints to descriptions of other items that can be traded to Iteration Ares for nanites
Increased the richness of deep sea mineral deposits by a further 2x to better compete with late-game mineral extractors
Compared to vanilla, Nautilon Boost now lasts 0.8x as long and takes ~1.3x longer to recharge (Nautilon is still much faster overall in PTSd compared to vanilla)
The Nutrient Ingestor now costs 1.2x as much to unlock, but crafting it requires -2 less Lubricant, and requires 1 Heat Capacitor instead of Hot Ice
558.0.6: Fixed Iteration Ares still saying "Gold Nuggets" in their dialogue when actually offering to trade for Sea Glass

Starting a new Abandoned Mode save will begin with the recipes for all Atlas Seeds already known, since they otherwise may not be possible to obtain (Can use a Save Editor to teach the recipes for an existing Abandoned Mode save). The mod "gPlayer Unlock Purple Access﻿" can also be used in Abandoned Mode to grant access to purple systems

Due to how it was often cheaper to buy a smaller starship & then purchase inventory slots for it compared to buying a larger starship, and how purchasing the components to build an S Class starship would often be much cheaper than buying one of similar size, the pricing for buying both starships & starship inventory slots have been reworked from the ground up:

• Most types of starships should now generally follow the same basic pricing curve and use the same Class-based price multipliers, and so should always have the following relationships: Explorers & Solar ships cost 1x the "normal" price, Fighters cost ~1.15x more, Exotics cost ~1.2x more, and Haulers cost ~0.67x less on a per-slot basis at all Classes (Freighters cost ~3-4x more). Living Ship & Sentinel Interceptor values are unchanged as you cannot purchase them directly with units.

• Shuttles are a special exception, where at C Class and low inventory size they cost ~0.5x as much, but gradually lose their discount at higher Class & inventory size, to where the largest S Class Shuttle costs ~0.85x as much as "normal".

• Prices for specific starships may have gone up or down depending on the type, Class, & inventory size, but in general most of the smallest possible sized starships have increased in price by roughly ~1.5x while prices at larger sizes are very roughly similar.
• The "Small" size class for Shuttles, Fighters, Haulers, Explorers, and Solar ships has the max possible inventory size reduced by ~3-5 slots ("Medium" & "Large" ships of those types are unchanged)
• Solar ships can once again only be found "in the wild" with inventory sizes appropriate for a "Small" sized starship, like in vanilla

• The price to purchase additional inventory slots for starships has been slightly reduced for starship inventories already over ~50 slots (now slowly growing from ~20 million to ~70 million instead of quickly capping at 100 million previously), but has been significantly increased for smaller inventories under 50 slots, and especially under ~25 slots, now starting over ~1 million units at 16 slots.

• The end result is that it should now generally always be more expensive to buy a smaller starship and then purchase inventory slots for it compared to simply buying a larger starship of the same type & Class to begin with. For S Class ships, on average it should cost ~1.33x as much to obtain a larger starship through inventory expansion compared to buying a larger starship, and even more comparatively expensive at lower classes (costing ~4x as much at C Class).

• Additionally, with the cost of buying small starships increased (to break into components for ship-building) and the max size of "Small" starships reduced (most built starships are usually in the "Small" size category), the expected discount for building an S Class starship compared to buying one should be significantly less. And since the built starship will usually be "Small" in most cases, the money saved by building it will usually eventually be outweighed by the increased cost to purchase inventory slots to bring it up to the size of a "Medium" or "Large" starship.
Reduced nanite cost for starship Reactor Cores to ~0.5-0.2x, to better compete with the practical alternative of purchasing & salvaging a small starship of the matching Class.
The unique expedition reward "Pillar of Titan" staff multi-tool is now received at Class C with fewer inventory slots by default, like other unique expedition rewards

Made planets ~70% as likely to contain predators which hunt the player, and made the largest kind of player predators spawn in smaller groups / less frequently. Also slightly reduced vision range of both ground & water predators.

Most buildable objects for bases once again require a nearby base computer to be built first like in vanilla, instead of being freely buildable anywhere on planets. The BuildMostItemsWithoutBase toggle in "gBase Items BasicX.lua" can revert this back to previous behaviour.

Added note to description of Pulse Engine, Pulsing Heart, Launcher, and Neural Assembly upgrade modules explaining that the actual Boost Speed bonus is greater than the UI displays. Also adds note that Neural Assembly upgrade modules in PTSd improve Boost Speed

Correction to earlier patch notes: You actually can use the Quick Menu to recharge all kinds of rechargeable hazard protection upgrade modules on Gas Giants, it's just that the game only lets you select the type of hazard protection which is currently lowest. However, it will still be more economical to rely on periodically recharging you base Hazard Protection instead of the special Toxic or Radiation protection modules on Gas Giants since you'll only need to recharge a single tech instead of two, and they drain much slower than Hot/Cold hazard protection there.
558.0.7: Fixed Golden Vector & Starborn Phoenix starships not always being awarded at C Class with a small inventory by default like other unique expedition reward starships

Unique expedition reward starships now each have their own cost of 4~8 million units to redeem instead of ~1,400 nanites, with the price roughly matching the cost of buying a "regular" version of the same type of starship at that size & Class C. There may still be the vanilla issue where redeeming an expedition ship will be free on the same save slot that you recently completed that expedition and/or already received the expedition version of the ship. (Note that with the recent changes to starship & slot pricing, like any other small starships the expedition reward starships will require investing a significant amount of units to increase their inventory size compared to buying a larger "wild" starship)

The description when redeeming unique expedition starships now notes that you can delete all the pre-installed upgrades if you want to use the starship without affecting game balance/progression (with a special note for the Wraith living ship being on the honor system not to sequence-break visiting Red/Green/Blue stars before obtaining the relevant hyperdrives). Redeeming unique expedition multi-tools gives a similar note, as well as suggesting to trade in a non-Pistol, non-Rifle multi-tool to claim it (as redeeming tools does not have a cost like redeeming ships does).

The % chances for finding S Class starships in Poor/Average/Wealthy/Outlaw systems has been changed from 0%/2%/3%/5% to 1%/1.5%/2.25%/3.4% for a more even distribution. Chances for finding C/B/A Class starships have also been adjusted slightly to progress a little smoother between the different systems levels. (Changes are at the top of "PTSd Ship+MultiTool Rebalance.lua")
561.0.1: Adjusted bonuses from foods in the Nutrient Ingestor again as after further testing in practice they do not actually behave as the UI indicates. The bonuses are actually multiplicative instead of additive despite what the UI shows (which means some of the "bonuses" actually reduced the relevant stat), but also seem to be applied to each tech/upgrade module individually. So for inherently multiplicative stats such as Mining Speed/Yield or Hot/Cold/Rad/Tox Hazard Protection etc. the final bonus becomes exponentially stronger the more tech/upgrade modules with the relevant stat are installed.

• The absolute effect of the Ingestor bonuses always increases the more relevant tech/upgrades you install, unlike most standard upgrade modules. For additive stats this will be a significant %-based improvement no matter how many techs/upgrades are installed, but for multiplicative stats this can range from being small improvements when starting out to very large buffs once you have many relevant techs/upgrades installed.

• Overall it can now be thought of as a "super upgrade module" that should generally give bonuses significantly larger than a single maxed X Class upgrade (assuming you're using high quality food and you've already installed many upgrades) which you can also flexibly change to match the current situation.
• Adjusted description for nutrient ingestor to note how bonuses are actually multiplicative and can increase exponentially with # of installed upgrades for certain bonuses

Gas Giants now spawn a larger variety of vacant buildings such as Plaques, Monoliths, Ruins, etc., and have a higher density of crashed starships/freighters and Damaged Machinery than regular planets (due to vessels getting pulled in by the strong gravity) to make them more rewarding to explore.

Vigilant Stone value increased ~1.6x, but they are no longer received from disturbing Vigilant Eyes directly, instead Mech/Floating Golems have a chance to drop them on defeat. Vigilant Eyes now award some Polished Stone instead.
Increased health, damage, knockback, and other combat stats of new golem / animated stone enemies. Also increased damage from the explosions of small "spider" corrupted quadruped sentinels

Fossil value increased by 1.5x on average and now varies slightly by category, in order of most to least valuable: Skull, Ribcage, Limbs, Tail. While this won't affect the average value of a dig site, it's enough to make the Limbs & Tails worth cooking, while Skulls & Ribcages lose value when cooked.
• Packaged Exhibits are currently a bit more valuable than I'd like as I haven't yet found a way to alter their value, so currently their description heavily discourages selling them.

Since the average value of Ancient Bones sites are now much more consistent without Common/Uncommon/Rare varieties of bones (only really varying based on number of bones at each site), Salvageable Scrap has been adjusted to take over its role as the POI with highly variable profits.

Salvageable Scrap sites now have a chance to drop additional procedural Scrap items from each of the Protective Casings surrounding the Scrap core, so each site should on average have around ~2 Scrap items. While the value of Common & Uncommon Scrap items has been reduced, the value of Rare Scrap items has been increased. This means that compared to Ancient Bones sites, Scrap sites will on average give more profit per minute, but only if you visit enough Scrap sites to start getting some of the Rare Scrap items. However, taking the time to defeat Ancient Golems at Ancient Bones sites for Vigilant Stones can potentially increase their profits/minute depending on how quickly you can defeat them.
The new small boxes in Abandoned Stations now always use their own lootpool instead of sometimes having the same loot as the Abandoned Mode version of Crashed Freighter Containers.

Reduced the chances of finding very valuable items in the new loot boxes on Abandoned Stations such as upgrade modules, Emergency Signal Scanners, inventory expansion items, etc. In exchange, these boxes can now contain a wider variety of generally useful items such as Repair Kits, Larval Cores, Navigation Data, etc.

In Abandoned Mode, Buried Caches & Crashed Freighter Containers are both less likely to contain inventory expansion items, and Crashed Freighter Containers are now more likely to contain the more valuable items such as Emergency Signal Scanners, higher Class upgrade modules, inventory expansion items, etc. compared to Buried Caches.

Re-ordered which Atlas Seeds require which substances to craft, so that anytime a new color of star system becomes accessible, crafting the next Atlas Seed requires stellar metal from that color star (except for purple stars). This should allow fewer techs/items to be crafted "out of sequence" in Abandoned Mode where all Atlas Seed recipes are unlocked from the start in PTSd.
Living Ships can still install standard Teleport Receivers in PTSd, but the new Grasping Tendrils tech now gives them an even longer teleport range than standard starships
Removed alternative recipe for Bone Broth using 2x Softened Marrow, as in PTSd this always loses value

Refined Flour's CookingValue lowered from 1.8 to 0.18 as presumably this was a typo in vanilla (all other CookingValues are 1.0 or less). This affects both the nanites Cronus awards for it and also the strength of its Nutrient Ingestor bonus
Reduced the efficiency of refining Polished Stone into Pure Ferrite. Still refines into more Pure Ferrite than Ferrite Dust, buy yield reduced to 0.75x and takes 1.5x as long.
Fixed what is presumably a vanilla typo that scrambled the strengths of Power/Mineral/Gas hotspots in one of the recent NMS update
561.0.2: Disturbing Vigilant Eyes is less likely to spawn the floating Living Stones compared to the Golem Mechs, always spawns at least 2 when it spawns the Living Stones, and can now sometimes spawn the Golem & Living Stones together. This also indirectly slightly increases the yield of Vigilant Stones, as Golems are now even more likely to drop 1 or more Vigilant Stones compared to the floating Living Stones.

Memory Stones now each require 64 Polished Stone to access, so that the amount of nanites per minute you can earn from them will increase as your mining & travel speed increases over the game (interaction description now lets the player know they can yield nanites).

Ruins now yield ~0.3x as much Polished Stone as before, as they weren't previously receiving the same adjustments PTSd makes to other minable objects, and in vanilla they yield double what other similar rocks yield.
The reusable fossil exhibit stations for assembling other fossils now require 50 Polished Stone instead of 25 Pure Ferrite to build. (Guide entry on assembling fossils now mentions this)

All other types of decorative exhibits & fossils had a hidden cost of 25 Pure Ferrite to build in vanilla (even when placing individual bones with no mount), which was not refunded when removing / deleting the exhibit/fossil. Those hidden costs have been removed.

Since the new Living Ship Tech Grasping Tendrils stacks additively with Teleport Receiver, they now have the same distance bonus (so installing both will double the teleport distance), tech description updated to make this clear
Bonus Mining Yield during Radiation Storms further reduced from 1.9x to 1.75x
Reduced Chlorine yield of Organic Rocks to ~0.75x
Improved formatting of new description for fossil exhibits
Fixed a formatting error with the description of the PTSd-added Dissonant Compass

Newly recommended mod: Natural Nights (no merging required). Makes nighttime noticeably darker, to the point that it adds a bit of challenge to navigation and makes your torch / exocraft headlights more useful.
562.0.1: Decreased cost to use Memory Stones from 64 to 32 Polished Stone
Decreased health of Living Stones and "mech" Golems to 0.8x
Increased the cost to purchase inventory slots for Multi-Tools in the 7-15 slot range by roughly ~1.5x on average

Reduced slots on starting Multi-Tool from 8 to 6, and added an initial damaged slot with a special description that explains that the starting Multi-Tool is weak and can never have Damage/Mining/Scanning stat bonuses like all other multi-tools can. (This is also true in vanilla)

The "Mud Hut' and "Ragged Tent" base building objects can once again be built on planets outside of player bases by default (as they could in earlier versions of PTSd alongside most decorative base building objects). Since they are a faster & more convenient method of sheltering from hazards than tunneling underground or creating a roof with the Terrain Editor, in exchange they now have more complex crafting recipes requiring multiple easy to get items such as Marrow Bulbs or Star Silk. This means relying on them requires dedicating some inventory slots to holding their ingredients as a tradeoff. Can be toggled off at the top of gBase Items BasicX.lua
562.0.2: New Abandoned Mode saves will start with you knowing the recipe for an Abandoned Mode-only Exosuit tech, Discordant Key, which while installed grants access to Discordant Interfaces at Korvax Monoliths to obtain Atlantid Multi-Tools. For existing Abandoned Mode saves, the next Buried Cache or Crashed Freighter Cargo Pod Container you open should contain the recipe. The Discordant Key requires a Korvax Casing, Living Glass, and some Polished Stone so it won't be buildable right away.

Most Exocraft weapons now have a 1.44x slower firerate but 1.44x higher damage & charge consumption to compensate, ending with the same overall DPS & charge usage rate as before (once supercharged). Flamethrowers were left with high firerate due to the special way they deal damage. This is a correction to how previously PTSd was unintentionally increasing their firerate due to exocraft weapons applying firerate bonuses from supercharged slots differently than other weapons.

• For the Minotaur Cannon the base damage was increased and firerate decreased a further 1.25x, as a way to further increase the Minotaur Cannon DPS when used by the AI -piloted Minotaur (the AI-pilot fires at a set low firerate, so it benefits from increased base damage but is not affect by firerate changes)

Increased Cobalt & Ferrite Dust cost to craft Ion Batteries 2x, reduced yield from Sodium Plants to ~0.93x, but also reduced Sodium / Sodium Nitrate cost to recharge the base Hazard Protection tech to 0.75x. The refining recipe to make Ion Batteries also had its costs increased ~1.3x, but is now 3x faster. Now options other than always directly crafting Ion Batteries by hand should be a little more worth considering.
Reduced yield from Oxygen Plants to ~0.75x
Increased price of Pistol Multi-Tools ~2x (should still be significantly cheaper than other multi-tools)
Cargo slots for the starting starship on new saves reduced from 8 to 7
Fixed issue where the new informative damaged slot on the starter multi-tool on new saves couldn't be removed.
Added some more notes to the description for the Abandoned Mode and Hyperdrive System Access difficulty settings to explain how they work with PTSd.
563.0.1: Memory Stones once again require 64 Polished Stone to use, but now after learning all Ruins blueprints instead of awarding ~150 nanites, there is a 50/50 chance to either award ~350 nanites or a random procedural Loot treasure worth ~400,000 units on average. This puts them roughly in the ballpark of activities like collecting Ancient Bones or Salvageable Scrap, but yielding less units as a tradeoff for a decent amount of nanites, scaling with your mining speed. (The procedural Loot treasure appears intended to be the reward in vanilla also, but seems to not work properly with the vanilla settings)

The loot from the small boxes in Abandoned space stations is now adjusted between Abandoned Mode and "regular" mode, with some of the higher value items such as Emergency Signal Scanner less likely to be found outside of Abandoned Mode. The droprate for all inventory expansion items from Abandoned Stations or Abandoned Mode Buried Caches / Crashed Freighters has also been further reduced.

Abandoned Mode no longer starts with all Atlas Seed or Discordant Key recipes known by default. Instead, opening some of the small boxes in Abandoned space stations in Abandoned Mode should teach you the Discordant Key recipe, and then has a small chance to teach you the next unknown Atlas Seed recipe, in order from 1 - 10 (Atlas Seed descriptions now note this). On average you should learn one for every ~5 stations you visit & loot, so on average it will require visiting around ~50 Abandoned Stations to learn all 10 Atlas Seed recipes in Abandoned Mode (The first 6 Atlas Seeds are all that are required for the vast majority of tech/recipes in PTSd).

The boxes in Abandoned Stations might "remember" that you've already opened them for longer, making it harder to repeatedly loot them instead of visiting new systems (difficult to test to confirm this)

You can now learn the "by hand" Creature Pellet recipe in Abandoned Mode from either the next Buried Cache or Abandoned Station box you open if not yet known, or unlocked from the base building unlock tree in the Construction Research Unit/Station (the Nutrient Processor recipes are still more efficient)
Exosuit Expansion Units found in stations and Buried Caches in Abandoned Mode (but not Crashed Freighter Containers) now replaced with Exosuit Upgrade Charts

The Nomad's "hangtime"/floatiness and ability to steer while airborne increased even further, and Pilgrim's "hangtime" decreased even more to widen the differences between them even greater (slight reduction for Roamer's "hangtime" as well to remain roughly in the middle). Thus Nomad leans even harder into the "spend as much time airborne as possible" theme as a hovercraft, while the Pilgrim should "hug the ground" more often and drop back down from jumps even quicker to make good use of its high groundspeed.
Sea Glass added to the list of items which can be refined together with Microprocessors to create Salvaged Data (Sea Glass item description updated accordingly)
Nutrient Ingestor now requires Frost Crystals instead of Heat Capacitor and Cadmium, making it possible to use early-game even before the Nutrient Processor.
"Exploding gas plant" Hazardous Flora on planet surfaces have their explosion AOE radius increased 1.33x, and the extra Oxygen yield from harvesting their Gassy Pods reduced to 0.4x
Most .lua files in download .zip formatted for use with public version of AMUMSS (although some .lua files will still not work, check POSTS page)
564.0.1: Adjusted the yields and chances for different Asteroid resources, such as larger amounts of Silver & Gold directly, fewer Gold Nuggets, etc. Overall when opening all Hyperclusters & Nuggets the result is that on average you should get about 0.8x as much Tritium, ~1.5x as much Silver, ~1.3x as much Platinum, and roughly the same Gold. Thus you should now actually get more Silver than Gold from asteroids.

Chances for a system to be filled with Platinum asteroids decreased ~0.4x in Red systems, increased 2x & 1.5x in Green & Blue systems so that the chance always increases with higher-tier system colour
Added refining recipe to refine Vortex Cubes into 12 Silver (item description now notes this)
Gold / Sodium Nitrate yield for refining Living Pearls / Crystal Sulphide reduced to ~0.55x
Rocket Boots tech now requires Cadmium
Nutrient Ingestor now requires Dioxite instead of Frost Crystal, so that it no longer is locked behind Cadmium (Cadmium is required for Haz-Mat Gauntlets needed to harvest Frost Crystal)
Emergency Warp Unit now requires 160 Silver instead of 220 Gold and 4x the Warp Cells to install, so that the ingredients to install/repair it are more accessible in the early game.
Lost Angler's Rig now requires 2x Salt, and 8 Living Pearls instead of Silver
Oxygen Rerouter unlock cost decreased to ~0.75x, the four individual %-based hazard protection techs (Coolant Network, etc.) unlock cost increased 1.5x

Most "non-functional" base building (e.g. stairs, prefab rooms/corridors, etc.) or decorative (e.g. posters, "clutter" items, etc.) items which had unlock costs of 3~10 Salvaged Data are reduced down to 1~2 Salvaged Data, so that decorating your base does not compete so much with unlocking utility items with special functionality, as those all have greatly increased prices in PTSd.
All types of "Skylight" Roof panels now require Glass in place of Ferrite Dust to build

Cost to claim expedition reward Hauler starship "Iron Vulture"  raised to 6 million units to match most of the others, starting cargo slots increased to fit the new price. (Starting cargo slots of the Wraith also slightly increased)
Purchase price for Ion Batteries, Di-hydrogen Gel, Projectile Ammo increased 1.5x, Life Support Gel increased ~3x

Most difficult presets now default to the "Standard" level for "Goods Availability" instead of "Abundant". Which items are restricted on which level slightly adjusted, setting description now notes which items are restricted on each level
Updated in-game descriptions for the various crop-growing buildings/rooms to note their relative strengths
Updated some in-game difficulty setting descriptions, particularly for the Abandoned Mode setting to reflect the recent PTSd changes to Abandoned Mode
564.0.2: Increases to the number of enemy starship spawned in space encounters / battles (which weren't working since the Worlds Part II update) are now functioning again

The value of all "geode" type items (Geodes, Gold Nuggets, Glowing Minerals, Crystal Fragments, Tritium Hyperclusters) increased by a further 1.5x ~ 3x to make them more worth the trouble of gathering/selling. Their default stacksize however is decreased from 25 to 15
The amount of nanites that iteration Ares on the Anomaly exchanges for the their daily item "bounty" increased by a further ~1.5x to make them more worthwhile
The "black orbs" on pedestals in the first few Atlas Stations on the Atlas Path missions now yield Antimatter instead of Warp Cells
The biome-specific farmable plants such as Cactus Flesh refine into ~0.85x as much Carbon and take 1.4x as long per refining process
Autonomous Mining Units require 3x Ion Batteries to build
All redeemed expedition or Twitch reward starships now come with their Hyperdrive completely uncharged like when buying/finding a regular starship, instead of coming fully-charged.
Slight changes to the values of the "Challenging"/"Expensive" level of several Difficulty Settings such as Damage Levels, Enemy Strength, & Currency Cost (their descriptions updated to reflect this)

The "Survival" difficulty preset now defaults to the "Standard" level for "On-Foot Combat" instead of "Hostile" (Note that like in vanilla, changing between "Hostile" and "Standard" can also change which planets have Low, High, or Aggressive Sentinels, particularly for Lush planets.)
564.0.3: Corrected Vortex Cubes accidentally refining into Gold instead of Silver in previous release, and increased their refining time 2x
Corrected the "black orbs" in Atlas Stations accidentally having no reward instead of Antimatter in previous release, and gave them a 50% chance to give 80 nanites instead of Antimatter
Corrected giving the wrong strength to certain B Class Mineral hotspots

Increased the bonus to Pulse Jump speed for Sub-Light Amplifier, Solar ship's Vesper Sail, and Living Ship's Pulsing Heart by ~1.25x. Pulsing Heart description now notes that it has higher Pulse Jump speed than standard Pulse Engines (if not using Sub-Light Amplifier).
Sub-Light Amplifier now requires Cadmium to install
Phosphorus is now only 0.6x as effective at recharging the Mining Laser / Hijacked Laser / Runic Lens

Units price of most craftable "component" products such as Hermetic Seal, Solar Mirror, etc. increased a further 2x to better incentivize crafting them instead (Microprocessor purchase price only increased ~1.3x).
564.0.4: The freighter techs which boost hyperdrive distance reverted back to requiring Antimatter Housing instead of mistakenly requiring the 3rd/5th/7th Atlas Seeds
The freighter techs which grant access to different color star systems now require the 2nd/4th/6th/7th Atlas Seed in place of Cadmium/Emeril/Indium/8th Atlas Seed, and 2x Warp Cores
Economy, Conflict, & Interstellar Scanners now require Cadmium to install and Economy Scanners are even more rare to find pre-installed in starships.
Conflict & Interstellar Scanners now require 2 Quad Servos instead of a Walker Brain. Interstellar Scanner now requires 2 Pirate Transponders in place of Wiring Looms.
Colossus Geobay now requires Silver in place of Paraffinium so that it can't be built with the same items required for the Roamer Geobay
Orbital Exocraft Materialiser freighter room unlock cost reduced to 0.5x, now requires Dark Matter (the 4th Atlas Seed) in place of Indium, and Teleport Coordinators in place of Portable Reactors
Exocraft Summoning Unit tech now requires 3 Portable Reactors in place of Crystallised Helium
Exocraft Summoning Station deployable unlock cost reduced from 24 to 15 Salvaged Data
Atlantid Drive now requires Atlantideum in place of Indium (Indium is still required for the Photic Jade component)
Antimatter Reactor now costs 0.8x as much to unlock and requires Dark Matter (the 4th Atlas Seed) in place of Dawn's End (the 5th Atlas Seed)

Nutrient Ingestor now requires Amino Chamber & Salt in place of Lubricant & Dioxite, to make it easier to install earlier (Lubricant requires Gamma Root, which requires Haz-Mat Gauntlets to harvest unless buying off pilots, which requires Cadmium)
9 recipes for making cookies using Sugar Dough + a farmable crop had the amount of farmable crop increased 5x or 25x to match similar PTSd recipes
Slightly increased crafting requirements for Mud Hut and slightly reduced requirements for Ragged Tent
Dioxite is now 0.6x as effective at recharging Life Support
Sea Glass yields 1.25x more Salvaged Data when refined together with Microprocessors, to go with its recently increased nanite value when exchanged with iteration Ares.
Bonus to Damage increased ~1.06x for Fighters, 1.15x for Sentinel Interceptors
Bonus to Shields increased 1.25x for Shuttles, ~1.25x for Solar ships, and ~1.3x for Living Ships to compensate more for their low maneuverability
Sentinel Cannon's description now notes how it can surpass the DPS of the Photon Cannon with enough upgrades
Solar ship's Vesper Sail description now points out that its slight reduction in Boost speed is worse when supercharged
Hijacked Laser & Runic Lens descriptions now note their special traits compared to standard Mining Lasers in PTSd
Mining / Scanning upgrade module descriptions now note that substance yield / Scan value is affected by the Multi-Tool's Mining / Scanning stat bonus
564.0.5: Fixed formatting error for Antimatter Reactor's ingredient changes in previous release
Exocraft Summoning Station deployable requires the 2nd Atlas Seed in place of Emeril
Cost to use Freighter Scanner Room decreased from 3 to 2 Navigation Data
564.0.6: Upgrade modules for the Minotaur flamethrower can now be installed on any exocraft, not just the Minotaur (upgrade module & tech descriptions adjusted to note this).
Exocraft Mounted Flamethrower now requires ~2x the Basalt and Methane to install, and fire rate decreased to 0.75x to make it less powerful than the Minotaur version.

Selecting the "Normal" game mode or difficulty Preset (or entering Expedition mode) no longer has a hidden effect which uses the "Discounted" level of Launch Costs for the "Standard" "Fuel Usage" setting until changing the "Fuel Usage" setting. The "Fuel Usage" setting should now always accurately reflect the actual in-game effects in every case.
The Launch Costs for the "Discounted" level of the "Fuel Usage" difficulty setting increased ~1.5x (still allows ~3 times as many launches per refuel as "Standard")

The launch cost for Solar ships increased from 66% to 75% of the standard cost (still allows 3 launches by default or 4 with the Efficient Thrusters tech, like before), as unlike Shuttles or Explorers they can supercharge their Vesper Sail tech to further reduce launch cost

The "Fuel Usage" in-game difficulty description now lists info on the default amount of starship launches for the different levels, as well as starship summon costs, and the launch discounts that starships types like Explorer, etc. have

The descriptions for the Launch Thruster, Neural Assembly, and Efficient Thrusters techs now give more info related to launching, such as how supercharging the core Launcher tech increases launch costs, summoning costs double normal launch cost, Efficient Thrusters on its own generally adding at least 1 more launch per refuel, the inherent launch discounts for different types of starships, etc. (Anti-Gravity Well description appears hardcoded and unable to be changed)

The descriptions for the Launch Thruster, Pulse Engine, Deflector Shield, Scream Suppressor, Aeron Shield, Mining Laser, Hijacked Laser, and Runic Lens techs now accurately list all possible substances / products that can be used to recharge them

The descriptions for the Photon Cannon, Sentinel Cannon, and Spewing Vents techs now all note that they have a high critical damage multiplier, are easy to aim, and are equally effective against both Shields and Hulls (similar notes added for Rocket Launcher). Sentinel Cannon & Spewing Vents also note how they are more powerful than the Photon Cannon
The description for the "informative" broken slot on the starting Multi-Tool now notes which types of Multi-Tools have especially high bonuses to Damage, Mining, and Scanning
Edited some other item/tech/setting descriptions for clarity
564.0.7: Shortened the names of several module folders & .lua files to make it easier to extract them from the .zip file on systems using longer directories.
For those editing / merging .lua files, they should now all work properly as-is with the latest public version of AMUMSS
Corrected formatting error in Minotaur/Exocraft Flamethrower upgrade module descriptions
Purchase price for higher-Class Minotaur/Exocraft Flamethrower upgrade modules increased to match PTSd baseline
Large Refiner & Refiner Room now require Emeril to build (this indirectly makes the Colossus' Mineral Processing Rig more appealing as it can be acquired earlier in a playthrough)
Further increased Echo Locator droprate from large corrupted Arachnid / Spider sentinels by ~1.8x and reduced droprate from Dissonance Resonators to 0.8x
Pilgrim Geobay Salvaged Data unlock cost reduced to 0.8x, Nautilon Chamber cost increased ~1.13x
Chance for jellyfish to spawn when mining underwater objects reduced a further 0.75x
Certain outlier underwater plants & minerals no longer give incredibly large (4x-10x more than other similar plants / minerals) amounts of their secondary substance like in vanilla
Medium Salt-bearing underwater rocks yield ~0.8x as much substances, large Chlorine-bearing underwater rocks yield 1.5x as much substances
Hazardous gas plants in caves yield ~1.25x more Sodium/Oxygen

Normalized some of the hazard strengths on different planets to be more consistent between different biomes, especially for Extreme planets and in shallow/deep water. This is the new way that each biome differs from the baseline hazard strengths (slightly changed from vanilla):
• Storms & Deep water on all planets, and non-Storm surface weather on Extreme planets have had their base intensity reduced to ~0.92x
• Cold planets have slightly milder daytime temperatures compared to the baseline, but slightly harsher nighttime temperatures and even harsher underwater temperatures

• Hot planets are the opposite. While shallow water on non-Extreme Hot planets still provides total protection from the heat, Deep water & Extreme Hot planets now only get significant heat protection from being underwater instead of total.

• Radioactive planets now have milder hazards underwater (less mild than Hot planets) and Toxic planets have harsher underwater hazards (even harsher than Cold planets). This is opposite to how vanilla works, since water is an excellent method of blocking harmful radiation in real life, and water/liquids are a famous method of conveying toxic/corrosive chemicals, so the vanilla behavior felt counter-intuitive
• Compared to the previous version, Gas Giants have harsher underwater temperature hazards, and Extreme Gas Giants have slightly harsher Toxic/Radiation hazards in all situations
Descriptions for broken slots on starships or Sentinel Multi-Tools now note that inspecting them may reveal additional Recycled Circuitry required to repair them
Descriptions for all the different Exocraft Geobays now note their relative strengths, weakness, and special features

Descriptions for the core Hazard Protection tech and all exocraft geobays now note the vanilla effect that all exocraft cockpits provide some hazard protection, tripling hazard survival time (or total hazard protection for Minotaur & Nautilon). Core Hazard Protection tech description now also notes that Ion Batteries can be used to recharge it
Descriptions for the Exocraft, Minotaur, and Nautilon Cannon techs now note the vanilla effect that the explosive AOE of the shots in close quarters can kill the player

Descriptions for the Exocraft Radar and Basic Sonar now note they can reveal additional nearby POIs with a scan pulse in addition to targeting specific buildings from the quick menu, like the Minotaur Radar tech description already notes
564.0.8: Nutrient Ingestor effects largely reworked (with updated in-game description), as with further testing I've discovered that the vanilla version's glitches still result in preposterously large bonuses when using buffed tech/upgrades in supercharged slots (especially for "multiplicative" stats), regardless of how much I've reduced the food buffs themselves
• Nutrient Ingestor bonuses no longer apply to all tech / upgrade modules with the relevant stat, but only to ones in supercharged slots with the relevant stat

• The strength of the bonus is now always ~1.83x (~+83%) applied multiplicatively to the relevant stat within the tech/upgrade module in the supercharged slot, on top of the usual supercharged slot bonus (regardless of food quality).

• Most Nutrient Ingestor bonuses to "multiplicative" stats have been replaced with bonuses  to "additive" stats that affect something similar, if possible. E.G. The Mining Speed & Resources Mined bonuses have been replaced with a bonus to Exocraft Mining Laser Power, etc. Notably, Breathing Efficiency bonuses are replaced with Exocraft Boost Tank Size bonuses.
• All Nutrient Ingestor buff durations reduced to 0.5x

• While unfortunately this is more restrictive than the vanilla implementation, it offers some interesting choices for supercharging certain techs / upgrades which normally don't benefit as much from being supercharged. It's also nice that it becomes more powerful the more supercharged slots you have access to, and gaining the maximum benefit from it requires you to potentially miss out on supercharging other techs/upgrades you would normally put in the supercharged slots.
Iced Screams and Syrupy Viscera now give a bonus to Words Translated in the Nutrient Ingestor, like most other foods cooked with Hypnotic Eyes

Exocraft Mining Laser & Minotaur Laser base damage increased ~1.22x & 1.12x, and all Exocraft & Minotaur Mining Laser upgrade modules had their Mining Power bonus increased a further 3x to allow them to remain competitive with Multi-Tool mining rates for longer. While the best, maxed out Multi-Tool can still obtain substances faster, the new Nutrient Ingestor bonuses to Exocraft Laser Power are enough to temporarily bring Exocraft mining rates much closer.

Precision Minotaur Laser and Minotaur Laser upgrade modules have their damage bonuses increased a further 1.25x so that the Minotaur Laser always remains ~1.15x stronger than the Exocraft Mining Laser with matching upgrades

As the Minotaur Mining Laser now gains much more damage from upgrade modules and can also benefit from Nutrient Ingestor bonuses to Exocraft Laser Power, the Hardframe Left Arm tech only provides a 2.5x Mining Laser damage bonus to stunned targets instead of 5x

Tethys Beam base damage reduced to ~0.93x and no longer can mine "difficult" minerals by default, but now has an unlockable Advanced Tethys Beam tech like the Exocraft/Minotaur Mining Lasers which enables this and further improves mining power even more
Minotaur Laser and Tethys Beam tech descriptions note their increased power relative to the Exocraft Mining Laser
The Mining Speed bonuses on Mining Laser upgrade modules follow a smoother progression from Class C to Class S/X
B Class Exocraft Boost upgrade modules will no longer have a chance to give a smaller bonus to Boost Tank size than C Class upgrade modules
Supercharging the Scanner multi-tool tech now makes it recharge faster instead of slower, unlike vanilla
Liquidator Body tech requires 1 less Walker Brain but 1 more Recycled Circuitry to install
The Minimal/Hostile levels for the Space Combat Difficulty Setting now adjust enemy health in space to 66%/133% instead of 80%/120%

Added more details to various Difficulty Setting descriptions such as all of the different Combat Settings, Damage Levels, Survival Difficulty, etc. to note the importance of things like supercharging weapon techs and give some basic tips.
PTSd-added technologies and items, such as the Advanced Tethys Beam, Minotaur Ultra Radar Array, Discordant Key, etc. now appear in the in-game Catalogue
564.0.9: Corrected a formatting issue since the Worlds Part II update which was causing the value of scanning or discovering fauna, flora, minerals, systems, planets, & waypoints to get multiplied multiple times, making some scanning units rewards smaller and some discovery nanites rewards much larger than intended. (Notably, waypoint discoveries were giving 12x more nanites than intended) On top of this, the nanites for all types of discoveries besides fauna (they already have a huge nanite reward for discovering all fauna on a planet) have all been increased ~1.5x - 2.5x from their previously intended values, as well as waypoints giving 3x the nanites directly from activating them.

All planetary creatures now have a small chance to be found only in the North/South hemisphere. Most planets should now have 1~2 creatures on average which are only found in the North/South hemisphere.

Many more varieties of planetary creatures are either nocturnal/diurnal or mostly active during the night/day, with "Always Active" creatures now being in the minority. Some slight patterns with things like glowing creatures or predators being more likely to be active at night, plant-creatures being more likely to be active during the day, etc.

These 2 above changes not only make the creature you see vary more with your location & time of day, but should also make completing the full fauna discovery nanite bonus for the huge nanite reward require a bit more time & effort than just landing in one spot and scanning for ~30 seconds. This also indirectly makes it a bit harder to find a planet with a convenient variety of creatures you can gather at the same location & time to harvest a particular combination of cooking ingredients from. Neither change should affect creature generation / sync with vanilla discovery data, etc. but just in case, both sets of changes can be toggled off at the top of "PTSd Creature Loot Changes.lua". Alternatively, deleting all folders & files besides "CREATUREPETBEHAVIOURTABLE.MBIN" in MODS\PTSd Incoming Damage and Predators\METADATA\SIMULATION\ECOSYSTEM will disable these changes.

Newly recommended mod, "gCreatures Underground Creature Fix", 3x version. Makes it far more reliable to spawn & find rare/uncommon underground creatures to complete fauna discovery bonuses, offsetting how PTSd now requires more effort overall to discover all fauna on a planet.

Predators which are hostile to the player (including underwater sharks in PTSd) are now mostly active at night, so should be encountered less frequently during the day. In exchange, predators found on planets are now ~1.2x more likely to be hostile to the player.

Foods which restored between 1~3 health when consumed directly (most raw meat, most small cooked fish, etc.) now only restore 1 health. Foods which restored 3 health when consumed directly (certain more complicated dishes, most larger cooked fish, etc.) now restore 2 health.
Most raw meat and small cooked fish now note in their description that they can be consumed directly to restore some health.

In-game guides and tooltips should now note that you can have up to 5 copies of the same type of upgrade module installed, instead of vanilla's limit of 3. Several Difficulty Setting descriptions now mention PTSd's 5 upgrade module limit, and how it allows for more adjacency bonuses

Procedural Hazard Protection upgrade modules which provide a fixed duration of protection (including underwater breathing) now note in their description that there is little benefit to installing multiple copies as they each need to be recharged individually.

Edited descriptions of various buildings like Exocraft Geobays or automated harvesters for clarity. Also clarified that the Exocraft Summoning Station works across any distance, including other star systems.
Scanner Recharge Difficulty Setting description notes more details about the actual functions of the Exosuit, Starship, and Exocraft scanners
Damage Difficulty Setting now notes that like in vanilla, Exosuit health does not automatically regenerate. Various other Difficulty Setting descriptions edited for clarity
The descriptions for Sticky 'Honey', Synthetic Honey, and Syrupy Nectar now note that they add significant value to foods cooked with them
564.0.10: Corrected making Waypoints give 30 Navigation Data instead of 30 nanites in previous version
In-game Options Menu now notes that the Difficulty page also contains useful info for PTSd
Predators Difficulty Setting description now notes how predators are more active at night in PTSd
572.0.1: Very roughly increased production rates of most Settlement products and substances, especially for Gek settlements
Settlements produce Di-hydrogen and Tritium instead of Launch Fuel and Frigate Fuel
Added more produceable products/substances unique to each settlement race, roughly matching the previous PTSd race-specific items
Settlement "Expeditions" no longer always increase the settlement population, but are now much less likely to fail (5% chance instead of 30% chance)
572.0.2: Added more items which can be produced by all settlements, such as all settlements being able to produce ~300,000 units/day worth of Trade Goods from the start, or Oxygen as an option from Industrial buildings

Added more race-specific settlement production options, both available from the start or from Entertainment/Bar buildings. In particular, each race should now have a method of generating nanites (Refining Inverted Mirrors / Radiant Shards for Autophage, direct Nanites for Korvax, selling upgrade modules from Salvaged Glass for Vy'keen, donating cakes/pies to Cronus for Gek)
Changed which Trade Goods are available from settlements slightly so that items which are required by some PTSd recipes, such as Star Silk, Autonomous Positioning Unit, etc. are possible options.
Replaced certain production options, such as Warp Cells with Antimatter, or Geknip with NipNip Buds

Greatly increased the production rate of Trade Goods, so now having 4 top-tier settlements can result in ~4.8 million units worth of Trade Goods per day (~1.33x as many units per day as a single pre-Beacon PTSd settlement). Gek settlements can reach a further ~1.5x as many units per day on top of this, compared to other settlements.

Crafting ingredient Products from Industrial buildings such as Enriched Carbon, Semiconductor, etc. have production rates that make them only 0.4x~0.7x as profitable as Trade Goods if sold directly, but 1.6x~1.3x as profitable as Trade Goods if you have the resources to "upgrade" them at least one step further in the crafting tree (even after accounting for the value of the resources needed) before selling them. E.G. Combing the Enriched Carbon with Nitrogen Salt to make Hot Ice and then selling it.

Production rate for most substances roughly doubled, having 4 settlements all producing substances can yield up to ~3,200 per day if making Di-hydrogen/Tritium/most gases (more than 2x what a single pre-Beacon PTSd settlement used to).
Production rates for crops/plants now more closely follow the pattern set by Hydroponic Trays, e.g. Frost Crystal grows faster than other crops, Solanium grows slower, Star Bulb has less yield, etc.
Reworked Settlement production rates & storage caps:

• The new "base" rate for all settlements is 1 product or 40 substances every ~2.4 hours. This works out to ~10 items or ~400 substances per day. The shorter production cycle time of ~2.4 hours means making settlement decisions, adding debt, etc. is much less disruptive to production since at most it can only reset up to ~2.4 hours worth of production time, instead of an entire day's worth. (NOTE: A Vanilla bug causes settlement production rates to become slightly slower as the settlement develops instead of becoming faster, so settlements with low population/happiness/productivity will actually produce items faster)
• By default settlements can store up to 3 day's worth of production before collecting (30 products or 1200 substances)

• However, various items are also adjusted individually across all types of settlements, such as crops/plants having lower production rate (and proportionally lower storage cap, to maintain a 3 day's worth stockpile), or Trade Goods having higher production rate / caps, etc.

• Gek settlements have 1.25x production speed for all items, but can only stockpile 0.6x as many items as other settlements (which works out to 1.5 day's worth of items at Gek rates). This makes them more productive overall if you play often and will visit your settlement every day or so to collect.

• Vy'keen settlements have 0.8x production speed for all items, but can stockpile 1.6x as many items as other settlements (which works out to 6 day's worth of items at Vy'keen rates). This makes them more productive overall if you don't play as often and will only visit your settlement once a week or so.
• Korvax & Autophage settlements use the "base" production rates & storage
In addition to their race-specific items and general rate/cap multipliers, each race is particularly skilled with a specific settlement building type:

• Gek settlements have 1.2x production speed and storage amount (on top of their rate & cap multipliers listed above) for items produced by "Commercial" buildings, ie Trade Goods (De-scented Bottles, Fusion Cores, etc.)

• Vy'keen settlements have 1.2x production speed and storage amount (on top of their rate & cap multipliers listed above) for items produced by "Agricultural" buildings, ie crops/plants (Faecium, Cactus Flesh, etc.)
• Korvax settlements have 1.2x production speed and storage amount for items produced by "Starport" buildings, ie fuels (Di-hydrogen, Tritium, etc.)
• Autophage settlements have 1.2x production speed and storage amount for items produced by "Industrial" buildings, ie crafting ingredients (Enriched Carbon, Semiconductor, etc.)
• This 1.2x rate & cap multiplier also applies to the race-specific item which can be produced from the start without any additional buildings (e.g. Platinum for Gek, Mordite for Vykeen, etc.)

Increased purchase price for Metal Plating, Carbon nanotubes, and Hermetic Seal by ~1.25x, decreased purchase price for Starshield Batteries to ~0.44x to bring them closer to the same ballpark as the cost of buying the substances used to craft them.
572.0.3: Corrected most settlement races accidentally having a storage cap for Frost Crystal 0.25x as big as intended

Marrow Bulb's production rate and storage cap in settlements reduced to 0.6x, but now only requires a Class B Agricultural building, while the 6 biome-specific crops (Frost Crystal, etc.) require a Class A Agricultural building instead
Kelp Sac's production rate and storage cap in settlements increased 1.2x
Settlement expedition failure rate increased to 15% since gaining population is now easier than pre-Beacon. Expedition description now lists the chance of failure.
Added note to the description of the Settlement Mission Log & Guide entry to list the strengths/weaknesses of the various races' settlements
573.0.1: Cooldown for all Settlement Tower abilities (Collect Navigation Data, Scan for nearby buildings, etc.) set to 20 hours instead of 24 hours
NOTE: There is an existing issue which causes the "Space Rescue" mission for rescuing a freighter from small pirate starships to sometimes disappear, I'm still working on a solution
575.0.1: Reduced the max distance from each other that certain ships during space pirate battles will spawn. Potentially, this may reduce how often the "Space Rescue" mission abruptly ends, for some users.
601.0.1: Most Corvette module bonuses not yet adjusted, will likely be unbalanced until I adjust the stats & prices after time to properly out how they interact (especially since PTSd allows 5x module bonuses of the same type)

Corvette base stats & handling roughly adjusted to be on the lower end of the ballpark for "regular" starships (before adding any bonuses from Corvette modules), but with much higher tech slots to hold all the module bonuses
Corvette bonus to Pulse Jump speed decreased from 3x to 1.33x
Solar Ships bonus to Pulse Jump speed increased from 1.2x to 1.5x
Removed Launcher auto-recharging effect from all Corvette modules which had that bonus

Certain functional interior parts for Corvettes (e.g. cargo racks / refiner / cooking / planter walls) now must be unlocked at the Anomaly under their corresponding "normal" versions, and/or require more ingredients to construct
Rewards from Corvette Missions via Mission Radar adjusted to match the equivalent Space Station / Nexus missions in PTSd
Corvette part droprate from Salvageable Scrap nodes greatly reduced, amount given as optional reward at end of Derelict Freighters slightly increased
602.0.1: Many adjustments to Corvette modules, both their bonuses/strengths and which "groups" of shared limit of 5 installed bonuses each belongs to. With several new debuffs tied to Corvette Cockpits, the main concept for Corvettes is now that they start off worse than standard starships in many respects, but can also get powerful bonuses from modules. However due to many bonuses coming from modules in shared "groups" with one another,  the player must choose between "spreading out" the bonuses across various stats to offset the initial Corvette debuffs as a "jack of all trades", or specializing and focusing on a few stats to make the Corvette as good or better than any standard ship in that respect, but worse off in other areas. (As in vanilla, if the player chooses a small Corvette with few modules to grant bonuses, the tradeoff is there will be more tech inventory room to install standard upgrade modules instead)

• Adjusted the strength of bonuses for Corvette modules and eliminated the randomness of the bonus strength. Now a particular type of Corvette module will always give the exact same strength of bonus when installed, and thus will match the strength shown in the Corvette editor. Specific values are still slightly WIP and likely to be adjusted

• Default Corvette launch cost increased 1.4x, meaning it cannot be summoned (unless it is currently hovering in atmosphere, which is always free) without additional landing gear / Azimuth Reactors, or launcher upgrades. However with enough landing gear / Azimuth Reactors, the cost can become extremely low, even below Explorers.

• Similarly, Default Corvette Pulse Jump fuel consumption rate increased 1.4x, Pulse Jump speed reduced to 0.8x, and Boost Speed reduced to 0.6x, but these can all be improved with appropriate Corvette modules / Reactors / standard upgrade modules to generally match or exceed a typical starship.

• Modules which add cargo slots (Habs & Walkways) now also slightly reduce Boost Speed and Maneuverability, since the vanilla mechanic for making larger Corvettes slower does not appear to be working currently. Like other Corvette module groups, this only applies to at most 5 installed modules.

• The 4 different Reactor modules for Corvettes are now in a single "reactor" module group, meaning you can only gain stat bonuses from 5 reactors total, instead of 5 of each type of reactor. This both reduces how many tech slots are taken up and allows the option to specialize Corvettes into different roles instead of always being jack-of-all-trades when maxed out. The choice of which combination of Reactor(s) to install should now have a big influence on the performance of the Corvette. (Can be reverted with the MergeCorvetteReactorGroups & MergeCorvetteWeaponGroups toggles in PTSd Starship Tech Changes.lua)

• Similarly, all Corvette weapon modules are now in a single "defensive systems" module group. This means you have the choice between having one extremely powerful weapon with the others being quite weak (due to the Corvette's low Damage bonus stat), or having 2 or 3 weapons which are each moderately powerful, allowing to swap against different defenses or when one is close to overheating, while still remaining strong.

• Changed & differentiated the bonuses for the different styles of Engines. Heavy Booster engines give mostly Boost Speed, Sublight Thrusters give mostly Pulse Jump speed, and Jets/Pyrodrive give mostly Maneuverability. This means the player must choose which stat to prioritize, as bonuses will only be granted by up to 5 engines.
• Similarly, the different landing gears give a different balance between Launch Cost, Boost Speed, and Pulse Jump fuel efficiency
• Decorative exterior Cargo Pods are now purely cosmetic and do not add cargo slots or take up tech slots

Corvette top speed in space increased to slightly above "Normal" weight (Shuttles), while top speed in atmosphere left at "Heavy" weight (Haulers), and base maneuverability in atmosphere slightly lowered.
Life support drain rate in space increased 2.5x
Pulse Jump fuel efficiency bonus from Engine upgrade modules for standard & Living Ships reduced in strength to 0.75x
Launch Cost discount bonus from Launcher upgrade modules for standard & Living Ships reduced in strength to 0.75x

Names/descriptions for PTSd-added items such as the Dissonant Compass should now display regardless of what language setting is used (the text will always be in English). Also added instructions at the top of "PTSd UI Description Adjustments.lua" on how to force PTSd edits to vanilla names/descriptions to display when using other language settings in order to see more accurate info or context & tips for PTSd (this will make edited names/descriptions display in English)
Fixed vanilla bug with Corvette Torpedo Launcher wrongly applying to Cyclotron Ballista instead of Rockets
Fixed mistakenly adding all Corvette modules to the list of buildable parts for bases / freighters in the previous PTSd update
Small adjustments to the base stats of Corvettes (upgrading the Class of a Corvette or building a new one will use the updated stats)

• Shield Generators are now also part of the same "group" as weapon modules, but also give added bonuses in different areas, like a mini-reactor. This allows you to choose to sacrifice offensive power by installing fewer weapon modules and using those "slots" to install a few shield generators instead to further boost other stats and defenses.
603.0.1: Corvette Weapon Modules now also come with a malus to Shield Strength
Reduced Corvette Cockpit's Pulse Jump fuel consumption malus from 1.4x to 1.3x, and Boost Speed malus from 0.6x to 0.8x
Small adjustments to various Corvette Module bonuses, especially for engine modules

Unlisted change from 602.0.1: Corvette base Pulse Jump Speed further lowered to match standard starships (but can achieve higher Pulse Jump speeds than even Solar ships with the right Corvette Modules)
603.0.2: Fixed error with text for PTSd-added items not displaying correctly
603.0.3: Rearranged placement of various Minotaur tech in the Exocraft unlock tree so it is no longer is so wide that it is cropped off the edges of the screen after the addition of the Sentinel Hardframe parts (only visible in Abandoned Mode)
Reduced unlock cost for Sentinel Hardframe parts in Abandoned Mode by ~0.5x
603.0.4: The temporary teleporters to return you to a Corvette from a planet's surface now cost 1 Navigation Data to "unlock" them for that specific location (can keep re-using the same temporary teleporter without paying additional Nav Data, but moving the Corvette to a new location will spawn a new temporary teleporter which will cost 1 Nav Data to "unlock"). So instead of never landing and getting around for free, the intended method in PTSd is to either land normally or spend 1 Nav Data to allow multiple teleport trips at a particular spot. Since teleporting down is always free, if you realize you have no Nav Data the Corvette can always be freely summoned down to the surface if it is currently hovering in atmosphere.

Unlisted change from previous PTSd version: Certain Corvette modules with special animations or particle effects (such as various landing gears) which only used to animate up to 4 modules, now will animate up to 6 modules (since PTSd incentivizes installing at least 5 of all the core modules)
Animation limit for Corvette Wing modules increased from 4 to 6 (e.g. spinning rotors, etc.)

• This can be toggled off with CovetteTeleportCost in "PTSd More Expensive Costs etc.lua" and recompiling with AMUMSS, or by simply deleting "No Man's Sky\GAMEDATA\MODS\PTSd Prices and Tech etc\MODELS\COMMON\SPACECRAFT\BIGGS\TELEPORTER\ENTITIES\TELEPORTER.ENTITY.MBIN"
603.0.5: Basic Corvette Parts purchased from the Corvette workshop on space stations can now also be used to trade for Advanced Corvette parts. (Due to how Bartering/Trading only uses a fraction of the value of the items you offer, if you need multiple Advanced parts it will generally be much more economical to search for some of the parts you need via loot instead of trading for everything)

Newly built Corvettes should start with more tech slots unlocked to better accommodate initial Corvette modules, and removed variation for initial slots. Now new Corvettes should always have a base of 9 cargo + 21 tech slots (before factoring in any module bonuses)
Increased Thunderbird Landing Thruster's discount to Launch Cost & Pulse Jump fuel consumption to ~1.9x
